-Couldn't update drivers without having to reinstall windows a couple times so I gave up on that. (-star for that headache)

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review Title: It works and can do high definition video.
Customer Review: I got this card to replace one that I have been using for 4 years. The motherboard is 2019 and the card that had been through 2 previous motherboards just stopped working the day after I ordered this one. So this card is up to date and high res. The drivers are easy to find and install (they do not come with the card) and up to date. After the drivers were installed I was able to set up 2 monitors with different res for each. The HDMI port is putting out 3k while the svga is putting out 1080. And the sound can also be set to use the speakers of the HDMI monitor. Mine is a 55" smart TV.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review Title: MSI has an excellent easy to install plug and play video card
Customer Review:
This video card is replacing an older MSI Geforce 460 Cyclone video card that has some horsepower when it was new but kept receiving display driver kernal errors and card would give me a balck screen. Inserted the new MSI card in the pci express slot and then it automatically installed video drivers and the new card works perfectly!
Mind you this is a band aid as my system was a custom build by me 7 years ago and looking to build another system. I ran a new Windows experience index and it dropped my score from a 7.3 to an overall 5.1. Gaming graphics dropped from a 7.6 to 6.7. I realize for $45.00 I'm not going run at 60 fps and I play most of games now on my PS4.
I really like MSI and the other card will probably still run if I update the drivers but I needed my desktop for work and the video capabilities are just fine for what I need.
For the person who lack pc skills this card is really a plug and play as long as you have the right slot in your motherboard.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review:
Bought a refurb PC off Amazon and I was hoping the onboard GPU (Intel/HP) would be enough for an 11 year old to adequately play Fortnite, but holy moly it was NOT. It's an SFF, so I didn't need much, and I definitely didn't want to spend anything more than $50-$60.

Fortnite runs super smooth after installing this bad boy, and although the graphics aren't super high, it's exactly what I wanted at the price I wanted it at.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review Title: Works perfectly in the Dell Optiplec 7010
Customer Review:
I bought the Dell Optiplex 7010 on amazon for what I thought was an amazing deal. As a college student pursuing degrees in video production and multimedia being able to run adobe products is paramount. However, after getting my computer all set up adobe kept alerting me to the fact there is an issue because I did not have a graphics card. After spending days looking for what I needed, mostly a 2gb low profile card with an hdmi port, I found this card. I did find it through another site but to my excitment it is less expensive on amazon. The card only took a couple days to arrive and once I changed out the brackets and got it popped into my CPU, I was off and running. I did have to use a driver booster program to locate my missing divers for the card but once that was all done adobe has been working perfectly. I've also see enhancments to my vido and gaming quality.

It's not too all that often that I write reviews and it's even less often when it's positive but I felt this product warrented the attention. Well done!

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review:
The card is good, but the company is ridiculous. For many years i use top buy many video cards for system i use to build in my business. Now they don't even include the drivers with the card. Talk about cheap. and BTW there are people who use a computer in a business and are not on the net. SO they can't even d/l the drivers. But not having the drivers with the card is more than aggravating because when you contact MSI they after 10 minutes of waiting send you to another URL:.
Although i love the cards, I am done with buying their products.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review: At under $40, the Nvidia GT 710 2GB does what you'd expect. Older games like Left 4 Dead 2 (Steam) and Counter-Strike Source (Steam) will run just fine at medium settings. Video resolution for movies can run at 1080p, though most look just fine at 720p. The low power consumption, low heat (fanless), and low-profile brackets make the GT 710 ideal for small form factor desktop PCs. Plays nice with Linux and the drivers can be found on Repositories in mere seconds, which it what I use it with. All-in-all the Nvidia GT 710 a pretty good low-ball GPU.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review: I received the box (opened) nothing in the box but one little metal plate and a small manual with an egg carton fitting... NO VIDEO CARD. Then I had to spend an hour and thirty-seven minutes trying to get the item replaced and find a QR code (that was not sent to me nor was it in my account anyplace that I had access to) to return the empty box.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review Title: Good performing video card for modest graphics use; low power requirements, too!
Customer Review: This card only draws about 18W of power, so was well-suited for my application, since my PC's power supply won't handle a bigger, more powerful card. No fan makes it absolutely silent, and it delivers solid performance that's a step up from my integrated Intel graphics. I do a lot of print publishing/graphics work, and some video - and this handles all those jobs just fine. Its 2GB of memory helps too. Probably not what you're looking for if you're into gaming, but it might give your older PC (or starter-level PC) some new life. Would buy again.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review: For an inexpensive graphics card, I was surprised at the quality and performance with no extra fiddling with color settings, contrast, etc...did nothing! Turned PC on and everything was beautiful! My previous Nvidia card that I paid extra for when I ordered this PC was constantly changing the color settings and conflicting with my online game color settings. So when the fan started squealing I decided to upgrade, this card was recommended by my computer repair store manager and I must admit I questioned the low price as not being a good choice, but he assured me it was a good card! So far I am very happy...EHG

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review: The card works well and speeds up my PC. The problem I have is my power supply is about a 240 watt and the card likes 300 watts. Some reviews I read said if your not running a i7 processor you'll be fine. I'm running a i5 and on rare times the video driver will reset and cause my screen to go black for 5 seconds. Everything comes back just fine. My power supply is a special one and designed only for this HP computer. It's not driving me crazy so I'll live with it. Don't do any gaming on this PC so I don't know how good it is that way.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review Title: Fan decibels increase over time: became unacceptable
Customer Review: If it weren't for the loud cooling fan, I would have given this card 4 or 5 stars. My PC is used for routine office work. I attempted to adjust the loud fan using the MSI Afterburner software, adjusting the fan directly and redefining the parameters of the temp/fan speed curve but to no avail. I also cleaned the fan with compressed air and a cotton tipped swab but again, no reduction in decibels. Disconnecting the fan eliminated the problem but the card temperature started rising precipitously. I eventually pulled the card and replaced with a Zotac which employs passive cooling.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review: Took a 10 year old Acer from not being able to render any detail and severe lag to smooth game play and better detail in graphics. Mind you this isn't going to be 4k quality but if you have an older desktop and don't want to pour money into something you only use a couple hours a day to play some mild graphics games. Then I recommend to get this.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review Title: Used older GPUs can have much better price/performance than a bottom of the barrel new one like this
Customer Review:
This is a cheap video card and performs accordingly. I realized afterwards that something like used GTX750i is way (WAY!) more powerful, has much better support in the gaming community, so ended up buying a 750 for the same price for my child instead.

I’m actually not sure what is the use case for this kind of a card. Either you have an old machine and you’d be the kind of person that would be able to accept better a used decent GPU, or you have a newer yet lower end machine that nonetheless is likely to have better integrated graphics. The price/performance ratio for this card is terrible but I’m sure someone has a niche use case for it. It works, slowly, but that’s it.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review:
I got this for my work computer to allow me to use two monitors. But after installing it, I was impressed with the performance. Running software graphic intensive software like Adobe Illustrator, Adobe InDesign, and Adobe Photoshop was a lot smoother and faster.

My video editing was also improved.

The GPU is super silent. Can't hear a thing. I put mine in an HP Slim case, so I used the low profile adapter that came with it. And even being in a small confined space, it was very cool and never overheated!

Excellent product. I would definitely recommend it to anyone.

BTW...I also may have done a little light gaming with it...don't tell my boss... ;)

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review Title: Easiest graphics upgrade you’ll ever do for dirt cheap.
Customer Review:
This was plug and play in a refurb HP desktop, proprietary MoBo, PSU, and W/ i5 chip plus 16GB of generic RAM.
You can play some older games but more importantly, you can max out resolution on a good monitor and there was zero requirement to download or CD install a driver (weird....) as long as you are online.
On a generic Acer 21” monitor the board dialed in on its own and the screen came alive. For the price point, you can’t beat a PCIE addition GPU @ 2GB VRAM over a system with native / integrated graphics.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review Title: Low power requirement, fits small form factor case.
Customer Review: Bought this to try and make my Lite0n internal bluray player work with old Foxconn LGA775 motherboard. Very satisfied. Works very well. Does not use much power. Less than 50 watts. Does not produce much heat. Makes no noise at all. Does not have fan. Works great for graphics on my Flight Sim programs. Not really for high speed games, of course, but will work. Looks good on my 32" monitor. I highly recommend for someone trying to rejuvenate an older Small Form Factor computer. VERY cheap! Did I say VERY cheap, oh yeah.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review: Never had such a bad experience trying to set up anything ever. The msi.com website is amazingly slow and written in the worst english ever. I must have gone through 2 dozen CAPTCHA's. Then to register your card, you need to read a 3 digit code off the card, but they don't tell you this until after you've installed it. They expect you to rip your PC open again. Then once you fight your way through to the driver updates, they send you over to nvidia.com to download a utility, which takes FOREVER to install and THEN IT MAKES YOU REGISTER AGAIN WITH NVIDIA. And now my browswer is running slow as s**t and there is a box that keep popping up in my system tray every five minutes asking me if i want to scan for updates. WHAT A BUNCH OF UNPROFESSIONAL JERKS!! DO NOT BUY FROM NVIDIA or MSI THEY ARE AWFUL!!!

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review:
I bought this card to support dual Acer 22inch monitors. The first bad was that it only supported full 1980 x 1080 on the HDMI port and only supported 1920 x 1050 on the DVI port. I was willing to live with that.
Today, only 18 months after installation, the DVI port refuses to display anything. Having two identical monitors makes it easy to swap the cables back and forth to confirm. I've reseated it, unplugged them both, reboot and cold booted multiple times. I even downloaded the latest drivers from the NVidia site. All for nothing.
I guess you get what you pay for with old tech.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review Title: Simple straightforward installation, and sped up web browsing and simple on-line games at 1920x1080 on an old Dell computer.
Customer Review:
Opened the box, replaced the standard bracket with the LP brackets, shut down the computer (Dell Optiplex 960 8 GB RAM, Win-10), installed the card into the computer's PCIx16 slot, moved the DVI connector to the GT-170 and powered up the computer = video came up in VGA mode. Went to the NVIDIA drivers page, and downloaded and installed the latest driver = video display automatically changed to 1920 x 1080. Rebooted the machine = worked perfectly.

Web pages definitely render faster now, and my 7-year old's Roblox (on-line video game) runs smoothly now (which was the main purpose for the video card upgrade).

The card worked perfectly for me (sped up the video on a old computer in a low-profile, low-power package). The Optiplex still isn't a heavy-duty "gaming machine", but perfect for what I needed.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review Title: Great video card, but no driver CD. Wasted 3 hours. Super slow download.
Customer Review:
Video card - very good for the money.
First order - Did not come with low-profile connectors adapter(s) for HDMI+DVI and VGA. Returned.
Second order - Did not come with driver CD.

Nvidia driver download site was super slow. I don't know why they make it difficult to find a darn simple
Windows 10 driver. Had to download 500+ GB worth of crap which took forever. This is what happens when you don't have a competition.

Parts - 5 stars.
Everything else - 1 star.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review Title: no good- black screen crashes frequently
Customer Review: frequently has black screen crashes - "you see a message with the description “Display driver nvlddmkm stopped responding and has successfully recovered” but the problem doesn’t seem to go away as it keeps on coming back. - hundreds of online complaints about this - NONE of the suggested solutions work - not even using the latest driver from nVidea - it is junk - the last solution is "buy a different gpu card" - oh. goody!

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review: Have this card installed into an 9 year old HP I7 tower that was upgraded to Windows 10 Pro running Two monitors. So far so good. I don't do much on or off-line gaming but do some wed admin and picture rework. This card was the answer to having to reboot my system sometime two and three time while working on graphic project with this old tower. It breathed new life into a capable tho old tower. Maybe I'll get another 10 years out of it. For the Price and function I would recommend

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review: If you have ever worked on a computer with multiple monitors then you know how difficult it is to go back to using only one monitor. This graphics card allows me to once again use 2 monitors and I could not be happier. I have only had this card for a few months but as far as I'm concerned this thing is tip top and highly recommended. I am not a gamer so I can't speak accurately on that part but if you're a multi-tasker looking to get more done or someone who wants to live stream video in one monitor while reading your script off the other monitor then this graphics card is for you.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review Title: Not a serious gaming card, but solves green Windows 10 videos!
Customer Review:
If you're looking for a serious gaming upgrade, this isn't it. You need to spend more money, and you need a card that requires external power.

However, if you've recently had an inexpensive card fail, and you dropped back to onboard graphics to discover that a lot of your video files are green (with no image) in Windows 10 with no recovery, then this is great. It was easy to put in, the drivers installed automatically, and I'm cooking again while I save a few more months for my next desktop.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review:
For about $40, this GT 710 graphics card is leaps and bounds over the integrated graphics on an refurbed business class PC I recently purchased. My PC is a SFF (small form factor) desktop so I needed the low profile card. For moderate to low level gaming (Fortnite, Minecraft), this card is perfectly fine. I did not need to upgrade the power supply for this card to function. The heat sink means it runs silently and with a SSD, the PC hardly makes a sound while it's running.

I had to use the low profile bracket so the VGA port requires a second external slot in the back of the case, but that wasn't a problem since I have no other cards installed. It took a firm and steady press to get the card into the PCI x16 slot. Just make sure you're pressing the card straight down, not at an angle, and it will click into place.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review Title: The quality! Top notch! I play Sims 2-4 no problems whatsoever on a low profile machine!
Customer Review:
I have a low profile dell that I got off amazon refurbished. I installed this graphics card and oh my goodness it is absolutely amazing. I use this computer for Photoshop, my Etsy store, and my Sims game. I also do a lot of streaming on this computer. I've had zero problems. I absolutely love this graphics card.

My only issue and the reason for 4 stars is that it comes installed with the regular adapter. You better have a good screwdriver or pliers handy because will have to switch it from this to the low profile adapter.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review Title: A Very Nice Video Card for General Use
Customer Review: I bought this card to replace an integrated video unit in my Lenovo desktop computer. That unit was failing and only displaying bits and pieces of video display on my screen. The new MSI GeForce GT710 installed very easily and the downloaded software was easy to set up to my desired preference. It installed quickly and without a glitch. I am not a heavy gamer so can't comment on the extent of this card's performance, but for general video performance it works perfectly and is well worth the $39 I spent at Amazon.com. I highly recommend it for anyone needed a general use video card although I don't know its full gaming potential.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review: Easy to install, great bargain for intro to gaming PCs. I'm not an actual PC gamer, but I do develop games in Unreal Engine and GameGuru. This made it possible to use both at a low price. It's not perfect, but for the price the graphics are pretty awesome. It came with a low profile bracket. My only problem is that I didn't have a pair of needle nose pliers to unscrew the regular bracket that came on it, but no problem I just borrowed somebody else's pliers.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review: This is a great graphics card for a low noise, low power HTPC. I am using it with an older 1.8 ghz processor. The setup plays 1080p video flawlessly all day and the card never gets over 40 degrees and makes no noise. If you watch 4k you might want something a little better like a gt 1030 but for 1080p video this card works great. This card saved my old pc and made it useful again. This is not a gaming graphics card (except very old games) but video gamers already know that.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review:
One of the first things this wants you to do upon installation (which is really quite simple) is install the management software. It will then proceed to tell you that "this device is not compatible with the latest version" or something to that effect.

It works just fine, especially if you're just looking for non-pro level gaming and graphics. A decent introduction level product.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review Title: Runs windows. I chose it for low cost; for gaming there are lots of newer more powerful cards.
Customer Review: Good for my needs. Installed no problem and running for a day with gigabyte aorus motherboard /AMD-2600 cpu. It is relatively Old tech & low-end for 2019 gaming benchmarks but it works for my general computing and is reasonable heat/power and good value if you aren’t looking for leading edge gaming tech.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review: This product is suppose to have (according to the box) a 10 year warranty. there is no address or site provided for this. I tried to contact the manufacturer and it is like getting danced in a circle. I finally got a promising lead and sent a message. some weeks later i got a message on my phone and was given a number to call except the number was nfg. Amazon wanted to pro rate my return. This card changes aspect at will. sometimes so bad i have to sign off. Usually this brand is rock solid.. but nothing is full proof.. Just based on the difficulty of getting warranty info and help i wont be buying this brand again.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review: This is a great economical video card for folks who don't need the latest and greatest game card. I never play the super intense games that put significant pressure on the video card so this baby fits my needs perfectly. Since I was replacing an earlier nVidia card I simply removed the old and popped in the new all without uninstalling the drivers. Fired right up, recognized the new card, and adjusted itself, all without a hitch. Gotta love it when it goes that easy.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review:
I haven't been able to make it work in my Lenovo M91P. It doesn't recognize the card in the PCIe slot. Not sure if it's a BIOS issue or there's something wrong with the expansion slot in my computer. When installed, this card disables the on board graphics controller and no signal sent to monitor. Don't have time now to trouble shoot the problem.

This MSI card is PCIe V2.0. Have to check whether the slot in the Lenovo M91P is V1.0 or 2.0. May have compatibility issue.

The supplied DVD with drivers on it doesn't work. Corrupted. Placed it into my laptop's DVD drive and it could not be read also. Drivers can be downloaded from MSI's website.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review: Had no problem installing the board itself, the drivers where another story . Took some finagling and several tries to get the new PC to eat up the new drivers. Once they were in and updated things went smooth . Wow what a difference in the video totally awesome an worth the small trouble of getting it to work. There's one other point to make about this board . It comes with two ends that must be used with small form PCs . Simply unscrew the original end , and one end goes to the HDMI and DVI .The other end goes on the VGA as a separate unit in the back of the PC.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review:
This card is garbage. Honestly, do not waste your money/time. I bought this thinking an independent graphics card would be an improvement to my daughter’s computer. IT WAS NOT. She has an A10 processor (2013). I maxed the ram, installed SSD and wanted a light duty graphics card to take load off the GPU.
Man was I wrong. Not only did this perform terribly but it dropped graphics frames per second in half. I tried two different drivers, neither made a difference. I used DDU to remove old display drivers first and install new ones to be sure there were no issues

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review: I have a dual HDMI monitor and DVI monitor setup that went white screen. My 9 year old 500 MB Saphire ATI Radeon video card finally died. This MSI was a perfect replacement. I did have to download the driver for my Windows 64 bit OS from the MSI website for this exact card, MSI GT 710 2GD3 LP (labeled on card itself), as per their included instructions for install. Both monitors came up perfectly after installing the driver and rebooting.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review Title: Reviving an old I5 for Win 10 with video upgrade
Customer Review: I bought this because I was having glitching buzzing issues with an 8GB I5-2400 Win 10 Pro 64 bit system using the onboard video. I suspected that the onboard video was overtaxing the processor. After installing this 1GB video card, the issue is resolved. I don't game, so I can't comment on it's suitability for that but I would think that you need a higher end GPU for that application but for general use, this card is more than sufficient and it doesn't use enough power to cause issues with a low wattage power supply.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review: Put in a motherboard that was previously running a 1070ti just fine and suddenly the PC reboots immediately after OS logo appears. Even with a rescue USB , reboot immediately after selecting to boot. Swapped in a really old 460 and it boots just fine. Built computers for over 10 years and never seen anything like it.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review Title: Probably not for gamers but otherwise great cards with HDMI audio
Customer Review:
This is an older model card and I have been using them for years. They work fine they are quiet and unlike most cards you don't have to replace them in a year or 2 when the fan wears out. Best of all they don't pester you every 3 days with driver updates that want to ad some unwanted junk software to your computer. They do support HDMI audio but enabling it may disable all other audio outputs as it is with most HDMI audio. I am not a gamer but when I built my daughters (who are gamers) machines with these cards they did not care for them.

About six moths later and it's crashing regularly. I'm guessing some MS update didn't care for it.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review Title: Worked perfect for an additional 3 video outputs.
Customer Review: For additional video outputs (third screen at office). As a computer hardware novice, this got the job done. The size was too big for the box, which was solved by cutting the metal and tucking the VGA output back. Besides the size thing (my fault) it worked great. Plugged it in, installed the driver off the CD, restarted, and it came right up as desired. Can’t complain for the price. Worth it IMO, as the alternatives ($20 less) were hdmi splitters that promised at best 800x600, and I was not willing to sacrifice the picture quality. Anyway I have no idea about gaming, but for additional video outputs, this worked perfectly.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review: I'm not a big gamer, so I don't need major power, but the games I play was taxing the onboard video of my PC. My major concern was that the power supply of my computer was limited and the computer was designed to resist any possible upgrade other than a ram option, so I needed an independent video option that didn't use much power, this card definitely fits the bill. Install was easy and didn't require any special configuration for Windows 10.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review:
Runs League of Legends on 1920×1080 P with ease with a 2 monitor setup. I would heavily reccomend this product if it is renewed or been used in good condition. If you are a light gamer this card is for you. However, for those of you guys who are running high graphic intensive on steam I would not reccomend if you are trying to achieve higher than 1080x720P. I know if you get two of two of these cards you could run sli with no bridge gap but it takes a lot of work to get it working. I would reccomend you look for a 4GB to 6GB VRAM GPU rather than buying this card.

If all you need is a simple GPU then the 2gb MSI GPU is probably the best budget GPU and bang for the dollar for games that only require less than 2gb of VRAM at high specs.

Requirements:

* It does not require any 4 pin or 8 pin slot.
* Minimum power required is 300 watts.
* PCIE 16X Needs to be available.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review Title: All I had to do was plug it in, and it worked perfectly as soon as I booted the computer!
Customer Review: This was to replace a VGA port separated from the motherboard on an HP Pavilion Desktop. I was so relieved when all I had to do was plug it in to the motherboard, and it worked perfectly, with a video quality that was better than the original NVIDIA GeForce that came with the system. The extra DVI and HDMI ports are an added bonus. I was worried that I would somehow need to adjust the BIOS settings without a display, but this card worked perfectly as soon as I booted the computer.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review: This card is great for a new build just to get you started, I paired this with a ryzen 5 1500x and runs smooth. Games that i played that run with no stutter: Rocket League gives me 45-60 fps with Performance settings + shaders. Closers 60 FPS, Paladins 120 fps on Medium settings on max detail everything 60-70 , and overwatch as well render scale 100 and medium settings 60-65 fps lowest ive gotten 45 fps.I have run this card for 5 hours straight and no signs of Overheating.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review Title: Dell Vostro 3670. Can be set up for normal or low profile use
Customer Review:
Great to get the video out of a dedicated card. Desktop business use in Dell vostro 3670.
Low profile or normal profile brackets included, It is not Low Profile only.
Not on a gaming rig, Dual monitors for desktop use in my small business.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review:
Bought "used" from Amazon, works great. No CD but just downloaded the software, with Nvidia it's easy.
For a 7 camera security computer. Takes the load off the CPU and that's all I need it for. Makes exporting faster too.

With a Mini-DTX motherboard, and the x16 on the edge, it could only fit a single slot card and it had to be short, as right at the end of the GPU there are capacitors, this fit.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review Title: Excellent card, easy installation, no PSU upgrade needed.
Customer Review:
Great little card. Install was a breeze and it fired right up on my Gateway sx2308. This is a low profile tower so I was very pleased that this card actually fits. I was also able to do this without a power supply upgrade (220 stock)

I only bought this to up my performance a bit, knowing it would not be a gaming card for the price, however to my surprised I can launch and play a steam game which I had bought and was unable to get past the title screen with my prior card. For the price I'm very happy.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review Title: Unable to review due to the following. Now a review
Customer Review:
1) For a computer with a 300 watt power supply.
2) requires a mini-HDMI cable.

I didn't see any mention of either of those two in the description/specifications.

A poster on the Acer company forums suggested this card for my Acer XC-704g desktop.

While it physically fits, I didn't turn on the computer while it was in there, the power supply is too weak. Increasing the power supply wont work as this computer is really a laptop motherboard in a small factor form case.

edit: I tried it with power on and the case open so I could see if the fan came on. Only the cpu fan started up. No video. There was no flickering on the screen suggesting it might be trying to work. I tried the mini-hdmi on the card's port. Shut down the computer and then tried the hdmi cable on the computer's hdmi port.

Still no video. Only the cpu fan started up. I'll keep the card as I found a newer desktop computer with a 300 watt psu and will try the card in it. But this desktop purchase wont be until later in the year.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review: Thanks to Disney I needed a HDMI graphics card (I thought) to watch ESPN on fubotv. I first tried a Radeon and crashed my poor Dell 3668 with 240 watt power supply. So I tried this because other reviews said it did not require the 300 watts listed. It works fine for me. However still no ESPN as either my cable or monitor, or both, are not HDCP 2.2 compliant. What a wonderful world of technology and profits.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review:
Problem #1.
After installation of hardware and software anytime my HP desktop went into sleep mode the PC would crash (blue screen). Google my butt off trying to troubleshoot but nothing. My work-around is to not let it go into sleep mode.

Problem #2.
Seven months after installation the fan failed.

I would not buy this video card again.
For reference this is the card I purchased: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce GT 710 2GB GDRR3 64-bit HDCP Support DirectX 12 OpenGL 4.5 Single Fan Low Profile Graphics Card (GT 710 2GD3 LP)
Customer Review Title: Not as good as the on-board GPU
Customer Review: I have an HP low profile desktop that I use for my TV; mostly for Netflix, YouTube, browsing the internet, etc. From time to time I play games from Steam and thought a dedicated GPU would speed things up a bit. I was wrong. The on-board Intel GPU runs faster than this card despite having less RAM and processing power. Also, after installing this card, my PC just seemed to run a little sluggish. I can't recommend this card for gaming.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review: I didn't have a lot of money to spare but needed a new graphics card. Looking at various sites I found this card on amazon. Its made by a well known company, had great reviews and was well within my price range. The card didn't disappoint. It was easy to install (granted I have been building computers for 25 years), I did install the drivers from the website like others recommended, and installed MSI afterburner and kombuster for the overclocking. With factory defaults I was able to play some high graphics games that wouldn't play before and some others that played sluggish now run at higher setting and much faster than before. I am a video creator and streamer and this has helped me to up my game without having to take out a loan to upgrade. the pic is what my computer rand high graphics games before the graphics card.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Good Quality, Very Quiet, Great For Medium End Gaming.
Customer Review:
Anyone looking to game with this card because they're on a budget this is what you can expect.

My Setup
-Win10
-AMD FX 4300 - 3.80GHz
-8G RAM
-GeForce GT 1030

Games/Settings/FPS

Borderlands 2 - Max Settings - 60-75fps
WarThunder - Max Settings - 65-75fps
DarkSouls 3 - Max Settings - 60-75fps
Fallout 4 - Med/low Settings - 45-60fps
Star Wars Battlefront - Med Setting - 55-60fps
Paladins - Max Setting - Solid 75fps

-Note this this is based on my setup + I have fully optimized my system for gaming and did a full defrag before benchmarking or testing any of these games. The card has not been tested on any of these games in OC Mode just Gaming Mode.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review: My 8 yr old pc is certainly overdue to be replaced but it does what I need it to do. My only issue was that the video card fan was dying so it was either build a new pc or replace the video card and squeeze out a bit more from this relic. Of course with the GPU market being overpriced due to data mining it took me a while to figure out how much performance I was willing to pay for at this time, with maybe an eye towards this being used in a new pc build over the next year. Fortunately the extra research this required allowed me to stumble upon an issue I didn’t know I had. That issue is that a few years ago PC BIOS was replaced by UEFI and the latest video cards won’t even boot on what is referred to as ‘legacy’ bios. After some research I found that this 1030 card is one of the most recent cards which will boot with legacy bios and is why I selected it. It was also only around 70 bucks which made this an easy choice. It installed easily, I pulled down drivers from Nvidia, and all is well. This card was theoretically 50% faster than the card it was replacing but when I ran new benchmarks it only reflected a few percentage points in some tests and better in others. There are other bottlenecks on this old system so I’m not surprised but since I can’t install anything newer than this model, and my old card was dying, I’m still happy with this purchase.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Great card for casual to medium gaming
Customer Review: Great graphics card for casual to medium gaming. Runs Rocket League, CSGO, the 2011 version of Skyrim, and Fallout:NV at high/ultra settings in 1920x1080 at well over 60 fps. Also runs Fortnite at medium-high settings in 1920x1080 at around 50-60fps. Can run pretty much any non AAA title, as well as most AAA titles released before 2015/16 at decent settings (depending on your CPU and RAM, of course). It is very easy to install, just pop it into your PCI-e 16 slot on your motherboard, as it only requires 30W of power. It can fit into most medium to large sized cases (the actual dimensions of the card are 4.38in x 6.6in x 1.1in for WxLxH, not what it says on the Amazon page). It is also very quiet, even when it is running games. Overall, if you are looking to upgrade your system without spending over $100 and still getting solid performance for its price point, I highly recommend it.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Purchased this card to add 4K capability to my HTPC ...
Customer Review: Purchased this card to add 4K capability to my HTPC. I don't do any gaming on the PC, so I didn't need anything too special.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review:
I received my GT 1030 OC from Amazon Warehouse Deals (AWD) today and promptly installed it in my 11 year old HP Pavilion Elite M9200t [Intel Core2 Quad CPU Q9450 @ 2.66 GHz 2.67 Ghz, 8GB RAM, Win10 64 bit, PCIe 2.0}...piece of cake, and backward compatible with PCIe 2.0.

As other reviewers suggested, I didn't bother with the enclosed CD-I went to the Gigabyte website to install the latest drivers & the Aorus Engine, mainly to monitor the temperature due to past video card overheating experience (no gaming).

I'm replacing a seven year old EVGA GT 520 card that's been recently having a problem with the fan- it stops turning at inappropriate times and overheats (I used canned air & a vacuum a few times in the last two months to get out any dust particles that might be unseen, which helps for awhile ).

Last week, I tried an open-box Gigabyte GT 1030 silent low-profile (from AWD), but within minutes, it seemed to be running quite hot, despite multiple fans in my PC, so much so that it did sudden re-boots of my PC several times. It also had such a tall heatsink that it was smashing the firewire plug on my motherboard. Not sure if that had anything to do with the hot temp & multiple re-boots. I had to send it back. My power supply is a 385W that isn't maxed out so it's not that.

This GT 1030 SC isn't as tall as the fan-less GT 1030, so it's well below the firewire plug and has been running fine without any re-booting issues. The temp has stayed around 37°(C) with standard PC use (no gaming, just watching videos, web surfing, MS Office, etc).

So far, this card seems like the perfect replacement for an old PC like mine or newer machine.

NOT reflected in my review rating is that I went with AWD to save a few dollars over a new item. I'm not opposed to an open-box product if it works as it should. I'll admit, I was initially concerned about the condition of the card when I saw the box's condition, but the card seems to function fine. AWD's description of the item was accurate. Everything is running great! :o)

UPDATE April 25, 2019: Three months later, this card is still working great on my 11 year old HP Pavilion Elite M9200t (no "gaming", just Microsoft Office 2016, graphics/photo editing, some video editing, Internet, machine embroidery digitizing & designing, etc.)

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review: Best bang for buck graphics card around, especially for those with smaller power supplies. Works great with a 300-watt supply. No extra 4 or 6 pin connector necessary.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Broken before a year is up
Customer Review: The card ran fine initially and graphics are great. However, recently I connected a second monitor using its DVI output. It ran well for a couple weeks then out of the blue my second monitor just refuses to wake up. I tried a different monitor and a different DVI cable, still no luck. Reinstall drivers, roll back windows updates and all to no avail. Contacted Nvidia and windows support who guided me step by step and problem still cannot be resolved. Windows could not detect my second monitor anymore. My main monitor worked fine still (HDMI). Overall disappointed. Now, I have a partially working card with an idle second monitor... yes, first world issue but still I'm pissed.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review:
I'm a top tier geek who's on the budget for computing, I had an ATI card die and couldnt play any of the Batman games I owned so I wanted Nvidia. I'm really impressed with this card it does far better than you'd expect I have all my games on Maximum and tho it stutters once in a while its because its not supposed to run at those specs but this little thing is a work horse and it goes all out for you.
Played with DOOM, MGS V, and Far Cry 5 at Max Settings.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: The best card for less money
Customer Review: I bought this card by mistake for my Dell optiplex 9010 and it also works for such good performance that I decided not to return it and leave the case without a cover, I did not expect such good performance, in most mid-range games, I recommend this card you will not regret , they will not have to change power supply and consumption is minimal ... good ventilation.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review: It’s a high/low end video card. It’ll do 4K video no problem, even on a 1080p tv. Gaming is moderate. Most highend games will play well at medium settings. But since I’m not a consistent gamer it’s not a problem. Recommend a cpu of intel i5 or higher. Or a Ryzen 3 thru 5. Ryzen 7 will bottleneck it’s performance with this card though. (GPU)

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review: I bought this to replace a GeForce GTX 750 TI 2gb which I'm migrating to my backup system. Installed and got beautiful color crisp and sharp images with Windows 10 drivers. Installed drivers from disc and image was washed out and blurry. I uninstalled all drivers and got great image with Windows 10 drivers again. Downloaded latest drivers from device website and installed them. Image became washed out and blurry. Spent many unsuccessful hours researching a fix and trying every tweak I could find. Good with Windows drivers. Washed out and blurry with device drivers. So frustrating to have to work so hard to find a way to make a brand new device work properly. Manufacturer should be aware of this problem because of the number of people reporting the same experience online over several years span. Shame on you Nvidia.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: I don't understand stats, I'm just a user who wants my desktop to function as a mid range PC should
Customer Review: I bought this GPU after doing hours of research. I had less than $100 to put into a PC that I had invested $127 into in hopes of reaching an FPS average that would allow me to play online racing and flying simulators without the latency that would hinder my ability to be competitive or cause grief to those playing on the same server due to my inconsistency in the game's sync. I bought an older Dell Optiplex 790 retired workstation PC from the FB marketplace for $100 that came with an Intel I7 CPU, 8GB RAM, DVD-RW, front multi card reader, 1GB GPU, and 300w PwrSply, but no wi-fi card, input devices, display or cords. I had a small junk pile of old keyboards, mice, cables, etc due to being very low income because of decisions made 25yrs earlier. Anyways, I get a lot of use from repairing broken things as well as giving new life to older items in which people have lost interest or have upgraded from. I found this and pulled the trigger with the order. While waiting on its arrival I installed 4GB of RAM for $23 to give me 12GB RAM. I also downloaded iRacing, War Thunder, Project Cars 2, and a lower level MS store flight sim in anticipation. With the original 1GB GPU, iRacing would run at 70FPS at the lowest settings which isn't suitable for dirt racing as dynamic HDR graphics are required to compete at any level. War Thunder wouldn't run at all on minimum settings without consistent tearing and lockups. Project Cars 2 would run barely on min while the low min req need flight sim would run but was full of lag with settings higher than midrange. After I installed and properly set up the drivers and config of the GeForce GT 1030 2GB I decided I had no idea what I was doing when reading stats. This GPU runs all the above games on at least medium settings without any lag or graphic degradation during play. I can run iRacing on their recommended cap of 84FPS with most graphical "extras" and aids on high while running car and track textures on ultra-high. I also use med resolution shadows, reflections, dynamic tire and track, and pit crews. I am amazed that I have a PC that I have less than $250USD invested yet it performs as well, if not better than most $500-$1100 "gaming PCs" sold in department stores. I have used this PC with GeForce 1030 2GB GPU for a while now without unwanted issues. I am so pleased I have built a custom sim racing cockpit, FFB competition-level racing wheel and pedals, flight stick(HOTAS), soundbar w subwoofer, BlueTooth and WiFi dongles, and a wireless mouse. I now have a decent gaming setup that I use for sim car, truck, FPV drone racing/flying as well as shooter games, streaming, mild video editing, web surfing, watching movies and bragging to those that spent 5X more for the same level of usefulness. my recommendations? Buy the damn card if you have a decent CPU, power supply, and amount of RAM if you want a mid-level gaming machine that doesn't cost more than it realistically should. You get what you pay for and a lot of times we often pay a lot of money to get ripped off on good products.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Not for heavy gaming but fine for light gaming, rendering, etc.
Customer Review:
I am at a time in my life when I have more work than time most days and that doesn't leave a lot of time for gaming. That being said, I do use 3D applications like Blender in my work and occasionally I will sit down for a short gaming session. The computer I have came with Integrated Intel UHD Graphics which is not bad for basic tasks but would fall short on things like rendering graphics, modern games, etc.

I picked up this card because it seemed like a reasonable trade-off between price point and performance. My Blender projects render well with this card, but I am doing small scene renders not making a movie or anything like that. I have played a couple of games, Arma, 7 Days to Die, etc and the games played smoothly with no noticeable lag.

The card was easy to install and neither Windows 10 or Linux (Mint and Manjaro) have had any issues recognizing the card and installing the correct driver. The card is running at a comfortable 35° C right now even though I have a bunch of programs running as well as my browser.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review:
Needed a replacement video card, and opted for this one. Play mostly EveryQuest II and Guild Wars 2. And this card does amazingly well for those, although have to lower some settings.

Lately though, after about 3 months, have had desktop glitches with Firefox and some videos. Had a few black screens the eventually came back to life, have backed-out boxes in menus or forums, and small glitchy areas from time to time. Not had these issues when gaming. Guessing it is a heat related issue and I needed to ramp up the fan speed from my Nvidia motherboard.

Gaming wise though, anything past 4 hours and the card needs a break, Things tend to not be as vibrant. So take a break and turn the game off for a while, then go back at it when the card cools down more.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review:
No big issues on install. Physical install was easy. PC booted in 480 x 320 VGA mode (eek) Driver install off CD froze up, but system found them on a reboot. Audio on my 2012 Dell XPS7100 got switched to the NVIDIA digital. Took a little thinking to get my antique Realtek analog sound working again.

Overall, it brought my WIndows Experience rating for graphics up to 7.5 from 4.9. Not that I use graphics. Great.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review:
I was running a Nvidia GeForce that was crisp and clean with a very nice picture, but in order to play a few new games I bought I had to replace it with an updated graphics card to get the Direct X 11 or higher This one sounded like it had a lot of Bang for the buck but it was a big disappointment . I ran the set up on the CD and it took forever to down load the drivers,, once that was done it took forever to install the drivers . Lastly, none of the drivers worked! I can’t even open the AORYS ENGINE to adjust my desk top settings. Right now it looks like the color is in 8bit mode that looks terrible being all washed out and to true color. Too bad I waited a month to open the box , now I am stuck with this pos , I would have been better off driving down the road throwing my money out the window.

Update: before I pulled the card back out and started over - I decided to download the drivers straight from NVIDIA web site and ran the EXE - only then I was able to open the display settings Though their software and after sever attempts I was able to adjust my display setting to a tolerable view. Hence , stay away from the CD drivers. It was a mess....... and It may have even added Malware to my computer system that I am unaware of..

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review:
This card is excellent if you simply want to bring 4k resolution and HDR to Windows 10. I dont play PC games so I wasn't workied about getting a top of the line graphics card... I wish I would have spent a little more money to get a slightly better card tho.

Watching and streaming video in any resolution goes from being super smooth to choppy for a few seconds and then back again. This is especially apparent when watching 4k and HDR content. Many times playback will speed up to "catch up" after it's choppy phase.

This card is a great choice of you simply want to bring 4k resolution to an older PC. However, it can't back up its claim to provide "smooth 4k video playback". If you're look for video performance - spend a little more on a better card.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: A fantastic choice for the average PC gamer on a budget.
Customer Review:
I do a good amount of PC gaming, but I don't play the latest AAA games on it. Instead I mostly play older titles and indie stuff that isn't super demanding. I recently got a refurbished PC for cheap and the onboard graphics card was so bad that it couldn't run games that the five-year-old budget computer it was replacing COULD run. Forced to upgrade it, I decided on this card, as at the time it appeared to be the best ratio of price to quality. The ultra-powerful cards were out of my budget, and the ones cheaper than this seemed like they wouldn't be enough of an upgrade to bother.

Getting the thing installed took a while, but I did eventually manage it on my own, and it was my first time ever installing a graphics card. I also got myself an upgraded power supply while I was at it and installed that, too, just to be sure my PC could handle the new card. Once it was installed, getting all the drivers and such on board took even longer, but eventually I was good to go. The result was everything I could have hoped for - my PC now plays every game I throw at it without issue, and it even runs more quietly than before.

As long as you aren't demanding the biggest, newest games on the highest settings, this card should be perfectly suitable for your needs if you're finding yourself with too many games in your collection that refuse to boot due to an inadequate graphics card.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review:
I'm re-purposing my older i7 workstation to a combination HTPC and NAS. I don't game and I don't need a big, powerful and expensive graphics card. I was mainly looking for a decent card with 4K and multichannel audio pass through.

My research led me to this card. It arrived yesterday and I installed it as soon as I got home. Installation was straightforward. The latest drivers downloaded and I was up and running in no time.

I have it feeding into my Onkyo AVR, which outputs to my Mitsubishi projector. The image quality is limited by the 1080p projector, but looks fine. The audio pass-through is great. I pulled my sound card and use the video card to send my audio to the AVR.

Study your needs, but it suits me fine. It is well built and easy to get up and running.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Still using it years after purchase
Customer Review: This was initially used to get one of my brothers through in a pinch after his prior gaming card (a 750ti) had failed, and he was very strapped for cash. He used it for years to play mostly World of Warcraft. He has since upgraded, but that card still lives on in my daughter's pc, where she merrily plays Roblox with it.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Solved a problem with using an old PC.
Customer Review: I have an old dual core Dell E521 PC with 8GB memory and Win 10 Pro. I have been using this PC for logging into a DVR security camera system. After spending many hours trying to solve an issue with no video and no help from the manufacturer, I began to suspect the onboard, integrated video was not up to the task. As soon as I installed the card and the drivers, my suspicion was confirmed. This card breathed new life into an old PC. The video looks great on a 4K HDMI monitor. I'm not a gamer so I don't know how this card actually stacks up in that department. This card provides a very inexpensive way to upgrade an old PC to make it compatible with a graphics/resolution intense application like high, (8MP or 12MP) security cameras.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review:
I bought this after I (depressingly) bought a video card that required a power cable that I didn't have. After getting this, I realized I could have bought an adapter, but it's all good in my book. The video card does its job. It won't be able to run the highest graphics, and some cheaper games won't run very well. But I am able to play Dark Souls 3, Witcher 3, and visual novels just fine, just tone down the graphics. I don't mind it, as I have fun regardless. I have not played World of Warcraft extensively yet (still just tested it out with the free version of it), but it seems to work well, especially in the auction house.

As a side note, I put in extra RAM (32 GB DDR4) prior to this. If it seems your RAM is being used up (I say used along with what is on Standby), then that would be the first step to a working computer.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review: didn't work as it should had to return it, every 30 minutes or hours my computer starting to display blue screen not sure if i got a defective, my pc requirements are indeed capable to run the graphics card but still got the blue screen spend almost a day trying to figure it out waste of time

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review: I have a pre-built HP computer that i didn't originally tend to game on, but quickly found myself wanting to. So, i sought after getting a cheap but decent card, and you definitely cannot go wrong with this one. It runs plenty of games on low to medium settings at 30 fps or even 60fps or more in my experience, including GTA V, Fortnite, Warframe, and more. Some games, if optimized well, will even run at high settings at a consistent 30 fps. I still find myself bottlenecked with some more advanced titles, for example COD BO4's blackout mode would not run well at all at the lowest settings, however I was able to get the multiplayer running at a good 30fps on some of the lower settings without sacrifing too much graphical fidelity. I got this thing for $90 and dont regret it in the slightest--a great value for what it is capable of.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review: The card works great with my 4k UHD monitor. I get 3840 x 2160 resolution at 60 Hz. However, the CD that came with the package is not readable. Windows automatically installed NVIDIA driver version 23.21.13.8813 from 10/27/2017, so downloaded the driver and software for this card from Gigabyte's website hoping to get a newer version. However, installation of that driver ended with an infinite loop with a black screen that periodically changed shades. I had to physically turn off power to the computer to escape this mess When I rebooted, everything looked fine, but I found that the NVIDIA driver now installed was OLDER, not newer, version 22.21.13.8476. So next I used the Windows Device Manager to search online for a newer update and install it. That was successful, resulting in NVIDIA driver version 23.21.13.9135 dated 3/23/2018. I never tried installing the downloaded AORUS ENGINE because of the bad experience with the downloaded driver.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Ok for what it is, serves its purpose for me.
Customer Review:
First one came and was DOA. Filed for a replacement, sent back the bad one that afternoon and got the replacement the very next day. Can’t complain about that level of service.

Second one works fine at boot. Installed the drivers and put it through its paces. Ran Userbenchmark and must say I was a bit disappointed. My original card was a cheapo Zotac 710 that just barely put out a 3% on the benchmark. This card bumped it up to 13% so it was an improvement, just not quite what I was hoping for. I’ll just keep it for my file server since I won’t be gaming off of it.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Supports 4K Resolution at a Low Price
Customer Review: I installed this into a productivity computer that does no gaming. Works great for my purpose, but I have no idea how it performs with games. There is a significant performance improvement with this card over the integrated graphics in Intel i7 4770K using Novabench to benchmark. I got this because it supports 3840x2160 resolution for a future monitor upgrade.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Lots of bang for the buck!
Customer Review:
This went into an old Dell Optiplex 780 mini tower that's been BEEFED up about as far as it will go with that motherboard.

Specs: Rosewill 450 watt power supply + 16 GB RAM + 2X 1TB Toshiba 7500 rpm HDDs + Gigabyte GeForce GT-1030 2GB video card + USB 3.1 PC card + Windows 10 on one HDD and Linux Mint Cinnamon 19.2 on the other HDD.

Windows 10 runs nice on this machine. I upgraded from the integrated video so I could enjoy videos primarily. On a lark I installed Wolfenstein The New Order, it runs great! Obviously you can't run the game on the highest settings but close. I did have to add another case fan but big deal? It is a very quiet running video card.

The 5 Stars are for what it does in its price range.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review: Not that I am not tech-savvy or tech-ignorant. But it was simple. No cords to hook up to the PSU. PSU needed is 300W, if your PSU is less than that, you're SOL and need to look for another GPU. anyway, great for the price.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Not the best choice for high resolution
Customer Review: With the DVI output you can get good quality1680 x 1050 with this card, but not 2560 x 1600 which can work using a custom setting, but is unacceptably fuzzy. This card only has DVI and HDMI. You could probably get quality 2560x1600 if it had a dataport, but even though the NVIDIA website says the 1030 has a dataport, it doesn't. You might be able to get a HDMI to dataport cable (~$30) and get it to work, but it makes more sense to get a GTX1050 card if you want high resolutions.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review: I chose this card because it seemed like the best ratio of value to performance gained. I ran a WEI app I downloaded which converts Windows' winsat performance scores to the familiar Windows Experience Index rating, and this card topped out at 9.9 for Graphics and 8.1 for Desktop graphics. I'm able to play LotRO in 1080p with pretty solid fps, and this is on an older Dell with only a v1.1 PCIE x16 slot.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review:
Good: So this GPU was an upgrade from my old one (idk the model). But let me tell you, I was IMPRESSED. I tested this GPU to its limits from GPU accelerated video edit rendering to playing high maintenance games like COD. I even downloaded Fortnite again just to see the difference. On COD I get a pretty stable 60 fps on normal settings, while Fortnite gives me that and more at high settings. Video rendering went from 10 minutes on a 5 minute video, to 6-7 minutes on a nearly 20 minute video. I know these don't seem great especially if you're looking for the best of the best, but now I don't have to worry about my computer lagging or shutting off.
Bad: If you're looking for a GPU that can handle COD on high settings, then this isn't for you. This GPU can handle modern games, but they make the GPU work for the performance. It is noticeably louder than other GPU's but it isn't too bad. Also, if you're wanting to hook up two monitors, you'll have to get an adapter or use one HDMI and one DVI.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card

I highly suggest this card to anyone looking to get into pc gaming.

I don't do gaming, so you'll have to see other reviews for that, but for everything I do (media editing & conversion, office, browsing, playback, etc.), this card does the trick.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Great card, unless you can get a gtx 1050 for only $10 more
Customer Review: Pretty much can be put into any pc new or old. It is pretty much garunteed to fit and it doesn't require any large power supply. Anything above 250w honestly could run this thing. I used this card until i was able to get my gtx 1070. It doesn't really compete, but for the price this gt 1030 can run a lot of games at decent settings. I recommend this card for light gaming/4k video streaming. I was able to play fortnite at 1080p at medium-low settings at 60fps. As long as you have 6gb of ram and a processor that has 2+ cores and clocked at 3.2ghz you should be good on the bottlenecking. (I used an i7-7700k and 16gb ram with a 750w power supply lol). However if you have a few dollars more try to get a gtx 1050 or 1050ti, because you will get a much better value per dollar there.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Low cost, low wattage, high satisfaction.
Customer Review: Very economical card which solves the problem of graduating from integrated graphics chips. 4-5 year old motherboards cannot handle 2019 Steam games. But this 1030 is enough upgrade, at low cost, to make such apps come back to life. Stuttering, app failures, low resolution backgrounds, all solved! Compact assembly, silent fan, low wattage, simple push-in install. Must download drivers and perform set-up after card in place. It works!

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Bang For Buck | HDMI + DVI-D Port
Customer Review:
There's not much to it, you get a fair power for the price.

A couple notable things, though, I did run into some issues installing the driver, but a fresh install fixed the issue.
You will most likely need to search online on how to get it to get the card to access the full color range, for some reason by default it's not already set up, but it's just a matter of enabling a setting.

Also, it does only have 1 hdmi port, and 1 dvi-d port. Which was a little frustrating for multiple monitors, as I have trouble finding dvi monitors, so I recommend possibly getting a DVI to HDMI cord if you plan on using 2 monitors with HDMI ports.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card

On the WEI scale, it rates 9.9 on the 3D business and gaming graphic performance and 8.1 on the desktop graphics performance
out of a 9.9 maximum. What more needs to be said?

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Good for the Price, but Sticky
Customer Review:
The card was definitely easy to install, and it runs fine for non-AAA games, or some AAA games on low settings, however, it was covered with some sort of sticky substance when I opened it. It was almost like somebody spilled pop on it, and it resulted in some corrosion of the copper parts. It does still work, like I said, but a GPU should not be sold, even a lower-end one like this, in this condition.

Edit: Also, for anyone wondering, I simply used 91% isopropyl alcohol and q-tips, making sure to leave no fibers behind, to clean the card, and it worked just fine. If you also want to try this method, just make sure you let the alcohol evaporate completely before you plug the card back in.

The photo I've included was before I cleaned it. Sorry for the flash.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GV-N1030OC-2GI Nvidia GeForce GT 1030 OC 2G Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Good, but bad drivers will need to DL online.
Customer Review:
Installed in
Windows 7 Professional (x64) Service Pack 1 (build 7601.24149)
System Model ASUSTeK COMPUTER INC. D415MT_BM2DK
System Serial Number: G7PFCGKK000B
Processor a 3.10 gigahertz AMD A8 PRO-7600B R7, 10 Compute Cores 4C+6G
600 W power supply( not required but it's what we have)

with a lot of the video cards out there today many are fakes, so when I saw this are only $89 I really did my research to make sure it was the real thing. This was purchased two weeks ago and I was surprised the prices gone up $20 to 109 now. The I arrived sealed and is authentically identified. Installers straightforward to not require very much room. Why this is not a low profile, it does sit semi-low and is very quiet.no power cord is required and if you've installed anything it's a pretty simple process to snap the video card in place includes you case back up.
The install of the included software failed. Time and time again I tried to run the setup program and it would not install. It would get to a certain point and not open up. I therefore went to the Nvidia website and downloaded the proper drivers and there was no problem at all it may have just been a bad CD, but I think there were some compatibility issues.

it seems to operate very well with call of duty, Saints Row, grand theft auto, and most others even at high resolution it worked well.. I notice in some reviews with the amount of frames that are being used. However this is going to vary quite a bit on your cash set up in the amount of RAM you have on board as well as how your monitor is configured. But it didn't do what it should do for this model the claims that are made on the statistics are accurate and really work well.

Pros:
sleek design
very quiet
easy install
works as it should
Windows 7 64, found the video card prior to installing any drivers, which I did eventually update.

Cons:
included CD did not work
instructions included are pretty useless to hopefully know how to install one
.
Overview,definitely a great buy for $89 pushing the limits up to $109 I am not sure it's worth spending too much money for this card. Why Amazon and raise the price 20 bucks in two weeks I am not sure however it is a solid card quiet and uses a very small amount of power which would be very good for small computers with little power supplies. As noted it easy to install, and the drivers are actively found online fairly easily. Make sure you use only the official drivers from the Nvidia website. I have been a big fan of Nvidia since the beginning, and have use these cards extensively, the gigabyte version works perfectly fine. I was concerned going in that the GT 1030 was simply a middle ground graphics card heading to the 1050 area. However this little card does hold its own while a full-fledged gaming machine I would not purchase it for. But for a home gaming system looking for average play it will work fine and did for me. Hope you enjoy the review the card is really solid. Only gave it four stars because eventually there is the likelihood and video will not carry these drivers online in the future and if you still need this card for a reinstall somewhere the CD won't work or did not in my case and I see that as a negative that and anyone knew installing a card like this and using the instructions may have difficulty
