GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Great little card; easily handles 4K display
Customer Review:
I have an older small form-factor PC (the exact model is Gateway SX2865-UR26). This computer is used 99% for basic office tasks, watching YouTube, and minimal gaming. The PC has on-board video which was fine for normal office tasks, but it maxed out at HD resolution (approximately 1920x1080). I eventually upgraded to a 4K monitor, but my computer's built-in video couldn't handle that resolution, so I needed to find a very small video card that was powerful enough to support a 4K monitor.

I tried an older card that I'd used with a 2.7K monitor, but it was terrible -- that card was constantly crashing and causing all sorts of problems....it literally wouldn't allow me to watch full-screen videos.

After looking around on Amazon, I found this Gigabyte card and decided to give it a try. So far, it's been basically perfect. First, it fit into my PC's very small case (the case is very narrow so a "normal" height video card won't fit). Second, after a simple install and setup, the card has been running perfectly -- zero crashes or other problems.

Although my PC is not really used for gaming, I've tried running some really old favorites (Counter-Strike, etc.) and everything seems to run great. That isn't surprising given how old the games I'm playing are, but still -- so far this card has been fast and smooth with everything I've thrown at it. Pretty impressive given the low price.

One other comment -- this card does have a fan, but it appears to be completely silent. My PC is very quiet anyway, but I can't hear the video card's fan running at all.

P.S. One additional thing -- getting 4K/60Hz resolution on my monitor did not require any special cables....I just used an old HDMI cable I had sitting around and this worked fine. This is yet another bonus point since some monitors require different/special cables to achieve the highest resolution & refresh rates, but that fortunately wasn't the case here.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: The GeForce GT 1030 2GB DDR5 64-bit has to be one of the best values for a graphics card <$100 available. I did plenty of research looking for something that would work for my particular rig: I picked up an old(er) HP Elite 8200 SFF with Intel i5-2400 3.1 Ghz processor, and 8 GB RAM for pretty cheap from the IT department at work, and it had a GT 310 installed which was barely able to run SWTOR on low settings (30-40 fps). I was worried about finding something that would fit the SFF tower and would run on the stock ~240W power supply (didn't have the budget to upgrade both). Even though this card recommends min. 300W power supply, I researched the specs and it draws the same amount of power as the GT 310, so I felt safe giving it a shot. Plus, I don't have much else running off the PSU so my total power needs are relatively low. Installation of the hardware was easier than expected (yes, it includes the low-profile bracket which was necessary for the SFF tower), and the software installation was as simple as booting up the computer after installing the graphics card and running the CD. It took about 20 minutes to install all the programs and drivers and was ready to go. I am now playing SWTOR on Ultra settings at 1600x1200 resolution with a framerate of 80-90 fps. I was able to temporarily plug into a different monitor and play on a slightly modified Very High settings (reduced AA, but not off) getting 60-70 fps at 1920x1080. I don't have a need to play the most recent games, just some sorta-oldies-but-definitely-goodies (I will be trying out Skyrim soon, and I have no doubts it will run fine on High settings). I have to say that this card is really great for the price and an outstanding choice for an entry-level graphics card for gamers on a budget.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: This is not a true gaming card and I am sure if I had tried to play something like Witcher 3 I would have had to scale things ...
Customer Review:
I waited a couple of weeks before writing this review to avoid the new buyer enthusiasm, but my enthusiasm really has not dwindled.

I have a Dell Inspiron 3656 which is a small form factor case with a proprietary 240 watts power supply. I wanted to upgrade from the on board GPU, but quickly discovered that there were few options. In fact it was either an older card from several years back or this one, the Geforce GT 1030. I went with the Gigabytes card because of the fan which makes it a thinner card more suitable for my small case.

This card has exceeded my expectations. Before installing the new card I ran 'winstat formal', a built in benchmark in Windows 7 thru 10. The on board GPU scored just 5.1 for graphics. After installing the Geforce GT 1030 I ran winstat again. This time the graphics score was 8.1 (on a scale of 1-9.9 in Windows 10). I am now able to play two year old games at 1080 with high graphics settings. This is not a true gaming card and I am sure if I had tried to play something like Witcher 3 I would have had to scale things down a bit. In Kerbal Space Program I am able to play a moderately modded game with thirty part ships at about 30-40 fps. At this point my CPU is the bottle neck.

Another point I want to stress, because I think it is important, is that the fan over my APU no longer kicks in. When I would first start my computer or launch a ship in Kerbal Space Program, the fan would roar up to full speed to keep the APU cool, but after installing the GT 1030, it does not. The APU is running much much cooler, which is a very good thing. I could probably overclock the system now, which Gigabytes makes very easy with its utility.

The fan on the Gigabyte GT 1030 is really very quiet, not much above ambient room noise. This make the card a perfect choice for a small form factor low wattage HTPC. You would never hear it above the sounds in the 4k movie you are watching. I can not hear it above the sound produced by my heater.

If you have a Dell or HP computer with a small form factor case and low wattage power supply, this is the perfect upgrade to eek out a couple more years out of your system. Or, if you want to reuse your older computer as a HTPC capable of watching 4k videos, this card will do it for you.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Decent budget 64 bit card ideal for slim case
Customer Review:
If you're looking for a review on performance, skip this review.

I was swapping out an older mobo from a mid atx tower to a slim case. I needed a low profile, low power consumption video card capable of DirectX12 to replace the GT630 on this old AMD triple core pc with only a 300W PSU running Win10 64bit. Also the card comes with both the full and half size brackets but mine did require swapping out the installed bracket since I installed this card into a slim case. Please note too that Amazon delivered this card in the retail box with the shipping label slapped on - no shipping box.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Lets See How Noisy or Quiet This Card Is, and What Is Its Best Use?
Customer Review:
Review for: GIGABYTE GeForce GT 1030 Single Slot Low Profile (skinny, short)

Greetings everyone,

In Part 1 we will show the result of noise testing, and in Part 2 we will note what this special unique card is best suited for.

PART #1: SUMMARY OF NOISE TESTING:
-----------------------------------------------

GOAL:

We want the fan to keep the Graphics Card GPU at or under 82-87C. This is 10-15C cooler than the max GPU temp (Tmax).

TEST ENVIRONMENT:

- SMALL COMPUTER CASE with lots of air venting (a worst case case for noise)
- NO OTHER FANS in the case other than CPU fan
- GPU at 100% load

RESULTS:

(1)
33%-50% fan speeds all result in 79C, nearly silent 2'+ away
55% fan speed result in 78C, and still quiet enough for under desk
65% fan speed result in 75C, Audible 4'+ away, OKish under desk
75% fan speed result in 70C, Audible 4'+ away, audible under desk
80% fan speed is MUCH noisier than even 75%

(2)
I CHOSE TO MOSTLY RUN AT 33% fan speed (lowest settable) since at 79C we are still well under the 82-87C goal. At that fan speed it is INAUDIBLE UNDER THE DESK.

33% Fan Speed translates to 1,940-2,090 RPM.

Side Note:
I would think in a mostly enclosed case it would be mostly silent on desk at 33% fan speed.

(4)
DON'T use AUTO to set fan speed as it prioritizes temperature over any concern for noise. AUTO can result in extremely high fan speed (ex: 85%) even when entirely unnecessary.

Instead use MANUAL or even better CUSTOMIZED.

CUSTOMIZED is set using the free GIGABYTE AORUS engine application (it's quite simple to use). I set customized as follows:
- 33% fan speed (lowest possible) until 82C
- 55% fan speed 83C-87C
- 95% fan speed 88C-100C

(5)
Remember that a video card pegged at GPU 100% load can generate different heat profiles depending on what it is doing, such as different games and workloads. It's not always the same heat profile even at a fixed GPU 100% load. Thus, 33% fan speed may or may not be adequate for your particular needs.

(6)
Based on all of this, if your new GIGABYTE GeForce GT 1030 card is quite noisy at low fan speeds like 55% fan speed then you may have a lemon and should exchange it. You will be doing GIGABYTE a favor, they have no desire that lemons make it to the customer.

SPECIAL FAN SPEED NOTES:

In case max fan speed or fan speed % calculations change, here are the RPMs found associated with different % fan speeds on this card.

% _____ RPM
----------------
33% ___ 1,940-2,090
35% ___
40% ___ 2,090
45% ___ 2,250
50% ___ 2,500
55% ___ 2,750
60% ___ 3,000
65% ___ 3,250
70% ___ 3,500
75% ___ 3,750

PART #2: WHAT'S THIS CARD BEST FOR?
-----------------------------------------------

What's special about this card is how remarkably skinny and short it is given its graphics power (SINGLE SLOT, LOW PROFILE). This allows a whole different level of graphics power for many small cases that couldn't otherwise fit anything near its graphics capability.

If you have a bit more space, such as double-slot or standard profile height, you might consider instead using FANLESS GT 1030 options, or for a bit more money up the graphics power a bit and go for at least the GeForce GT 1050 level cards or its AMD equivalents.

Keep in mind this card has 2 GB on it, which is plenty for many uses but can be quite limiting for some more demanding uses like video editing.

Hope that helps!

Best Regards,
Neil

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: I am genuinely surprised by the performance to dollar for this chipset! Especially from a company like nVidia. I had an HD 7750 that was the most powerful chipset (in the low profile, single slot part of the market) for my little brother’s “gaming” pc. Hardly any heat, and little no noise compared to the HD 7750! He plays a lot of light games, but had began playing XCOM 2 (not the most optimized for lower end chipsets) and the upgrade changed his resolution from 720p to 1080p with a higher frame rate! Great little card for anyone on a budget or with size restrictions.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: This is good for Low profile computers with little video card space. nothing else.
Customer Review:
The ONLY reason you should get this card is if you have a dell small form factor computer and nothing else will fit. This card is marginally better than the GT210 or 220series that came with SFF computers.
It takes up one slot in the computer, low fan noise, HDMI and DVI outputs. NO VGA outputs or dongles available.
As far as gaming, it can run lower end games on medium settings, or higher end games on low settings,
but this is also based on the processor you have as well.
This card will help free up resources for your machine if you're running on board memory, as well as being able to run dual monitors. You CAN do 4k, just not terribly well, again, depends on processor. i5 from skylake or better would be recommended. .
If you have room for two low profile slots, my recommendation is the 1050's. Or if you have full size slots, 1650.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Ballin on a Budget, the best card for under $100.00
Customer Review:
I bought this card to upgrade a PC that was given to me. The PC is an HP 510-p026. This PC had a 180watt power supply. I tried this card and it did not work do to the power-supply being to weak. Not to worry. I replaced this power supply with a 300 watt I had from another PC. Now the GT 1030 is running. I have been using this card for the past 4 months with no issues. I am running the card in a small case regular height. This card does come with a slim bracket for slim PC's. I like that card has a fan on it to keep it cooler while gaming. I use NZXT's CAM software to monitor temps while I play some games. GPU temp has never been higher the 60C under full load. It idles between 24 and 27C.
This card is not meant to play AAA titles at max settings. This is a budget friendly card meant to play e sports games and older games. If you want to get off you Intel integrated graphics this is the best card to start with for under $100.00.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review:
I got a free computer from work. It was an older dell optiplex (790) that are filling the shelves in our IT's storage room as the office gets upgraded. It's a small form factor case. It has a second generation i5 and 8GB ram. I didn't really have a use for it, but I thought it would be fun to see what a super-budget-friendly graphics card could do in a free computer. Honestly, I couldn't be more impressed. Since this is a current model, it has up-to-date drivers and supports the latest DirectX. so far, I've tested AC Syndicate, GTA V, Project Cars II, Dirt Rally and Fallout 4. All games perform flawlessly on recommended settings (low to medium). Though it does seem the recommended settings are a bit conservative for this card. I was able to turn them up a bit past the recommended settings with good results.

Besides performance, I was happy with how easy to install it was. The computer came with a 240W power supply, which is actually enough to power this card through the PCIe slot. Being low profile, it also fits perfectly in the small form factor case. I'm amazed at what I'm able to play on this $90 build (the only thing I bought was this graphics card).

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: It works for a while then hangs in 2 different workstations
Customer Review: I got stuck with two HP z240 SFF Workstations from a bad business transaction, one with an Intel i3 and the other with an i5. Gave one to my grandson for video games. Bought the GIGABYTE GeForce GT 1030 which after some research seems to be a low budget good video card. I took some time before testing it. When my son tested it, he informed me that the video will hang randomly and even with the computer (Windows) up and working. The only way to fix it was by rebooting the workstation. After re-installing Windows 10 from scratch I gave it to my grandson. He complained about the same situation. I took it back and spent more than a week researching and testing many suggestions to fix the problem. Installed a new NVME PCIe 240GB SSD which was quite FAST (about 4 times faster than a SATA SSD). In my tests (I'm not a video gamer) seems to be good. But once give it back to my grandson the same behavior began again. After several days of tying and error, I decided to install it in my other workstation which has an Intel i5 PROC, 500GB NVME PCIe Intel SSD and a second SATA 240GB SSD. After a little while, the system started to hang again and as before it will send a message that it has no video. Reboot the workstation and started to work again until it will hang again. Spent several more days and even clean the SSD and reinstall Windows 10 from scratch again, but for no avail. That is when I decided to contact the manufacturer, GIGABYTE. They sent me an RMA confirmation and today I mailed it back (had to pay $12 shipping from my pocket). I will update this review once GIGABYTE answers me for a solution.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Genuinely impressed for an entry level gamer
Customer Review: I bought this for the PC build I gave to my nephews for Christmas. I had thrown this bad boy into a Dell Optiplex 1020 SFF which also had 16GB of Memory and an i5 processor. I had originally intended this to be a "decent" starter gaming machine for the kids, as they are young enough to not notice or care if their games didnt look super HD, plus the games they were playing were things such as Fortnite, Five Nights at Freddy's, Minecraft, Roblox, League of Legends, games that didnt require too much GPU power. Well I can say this...I decided that I would Install games like Need for Speed: The Run, Need for Speed: Rivals, and Sonic Generations. Not exactly super intensive games, but enough to try to test the card. Well, I will tell you that the card handled these games for the most part at the highest settings. NFS The Run ran flawlessly at the highest settings, NFS Rivals ran fine with a few hiccups here and there (when the environment got super detailed and several AI were on screen) and Sonic Generations ran flawlessly on the highest settings. Of course, it is now after Christmas and the kids have been playing fortnite, minecraft, league, and all sorts of other games without any issues. I definitely recommend this card for small builds and for any casual gamer.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Great for Home theater PC set ups and H265 / HEVC video decoding
Customer Review: Didn't buy for games, rather using it in a HTPC build. My AMD APU setup worked well for years with H264 based codecs but time has moved on and H265 is coming to the forefront as a newer and more efficient video codec. HEVC or H265 would drive my cpu usage to 99-100% on an AMD A10 as that generation lacked H265 support, after installing this video card, the cpu usage has dropped down dramatically to 7-8% CPU usage when playing H265 files and should extend the life of this build for another few years.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review:
Bought this to see if my onboard video was dysfunctional.
Computer would boot, but nothing on the monitor.

MB: MSI z97 PC MATE
CPU: i7 4795k
RAM: 16GB
GPU: none before (installed this card to see)

I accidentally reconfirgured the windows of a stock chart program.
In order to not have the program save the new configuration, I turned off my computer at the PSU switch while Windows was still running.
After that, for whatever reason, the monitor would not show input when the computer was turned on.

Having troubleshoot some components (RAM, HD, cables, monitor), I searched the internet for similar causes.
Primary cause was not clear cut - some said PSU, some said MB, some said HD, etc.
I figured that since the power was on, HD was spinning, and blue LEDs were on in the case, it had to be the onboard video.

Not wanting to waste $40 on an underpowered older GPU, I opted for this GT 1030.
It's not for major gaming, but for my 4k television monitor and my TOS stock charts with real time data (18 small charts at once), it seemed to be what was needed as those two factors do require some processing power and memory.

I initially installed it on the lower (blue) PCI slot of the motherboard...nothing.
I moved this card to the upper (blue) PCI slot, and VOILA! I get Windows! (albeit initially at 1080p max due to Windows' VGA drivers).

The item came in it's GIGABYTE package undamaged.
New tape was on the tab.
New tape was on the electroprotective package.
It also had plastic covers on the terminals and 2 ports.
It was missing a manual and maybe a driver disc, but all I needed to do was download it off of GIGABYTE's website and install. Upon driver install completion, I was asked to reboot. On reboot, 4k resolution instantly appeared.

Overall, I'm happy with the purchase.
I'm happy with the "open box" price as well.
Delivered in 2 days and I didn't have to spend the gas to drive over to Microcenter or Best Buy, both of whom had similar prices for new. But for this aging machine, a few bucks saved is a few bucks earned.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Better than integrated graphics, fair solution to pre-built PCs
Customer Review: First gigabyte video card I've used for a client's build and I'm impressed. The packaging from gigabyte isn't anything amazing but with low end cards I wouldn't expect them to be. Used this card for a client, for mainly home theatre use and light gaming. It runs quiet, comes with half height bracket, and to be honest when you are used to using bigger mainstream gaming video cards it's kind of adorable. This video card won't play the newest AAA games but, it will work better than integrated graphics and is really aimed at home theatre use. Somewhat comparable to the 750ti but with half the power consumption, I would recommend this in a pre-built system with a proprietary power supply like a dell 3650 or similar that doesn't require a power connection.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Nice little card for small form factor systems
Customer Review:
Nice little card for small form factor systems. Installed in an OptiPlex 5050. Runs e-sports titles like CS:GO and Rocket League at max settings 1080p with 100+ FPS no problem. Does surprisingly well with modern games. Packs a decent punch for an entry level GPU. Will run any older game without breaking a sweat. If you can deal with lower settings or playing at 720p for more demanding titles, this card shouldn't disappoint. As a basic card for an office desktop, this is a great card. Much faster than onboard, frees up system memory normally shared with the onboard graphics.

Card runs quiet and cool. One of the few low profile, single slot cards out there.

I paid $79 for this card from Amazon. I would not spend more money than this. Wait until the GPU market cools down. This card is NOT worth $120.

One major con - does not support NVENC encoding, so if you're getting this for streaming in a dedicated box, you need to look elsewhere.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: A Big Improvement for a Reasonable Price
Customer Review:
There were some games I wanted to play on Steam, but with the standard "HD graphics 4600" on my computer, the motion was balky and choppy. My computer was a small form factor HP, so I was limited by 2 main constraints. The standard 240 watt power supply was an odd size, preventing me from upgrading it, and the case was small so I need a low profile graphics card. The Geforce GT 1030 proved to be the perfect solution. Its power draw was very low; it drew power only from the motherboard, meaning that no additional plug was needed to power it; and it was small enough to fit inside the case.
I should note that I run an SSD (solid state hard drive) instead of the standard HDD, and this reduces the power use of the computer considerably. This power reduction offset at least some of the extra power drawn by the graphics card. I don't think that I would attempt this upgrade with a 240 Watt power supply and the standard HDD.
Installation was a breeze. Attaching the smaller bracket on the card and physically installing it in my computer took less than 10 minutes. I had difficulty getting the driver to download from the Gigabyte website, but the included CD worked fine. The included instructions are generic and of little help, but fortunately the process is fairly intuitive.
You should be aware that this video card does not have a VGA port. You will need either an HDMI or DVI cable to connect your monitor. This is clearly stated on the Amazon page, but somehow I failed to notice it.
After installation was completed, the performance increase was impressive. To be sure, the graphics aren't perfect. Occasionally there is still the slightest amount of hesitation in some of the graphics. However, the games are now perfectly playable with minimal distractions. The cooling fan is audible but not at all distracting.
With a larger case and power supply, I probably would have paid the extra $80 or so to get a more powerful GTX 1650 with 4 GB instead of 2 GB. However, given the physical limitations of my system, I think that the GT 1030 gave me as much improvement as I can squeeze out of my tiny computer.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review:
This was an excellent video card and it did exactly what I needed it to do.... almost. The problem isn't with the card though, it was with the power draw. Each time the video card fan started up, my video would go out. My Dell PC only has a 240 watt power supply and the low power capability caused the graphics card to go out each time the fan started.

There is hope however!! Apparently, the same company makes the same card with a larger heat sink and NO fan!! It is called the GIGABYTE GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030SL-2GL Silent Low Profile 2G, and it is even a bit cheaper. Just ordered it and am going to try that one instead.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Best Available Single-Slot, Half-Height, Low Profile Graphics Card For SFF Computers
Customer Review:
I bought this Gigabyte GEForce GT 1030 card (GDDR5) card for my Dell OptiPlex 790 SFF desktop computer. I upgraded tie wimpy OEM Power supply to an OEM 240 Watt unit, and the card works flying advanced flight sims with no problems.
Full disclosure: the comp is running a Win 10 Pro OpSys, 2nd Gen I7 (OEM) CPU, max RAM of 16Gb, the aforementioned (OEM) PS upgrade, and dual SSDs. I have gotten by with far less advanced rigs than this flying modern flight simulators, but this rig will do until the "BIG" Upgrade some time in the future. I admit my rig is far from cutting edge, but it works fine for my purposes. I haven't overclocked anything.

I have used cards with nearly the power draw that this card has (GEForce 710) with wimpy OEM PS, but since this card draws more, I played it safe and upgraded PS to something far more powerful that original PS. This model computer has a case fan, a fan on the CPU, and a fan on the card. No problems with heat or noise, without headphones.

From my research, I don't think there is a better card available for this specific application, that being single slot, half height SFF envelope.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review:
Spent hours looking for a card that would work in my Dell 7020 sff. Problem was the Dell sff has limited space (width) for a serious graphics card. This card fit perfectly with room to spare. Took some time to download the included programs (on the cd they provide). Installation of the card takes about five minutes, and I had a picture on my monitor from the first moment I turned it on. Frames per second were dramatically increased from the R5-240 graphics card that was installed by Dell. Huge increase in video quality and power. Fan is whisper quiet on this Geforce card. The exact card I purchased is: GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G. Make sure you get the DDR5!

Additional thoughts - I initially wanted the 1050ti at 75 watts. Contacted Dell and they said a single slot low profile would work and my power supply should handle it as long as I didnt go above 75 watts. I found one card that fit the bill and it was over $200. Issue is the 1050ti requires more cooling and therefore a wider footprint for the fan(s). Also, the low profile means the card needs to come with the low profile adapter. The 1030 adapter on the card I purchased was perfect. After installing the 1030 and seeing the additional space that was left over, im guessing that a low profile 1050ti that takes up a slot and a half or less would work in my Dell 7020 sff. Just guessing but worth a try as Dell rep said the 7020 should handle the power requirements of 75 watts.

Bottom line - I purchased one of the more expensive 1030 cards, and could not be more pleased. First, it fit perfectly and graphics ability amazed me compared to my old card. FPS went thru the roof. Even though is is not a true gaming card. If you are a serious gamer or don't mind spending the extra cash and have limited space you might consider a low profile 1050 ti. Call the manufacturers and get a thin one... slot and a half width should??? work. Worst case is you will have to drop down to the 1030 and save about $80.

Final thoughts - I love this card. It dramatically increased my fps, its quiet, and it FIT!!! And didn't break the bank.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: I have an older computer running Ubuntu 18.xx with an AMD Phenom 9600 in an MSI K9A2 Platinum motherboard. I had been using MythTV with my TV tuner card and decided to go with Plex Pass as the guide integration is better. When using MythTV the client was responsible for decoding the Mpeg2 stream(s) and I had no issues with my server hw. Plex is transcoding it to H264 on the server and it was maxing out my processor. I bought this card, downloaded and installed the NVidia linux drivers, and plex is now using the vid card to transcode the video and my processor usage is around 50%. All of my other content is Direct Streamed as I've ripped it in compatible formats with my clients, and uses no CPU. So now my live TV is playing without stuttering, I'm happy. I don't notice a difference in the quality of the TV video stream either.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review:
I have nothing bad to say about this graphics card. It is well-priced and the performance is good. The only concern consumers should have is that AMD has changed the technology landscape.

This graphics card (GT 1030) is about as strong as the integrated graphics card on the AMD Ryzen 2400G. At least, this is my personal experience. So this card (GT 1030) is good if you already have the rest of your PC build already, and you only need a low profile and decently strong graphics card that can play most games at 60+ FPS.

However, if you are looking to build low power-consumption PC from scratch, then I highly recommend anyone to buy a APU like the 2400G or 3400G. The graphics card is built into the CPU chip, so it will save you so much space, power consumption, and money!

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Happy with a big upgrade at a modest price
Customer Review:
I bought a cheap Dell Inspiron 3670 a while back at Costco and while I didn't expect much from it graphics wise, the onboard graphics were just plain terrible. I was not looking to make a major investment but wanted an upgrade to passable gaming. GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: If you don’t have a dedicated GPU, this should definitely help
Customer Review:
If you don’t have a dedicated graphics card, and are in need of a low profile card that doesn’t require a lot of power, than this card is perfect. I bought a used computer that had decent CPU but had no dedicated GPU. It’s a small computer so I needed something small to fit, and I didn’t want to change the PSU. Long story short I got a huge performance boost.

I mainly play Rocket League. Before this GPU I was getting 45-55fps @ 720p with all settings on low. After I got this GPU I went to 110-120fps @ 1080p with all settings turned all the way up except anti aliasing.

I honestly wasn’t expecting that much of a difference. But I also tried playing Fortnite once and it wasn’t good at all. So graphically intensive games will need a better GPU than this, but for games like Rocket League, WoW, CSGO, Dota, etc, this GPU will greatly improve frame rates.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review:
I'm running a Dell Optiplex 780 SFF with Windows 10, 16 Mb of RAM, SSD, Xeon 3360 (95 watts draw) and the purchased from Amazon GIGABYTE GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL card. This is all running with a 235 watt power supply. The card slotted in with just sufficient room to fit. Screen is a Philips 190SW with resolution of 1440 x 900 and a refresh rate of 75 Hz. The case lid is off as I'm still playing with the interior of it. The card is at temperature of 83 degrees Celsius and seems to maintain that with gaming. The game with the most noticeable improvement has been Mirror's Edge. That could be PhysX from Nvidia being used or the Xeon or the Gigabyte card or setting the refresh rate up to 75 Hz from 60 Hz or the combination thereof. Three Tomb Raider games, Legend, Anniversary and Underworld have also improved and are now running with lots of detail and fluid movement.

So if you've got an old Optiplex 780 SFF and were considering the GT 1030, well jump in, it's worth the upgrade.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: It worked Well for a Day
Customer Review: I still believe it is an excellent product. Somehow it wasn't compatible with our I5 Desktop and it subsequently crashed - to the effect that we cant use it any longer for video games. Short of calling the experts or buying a new desktop we are without a gaming computer for now. Just saying that it is not always plug and play..

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: We have a 2012 Lenovo ThinkCentre M71e i3 slim desktop functioning as our Home Theater PC (HTPC). It has an SSD drive, Blueray optical and 8GB RAM. We replaced an AMD HD6670 with the Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 when you upgraded to a 4K TV. The upgrade was uneventful - we uninstalled the AMD drivers - restarted and ran the CD that came with the card. Typically we are learning about HDR, 4K and media players that work best in Window 10 as we go along. By sheer luck I happened to pick the DDR5 based GT 1030 - apparently some have 2GB of DDR4 memory and those cards are much slower. This card plays HEVC encoded 2160 movies without a single hiccup.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Great low electricity card with decent gaming capabilities.
Customer Review:
Great card for light gaming.

The GT 1030 is one of the lower end gaming cards Nvidia makes at the moment but it's a real gaming card. I is perfect for me. I bought it for my daughter, who has an older i5 with a graphics card not intended for gaming. She wasn't able to get high quality textures on even basic games like starcraft 2. I replaced her card with this and now she can max out all the settings and it works great.

One requirement for me: the card I bought needed to be able to use basic PCI power and not require one of those 6 pin plugs from the power supply since her power supply is cheap and doesn't have any. This card does not require a separate power cable.

This card compares with and surpasses high-end cards from a few years ago (I have a Radeon HD4870 for example) but consumes way, way less power, like 20 watts max or something. You can put this in any computer and not worry about the power supply, heat, or effect on your electric bill. Yet it does very well in mid-level games.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Decent gaming at a decent price.
Customer Review:
So, I purchased this for a Home Theater PC, but was quite surprised when it seemed to game well, too. I decided to overclock the card and see what it could really do, and boy, could it go. I raised the core clock to 1926mhz, and the memory to 3786mhz (7572 eff.) This little thing took off like a rocket.

At 1080p, Normal, Tomb Raider 2013 saw roughly 90fps. Metro LL, just over 80fps. Rise o/t Tomb Raider fared less well, with 1080p Low settings at just below 60fps. Realistically, moving forward, if you are buying this for gaming, you will largely be playing AAA games at 720p or 900p. But, for slightly older games, eSports titles, or Indie Gems, this little thing rules, you really cannot beat it for the price.

Moreover, this card was the last to rise in price and the first to fall during the Great GPU Price Gouge of 2018, and when I purchased it, I found a great deal. But, always be aware of price-to-performance.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: A great video card for those of us who can't spend hundreds of dollars.
Customer Review:
I am not a person that can drop a few hundred dollars on a graphics adapter, there are plenty of other things higher on my priorities list. I am a middle-aged man that probably spends ten hours a week playing video games. I wanted a card that enabled me to view the graphics in a more pleasing way without sending me to the poor house. The Geforce GT 1030 was a great upgrade for me. It is not the fastest graphics card by a long shot, but it is certainly worth the money! Its performance has been flawless after a month or so of use. The card only uses about 30 watts of power and has a PassMark perfoemance rating of Last 5 Baselines for GeForce GT 1030, most recent listed first
BL1014740 - Apr 25 2018 2425
BL1014251 - Apr 24 2018 2238
BL1013601 - Apr 23 2018 2477
BL1013394 - Apr 22 2018 1394
BL1012999 - Apr 21 2018 1911
PassMark Software © 2008-2018

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Effective and cheap low profile card
Customer Review: Great little card for the price. Decent performance for anything you're trying to add a lower end graphics chip to get off the on-board system. Only knock I'd have on this is that it's advertised as a low profile card, it comes with the normal bracket pre-installed in the card. There is a low-profile bracket included with it, however you'll need to remove it and replace it prior to installation. Easy enough to do, and did not remove stars as a result. Just seems it should probably be ready to go for it's advertised purpose and have the large bracket for swap instead. All in all would recommend!

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: No complaints whatsoever about this product. I uninstalled the previous Nvidia drivers before installing using DDU, and then Windows downloaded a driver for this after installing it. I then went to the Nvidia website to install GeForce Experience, and have updated drivers a couple of times since then. The only issue I faced - and this has nothing to do with this product - was that Windows also ended up installing a driver for my previously removed graphics card, which caused some BSOD issues. After making sure I uninstalled that device from Device Manager, there have been no problems at all.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Great Card, Especially for Linux Users
Customer Review:
I bought this card so I could do some gaming on Linux (Ubuntu). This card works right out of the box and all I really had to do was install the latest drivers for the 1030 using apt. The one thing I will recommend for anyone wanting to use both the DVI and HDMI outputs is to get a DVI -> HDMI cord if you have a choice between HDMI and a DisplayPort. Unfortunately, the display port option doesn't seem to be recognized properly.

I have one monitor that is 27" on the HDMI and a 36" on the DVI output, and it works great. I play games like Portal and CounterStrike using Steam and I can play on the large 36" at full resolution with all the bells and whistles really well. No need to really spend more unless you really are trying to drive bigger than that.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: I bought this card with the intention of using it for hardware accelerated transcoding on a plex server. Unfortunately, after finally finding the document that shows it, this is one of the only cards that nvidia has made in the last several years that doesn't actually have a HWENC chip on it. Tons of troubleshooting to figure that one out :\ . I will say that it does not appear to draw much power at all, and the fan is effectively inaudible, but I cannot imagine that it's particularly useful for anything other than getting an image to a monitor.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review:
I needed a newer card for my small form factor desktop, a micro-atx dell 7020. To fit in the machine the card had to be low profile, single slot, and short. I also needed something with a reasonable amount of horsepower. It's surprisingly difficult to find a card that meets those requirements, but this one is great. It's small, fast, quiet, supports dual monitors, and fits easily into the machine. This isn't a gaming machine, but I tested Diablo 3 out of curiosity. The 1030 ran it at the highest settings without any problems.

This card is perfect for what I needed.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: Bought this for my Dell Optiplex 390, I3-2400 cpu, 10gb ram. It turned my PC into a whole new gaming experience. I also didn't have to buy a new power supply. It runs smooth. It recommends 300w power supply, I have a 265w power supply, and I have no issues. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Average Joe gamer review: BUY IT. Read this.
Customer Review:
I am not a pro gamer. I’m not going to list all my specs in this review. I’m giving a real life, average joe review. Read this.
I have a small Hp compaq 6300. Its a slim office computer basically. It uses integrated graphics, so games like fortnite don’t play on more than 15 frames per second, which is unplayable. I didn’t have $300 for a fancy graphics card. I needed something small and cheap until i could save. I had lower expectations and I was blown away. I play fortnite consistently on 60fps, and if you’re a casual gamer who just wants to mess around, this is just fine. Now, if you have a computer from 2007 that doesn’t have at least decent other parts, this won’t save your games. games rely on 2 things: the graphics card (gpu) and the CPU (motherboard, basically) if you have a janky CPU this card won’t just magically run games. I have an average joe, $200 office computer, and this does fantastic for what it is. If you need something to get you by for now, this is great. Perfect. If you want seamless high quality gameplay with 240 fps.... this won’t do it. If you know nothing about games and computers, but you want a tiny bit more for gaming, this will probably do what you need. Easy to install, just plug it into the graphics card slot inside the computer and download the software. This is doing great for me. Everyone that’s rating this poorly expects pro level game play, so don’t let their poor review talk you out of it. Do a tad bit of research on your computer, and make your decision, but i recommend this for sure.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: It really improved my son's computer's performance
Customer Review:
My son got this for his 15th birthday, and installed it right away. He had no difficulty installing it, although the shield was too big for his setup. He fortunately found one around the house that fit. He had it up and running very quickly (I'm guessing it was around half an hour, including time looking for another shield.)

He was installing into a computer that did not already have a graphics card, only an integrated chip, on an older computer. He went from not really being able to run Minecraft at all (1 fps) to 60 fps and smooth running. He is very happy with it.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: I knew going in that the price to performance ratio ...
Customer Review: I knew going in that the price to performance ratio on these 1030s was way out of line. Unfortunately options in the single slot low profile form factor means it's this or a card from 5 years ago.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: The best option for a Dell 9020 small form factor.
Customer Review: Bought this for use in my Dell 9020 small form factor emulation PC. Unfortunately because of the position of the PCI-E slot, only a single-slot card would fit, of which this is the most powerful I've come across. It's handled everything I've thrown at it emulation wise up to the Wii era and even surprised me with its performance on some older PC titles as well! I'm currently playing Prince of Persia (2008) at 1080p at max settings and enjoying every drop-frame-less second!

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review:
I've heard of people using these for games but with low quality settings, but supposedly it can be done. Nevertheless for the same money an older used card that's higher spec would be better.

What you really get a card like this for is if you have a PC with outdated onboard video and would like to be able to stream movies, play browser games and the like and be able to have current drivers.

Used for that, which is a lot of office PC's and low end store bought computers and it works great.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: Got this for a Ryzen 5 3600 build w/ MSI B450M PRO-VDH Max mobo in an ATX case. Easy install. Worked fine in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS w/o update and even better once I got the latest nvidia drivers and updated the system to v5 kernel plus other updates to take advantage of recent hardware. I mostly use my machine for Chrome browsing, so not that exciting, but rendering is fast, scrolling is smooth and I don't see flicker. Seems like an awesome budget card.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS IF YOU LIVE IN ANOTHER COUNTRY BESIDES THE U.S!!
Customer Review: I felt great about this product when i got it a first. obviously, because I had never had any real GPU or computer parts before. However, I opened it up, and put it in my computer, i put it in the RIGHT PSI slot (the only one it fitted), connected my HDMI, power on my system, and NO SIGNAL. I first tried to switch which connection it was going through. i switched it through from HDMI1 &HDMI2, but nothing worked. So I tried for 2 WEEKS to get it working. but when I went to J car, they told me it should be able to just connect with and HDMI. so that's when i knew it was faulty. So i returned it, but even that was a hassle all by itself! next time, I'll make sure to buy something From a local website that I can trust and return things if need more easier. And yes, my system has an i5 2400, 320w PSU, 4gb DDR3 RAM,500gb HDD, and a 80gb SSD. I'm pretty sure that's enough but I could be wrong. But last time i checked, the Geforce GT 1030 2gb is a perfect match for the i5 2400.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: I use this in my home theater system, replacing a lesser video card, to deliver lossless 4K images to a 10 foot screen and its projector. All is beautiful except the fan, which spools up and down based upon heat - the speed of the rendering required. I also have an identical card running my three screen desktop running Windows 10 64, and there is absolutely no fan noise. So, your use determines this, and your taste determines whether you care about a little noise. In the theater I do. If the same noise were under the desk, I might not...

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Work on my HP Envy Desktop very well with the New Dell 27 inch monitor
Customer Review: This works works on my HP Envy Desktop that's almost 5 years old. Just purchased the Dell 27 inch monitor and needed a video card to drive it. the resolution was so high, I had to tune my monitor contrast and brightness down and increase the light comfort. it's a Nvidia chip and it is driven by the Nvidia control panel. HDMI supported my Dell 1440P Dell monitor. I'm not using it for gaming. but it's for my monitor and graphics editing.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review:
I ended up going with this card after looking for low profile cards to stick in an old Dell Optiplex 3020 that I set up as a media server and classic game setup on my TV. I wanted to have a card that could be used for Plex's hardware acceleration and drive the 4K TV to free up the CPU a bit.

Installation was quick and easy. The screw to remove the plate is easily accessible, and a small pair of pliers made getting the post screws for the DVI port off easy as well. Fit perfectly in the Optiplex 3020's x16 slot and closed back up with no clearance issues.

Operationally, the card seems great so far. Ran a few tests with Plex and some emulated games and there was a definite improvement over the CPU's onboard graphics. Here's hoping the card continues to work this well!

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: I have a Small form factor Lenovo that came with a GT730 and because of the case design, I discovered this was my only possible upgrade for my GPU. I am very pleased and it runs games like Madden 19 and Battlefield 1 very well for its specs, and doubled the performance of the 730.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: It's small and low power needs
Customer Review: This GPU is the lowest you'll want to go if your a casual gamer and I mean casual. It won't impress you but don't be fooled by the low power needs and how small it is. It still packs a punch for a low end GPU. I got a used one, the very cheapest, and it looked to me that someone bought it and didn't like it and immediately sent it back. That's great for me because that knocked ~$10 off the price. It arrived on the date it said and was packaged as well as used can be.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: I didn’t feel like buying a new desktop when my 10-12 year old graphics card couldn’t handle a photo editing program I wanted to use. This got good reviews and I figured it was worth a shot. I’m very pleased that this card fixed my issues. It hasn’t given me any errors yet. Updates are frequently available. It was easy to install. It’s still not super quiet, but that doesn’t bother me.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: I updated a Dell XPS 8700 PC from the GT-730 1GB to this card. I didn't want to mess around with the PSU so just did a small upgrade. The card went in perfectly. At first I couldn't get my PC to boot up and the fan would just work but nothing else. I read the comment and saw one other had the same issue. But it puzzled me so I googled a bit more. Turned out that updating the hardware drained the BIOS CMOS battery! A freaking $2 C2032 battery that took all of 3 seconds to remove and put in a new one. Then it booted up just fine. I forced an update in device manager and it worked just fine. Whew!

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review:
I won a pre-built gaming rig at work, however it did not contain the minimum graphics specs for the upcoming WoW: Shadowlands.

This card installed very easily and the design is very intelligent. They even offer an alternate plate to utilize for smaller cases.

I utilized this purchase together with a new external SSD, since that is also a new standard to play the new WoW expansion.

The graphics are nice and everything loads very quickly. The drivers automatically installed on my Windows 10 pro while I was executing a search engine task of finding them. That added an extra layer convenience.

Overall I give this card 5 stars. This is due to the price range and ease of being able to install it. Since I only play WoW on my desktop, this is sufficient for me and it runs great.

I would recommend this card for any individual looking for a graphics card upgrade that doesn't require an external plug.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: Easy install on an HP slimline running Win 10. Replaced an old AMD HD 5450 to get to native resolution on a new HP pavilion 32 monitor. The old card couldn't make it and those software patches didn't work. Shut down the computer. Removed the old card and installed the new card. Restarted and installed the new drivers. The new drivers were downloaded. Note the install occurred at 800x600 resolution. After install completed and rebooted I was in business at 2550x1440. Time elapsed- 20-30 min. There was no need to remove the old AMD drivers or the Catalyst controls. A few tweaks to the Win display settings were needed but that was personal preference.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: I purchased this card to use in a Lenovo Thinkcentre that I am using as my home theater pc. Read reviews and watched videos about this card most said it is a great card for a home theater pc. Installed the card and followed the installation cd instructions. Had great picture quality but after about 10 days the video would just randomly shut off and come back a few minutes later, only to do it again in a short period of time. So I removed the card and installed it into a second machine (HP) and it seemed to work fine for about 2 weeks in that machine before the issue came back. So i reinstalled it into the Lenovo and the card wouldn't work for more then a few minutes in that machine. I then switched it back to the HP and it won't work at all. Very disappointed this card only lasted about a month and I can't return it since it's now past the return deadline. I should have listened to the other reviews that said the same thing.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: I bought this for a Lenovo M91P SFF desktop. It installed perfectly in the on-board PCIe 16 slot. This card draws low power considering the small PSU on the Lenovo. I watch live streams, YouTube and Netflix without any issues. I am light gamer, and was able to run StarCraft II and Diablo III without and glitches. For those on a budget, this card is easy on your wallet.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: I'm not a serious gamer and only gave 4 stars because I just got the card this past week. I previously had a dinosaur GT 240 card. Games I play most often are N4S hot pursuit and Battlefield Bad Company 2. I have both set to highest settings and no problems. If the card holds up I'll upgrade to 5 stars later. I have an AOC 27" monitor and the graphics and 4K videos etc look great.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Perfect fit for either a single-slot or low-profile case
Customer Review: Perfect fit for either a single-slot or low-profile case. These are roughly equivalent to a GTX750 at a great price.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: I am not a gamer, but I like to run some Total War games from time to time. Purchased this card for my low profile refurb, and it runs great! Runs Thrones of Britannia on high (not ultra) and Empire on Ultra. Everything is as smooth as can be. For the price, and for the casual gamer, this is a fantastic card. Really happy with this purchase. Install was easy. Driver installation no problem. 5 stars.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review:
I got this card to install in an older motherboard that I'm turning into a Linux server. (I should have been able to use the onboard graphics for that, but for some reason wouldn't boot without a video card. No amount of resetting the BIOS and such would convince it otherwise. This was my solution.) I've had much better luck with Nvidia cards under Linux than AMD cards. The drivers are nearly up-to-date with the Windows ones. Works great for a simple Linux server with its standard graphical interface. Very low power (no secondary power from the PSU needed as it's only about 30W).

Someone asked a question about the height of the card if the included low-profile bracket is used. I didn't use it, but I've uploaded a picture of it next to a ruler. I've also taken a picture of the card inserted into my machine. It uses all of the height of the low-profile bracket as can be seen by comparing where the HDMI connector is on the low-profile bracket to where it is on the back of the actual card. Looks like it takes every millimeter to me.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Works Great On My 10-Year Old Dell XPS 630i
Customer Review: My fan stopped working on my graphics card in my DELL XPS 630i. I was thinking about trying a new fan to attach to the card, but my PC is 10 years old, so I ordered the GIGABYTE GeForce GT 1030. It plugged in very easily and fired right up. The new graphics card is much smaller and the fan is very quiet compared to the original. I am very pleased with the display.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: Eliminated a lot of buffering issues with 4k content. Replaced an integrated Intel HD530 on a 6700k CPU. Seems to greatly reduce CPU load for hardware transcoding tasks since the GPU is taking on some of the work with ease. I installed it in a slim case and the low profile card fits perfectly in a single slot. No external power is required. One star deducted because the card does not support CUDA video encoding.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: Recently added a new monitor to our Acer Aspire and the new monitor needed one more HDMI or DVI port then we had available (don't remember which) Plus at the same time I discovered the Photoshop CS requires a graphics card to be able to use some of the filters and 3D effects. After some quick searching this came up as a budget solution that covers both problems. This plugs in quick, is silent, and functions perfectly for my needs.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: I Bought this item used back inay and it was an amazing experience for this low profile GPU. But it came to an end when it just stopped working. Way past the return policy through Amazon. I have no complaints with this graphics card at all. Superb job. Who knows maybe the Company or Amazon would donate a fresh one to me. Sure would appreciate that very much. Thanks for reading me.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: This thing works like a charm for Valorant/Overwatch/Starcraft 2/Red Dead Redemption 2, and LoL. It was quite simple to take out, and replace my old GPU. Don’t bother with the accompanied CD, just go to the GEForce website to download drivers. It does get a bit loud the first few times you run it, but the noisy fan should die down with continued usage. All in all, pretty pleased with my purchase. It’s not the top of the line GPU, but can’t really beat the price point.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: I bought this to add to my daughter's Acer desktop that only had integrated graphics. She wanted to play Overwatch and the minimum requirements called for a dedicated graphics card. It pulls all of its power through the PCI-E port so there was no need to connect it separately to the power supply.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: Ok I get the fact that my package has been lost somewhere.. it would be nice if y’all would keep track of it more... idk what’s going on with the whole “it’s late, but on it’s way” I’ve Never encountered this problem before until I ordered this part. ANYWAYS, other than that, pixelation is gone, I can enjoy the FPS much more..

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: I thought it would be much faster than integrated Ryzen's CPU Amd Vega 11
Customer Review:
Cons----

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Ok to upgrade for young gamer
Customer Review:
This is just fine for running Fortnite or any high resolution game from an old computer.
Not for serious gamers. I bought and installed this for a young kid who occasionally plays computer games. Noticeable improvement from builtin GPU on Mobo.

Fortnite runs just fine With no lagging (depends on your CPU and memory, of course) after installing this video card. Fits perfect to Mobo slot.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: This was a huge upgrade from my older gpu (geforce gtx 860m). What really matters when shopping for a gpu. Is pricing, if it is stronger than your last gpu, and is it able to play the games you want. For me, this hit all check points. Overwatch and League Of Legends play perfectly fine. Pricing was 90$ when I got it.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Works great for an older HP PC where space is a problem
Customer Review: Perfect and quick enough for most gaming that we have thrown at it so far. I used it in a $200 HP PC that I maxed the RAM, installed an SSD and this cars so my kids had a gaming rig that wasn't going to break the bank. I think I have less in the PC than I do in their Xbox and both have the same graphics quality.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Great Card But Be Careful With Optiplex 390 SFF
Customer Review:
I purchased this card to pair with an Optiplex 390 SFF. Dell rates the PCI-E 16x slot at 25W TDP but this card can pull 30W. I used MSI Afterburner to apply a profile at startup to limit the card to 25.5W. If I don't do this then the card will fail while gaming because of excessive power draw.

Runs Fortnite at 1080p with a mix of High and Med settings at 60ish FPS.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: I installed this in a 2008-era Dell low profile PC. It's performance is incredible for this application. It makes a Core2Duo PC feel like new for an HTPC. My only other major modification was a cheap solid state drive. I get 4k 60Hz video with this ancient computer, no problem. Obviously not for any serious gaming, but I take it you understand that if you are buying this.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: What's worse is that the box was not even taped shut ...
Customer Review:
Five stars for the card, ONE STAR FOR THE PACKAGING. Amazon is shipping these in the Gigabyte retail box (as seen in the product picture) with a shipping label slapped on it, or at least that's how I received mine. What's worse is that the box was not even taped shut (and there was no factory sealed on the box either), so it's a miracle that it arrived without the loose card falling out of the box or being stolen -- so beware.

As for the card, it runs cool, and despite the fan is silent. It is being used in a small form factor PC and can run older games like Skyrim on ultra settings at 60 fps (CPU is an i5)

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: I bought this to upgrade my 4850HD when my tower died and had to buy a new one, needed a good card to play my older games and this did not disappoint! Probably not good for new more intense GPU games but perfect for what I needed it for. Always check the system requirements of your games before purchasing.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Defective, will not support dual monitors
Customer Review: Despite the configuration of the card with both HDMI and DVI-D connections, I could not achieve dual monitor setup. The slots both had output, but only one at a time would work, and using the HDMI connection in an attempt to achieve a 1920x1080 resolution caused it to crash the system. The above verified by a certified Microsoft Technician who was unable to resolve these issues. I asked Amazon for a refund/return, but the 30 day limit was exceeded, so they referred me back to Gigabyte. A call to support there was made. The manufacturer is in China. They declined a refund, said I would need to return to their service center for engineers to assess and refurbish. Considering shipping costs, it was not worth the hassle, so decided to trash it and stop wasting time. I will not order from this manufacturer again.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Good if you need a low-profile graphics card
Customer Review: I have a low-profile PC so I can't use a regular sized graphics card. I found this low-profile one and I'm very happy with it. It was easy to install, and is leaps and bounds better than the integrated GPU that came stock with mine and many other PCs. With this graphics card, Team Fortress 2 went from 30 fps to 160-200 fps. Skyrim (on low settings) went from an abysmal 15 fps to 50-60 fps. If you want to upgrade a low-profile PC, I would highly recommend this one. Side note- For some reason the fps improvement did not kick in until I went into NVIDIA settings and set my resolution to 1080p.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: I bought this card to only play games and I felt bad for buying this because of people saying it's bad in 2020 for 1080p 60fps but they don't realize this is not meant for 1080p 60fps on modern games it's meant for some 720p medium setting possibly high settings. I play games like TF2 and payday 2 and it plays on max settings 720p on those 2 games. I'm currently building another gaming PC with a gtx 1650 super, but I had an old dell optiplex laying around and decided to make it into a decent PC and this card brought it back to life.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card

For light duty office work like this, it is a great card... but for gaming, you're better off finding a used 680 or 780 (or 1060) that blows this card away.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card

I don't know it would hold up that great for more graphics heavy games, but for the price and the power requirements, it works really well for these particular use cases.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card

The product descriptions on Amazon help to overcome these issues.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Had trouble at first, but worked great after.
Customer Review:
I had a bit of trouble with this card at first. I used the included install disk and went through the steps, but when I tried playing games I found that some would stutter every second or so and it got very annoying.

After some troubleshooting, I uninstalled all the software from the disk and reseated the card into my PC. This somehow fixed the stuttering issue for me. Since then I have no complaints with this card. A modest yet great upgrade for my tiny Dell optiplex. Plus it has an hdmi input, which my computer didn't come with and is convenient for me.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review:
I bought this card for light gaming. It can easily run games like Minecraft and Terraria at 60 fps, and after disabling vsync I got over 100 fps in Minecraft. However, the card had one major flaw - running games in full screen would crash the system. I have tested this graphics card in multiple systems and have confirmed this crash is caused by this card. Overall, despite this flaw I would reccomend this card to someone on a tight budget.

Update July 1, 2019 - I am now having more major flaws with the card, causing me to have to change settings for five minutes whenever I start my PC. I would reccomend buying a used 1050 or 1050 ti instead of this card, or buying a 1650.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card

I'm driving 2/3 of the monitors on the card, and the third on Intel HD integrated graphics. No complaints so far.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card

The best part is you can use this card with pretty much any PSU. I'm currently using a 270w that came in the Dell. I even over clocked it a little. Great card!

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card
Customer Review: I bought this specifically to access full 4K on my low-end Samsung 40" UHD Smart TV but didn't want or need a high spec gaming GPU. This fit the bill perfectly. A good buy at $79.99.

GPU Name: Gigabyte GeForce GT 1030 GV-N1030D5-2GL Low Profile 2G Computer Graphics Card

GPU Name: ASUS NVIDIA GeForce GT 710 Graphics Card (PCIe 2.0, 2GB GDDR5 Memory, 4X HDMI Ports, Single-Slot Design, Passive Cooling)
Customer Review:
This GPU is for VERY specific situations. The individuals rating this one star quite possible did not know what in the world they were buying, were being cheap and simply bought the most affordable "GPU" or who knows what.. Let me just say that their reviews should be taken with a grain of salt.

The day this was announced I was ecstatic, this was the exact GPU I was in search of for quite a while. 4 HDMI outputs, Zero display ports, Zero Type-C ports, Zero VGA ports. JUST HDMI. Thats what I needed, ASUS delivered.

Let me give you a run down on my set up.. I have an Micro-ATX asrock x570 TB3, Ryzen 9 3950X, 32GB RAM and an RTX 20080. If you're knowledgeable on the Motherboard you'd know it only has one PCIE port. which is utilized by the 2080 GPU. I have this 710 connected via Thunderbolt 3. WHAAAT?! I have four 4K TV's connected to the 710 through TB3, downscaled to 1080P and 30 hertz. It runs like butter. The TV's are used for security camera feeds of 4 different sites running on Blue Iris. I offload all the video conversion/transcoding onto the 2080 as intended and utilize the 710 for its sole purpose, displaying static video. Thats exactly what this GPU is for, not for gaming, not for office work, rather for static imagery such as billboards, a wall of TV's, surveillance, etc. Dont expect this GPU to do any transcoding or high refresh rate situations.

The second unit I have is being used as interim as I await the delivery of another graphics card, GTX 1080. It powers, with no issue, an LG 3440 x 1440 34" ultra wide monitor with 21:9 ratio. Again, zero issues with the operation. I dont game on the PC yet until I get the true GPU in.

You cant compare apples to apples here, this GPU has 192 CUDA cores, in comparison my 1080 has well over 1900 CUDA cores. Know what you are buying, Know what you will be using this GPU for. For me, this device works as I initially intended and for that, THANK YOU ASUS! you really saved me from using two GPU's for four HDMI connections. The fact that I can use an external Thunder Bolt 3 enclosure to power and send data for the GPU is just amazing.. No regrets, highly recommend this GPU

GPU Name: ASUS NVIDIA GeForce GT 710 Graphics Card (PCIe 2.0, 2GB GDDR5 Memory, 4X HDMI Ports, Single-Slot Design, Passive Cooling)
Customer Review: I am running three full screen movies simultaneously on three 24-inch 1920x1080 FHD computer monitors connected to this card, and all three movies look fabulous. There are no buffering pauses, no jerkiness and the action is as smooth as any movie I have ever seen on any single-monitor computer. Folks, this is an amazing video card at a great price. For those who gave it one star, all I can say is they probably didn't realize that they needed to install the 64-bit drivers from the DVD that is included with the card. Without those drivers, Windows will default to a generic VGA driver, resulting in exactly the kind of slow, jerky video that the one-star reviewers complained about. Not only is this card displaying three different full motion, full screen, full HD videos simultaneously, but the GPU isn't even breaking a sweat! The GPU Tweak utility that comes with the card shows that it is loafing along at well under the clock and temperature maximums, with plenty of capacity remaining for a 4th monitor if and when I decide to add one. By the way, I bought this card to use with my multi-monitor trading setup, and it is more than up to the job. Price charts and indicators on all three monitors are crisp and clear, updating instantaneously as new data comes in. If you are a trader looking to create a multi-monitor setup on a budget, look no further. I am using this video card in a 5 year old Windows 7 Professional 64-bit desktop computer with an Intel i7-4790 3.6GHz processor, 12GB RAM and 1TB HDD.

GPU Name: ASUS NVIDIA GeForce GT 710 Graphics Card (PCIe 2.0, 2GB GDDR5 Memory, 4X HDMI Ports, Single-Slot Design, Passive Cooling)
Customer Review Title: Can not even play Youtube 1080 on a single screen.
Customer Review: If you actually need 4 outputs then get 2 separate GPUs. I guess it works ok if you have non moving things on your screen like spread sheets or text documents. But even the most basic of videos (even if I unplug all but one screen) and the video becomes choppy and un-watchable. Very displeased with the card. I gave it one star but if you NEVER watch a single video then I guess its worth at most 2.5 stars.

GPU Name: ASUS NVIDIA GeForce GT 710 Graphics Card (PCIe 2.0, 2GB GDDR5 Memory, 4X HDMI Ports, Single-Slot Design, Passive Cooling)
Customer Review Title: TERRIBLE. NOT FOR WATCHING VIDEOS AT ALL. JUST OK FOR BASIC WORK
Customer Review:
As in other comments, I purchased this card expecting to have a third monitor with HDMI, to play time to time videos in Youtube, as well as to open browsers and excel sheets for my work. Well, for work is just ok. For Videos is terrible. Specially if you attempt to watch them at 1080 resolution. Video stops every 5 seconds, and skip parts. Issue is not only with Youtube, but any video streaming via Chrome, Edge, or apps.
Not sure if it's because the PCIe X1 version (the smallest, less fast, slot of the PCIe family), but I didn't have any other option rather than buying a Card for x1, since my PC only has 1 PCIe x16 slot, and that one is being used with the original Video card RX 550, which works great with my other 4k monitors.
This GForce GT710 seems like an entry level card, maybe for windows XP. Definitely not for HD videos, YouTube (Let alone gaming)

GPU Name: ASUS NVIDIA GeForce GT 710 Graphics Card (PCIe 2.0, 2GB GDDR5 Memory, 4X HDMI Ports, Single-Slot Design, Passive Cooling)

GPU Name: ASUS NVIDIA GeForce GT 710 Graphics Card (PCIe 2.0, 2GB GDDR5 Memory, 4X HDMI Ports, Single-Slot Design, Passive Cooling)

Its kind of odd...

When I move the mouse into the screen that is being driven by this card the mouse pointer gets all jerky and slow - its nearly un-usable. If I'm playing a video on the 710 driven screen - its smooth and perfectly fine, UNTIL I move the mouse into that screen.

Maybe its really only designed for a system where all the video cards are the same.

GPU Name: ASUS NVIDIA GeForce GT 710 Graphics Card (PCIe 2.0, 2GB GDDR5 Memory, 4X HDMI Ports, Single-Slot Design, Passive Cooling)

Claims to support up to 4 monitors. I have 3 attached. With 2 of them empty/blank, watching a simple youtube video--not even full screen--has frequent stops, jerky action. I understand, this is a low-end card, but I'm not doing anything demanding with it and it's not keeping up. (These are cooking videos, NOTHING graphically demanding.) As for the ordering process--shipped promptly, arrived quickly, no problems with how the order was handled. But this is a good BASIC card. If you can afford something with more power, get that.
