I bought this card with no intent on every playing games like Project Cars, Dirt 3, Batman Arkham City, FFXIV, and more at anything above low-medium setting. After all it was paired with a Skylake dual-core Pentium processor. Man, was I in for a surprise. While Project Cars and Ghost Recon Wildlands and Max settings at 60 FPS, it CAN run them at 60 FPS and low-mid settings. Older titles like Dirt 3, Batman Arkham series, Need For Speed Most Wanted, and FFXIV for example ran at max settings. Even the Just Cause 1&2 and Saints Row 2-4 all run smoothly at 50+ FPS. Recently got Watch_Dogs and that too ran smoothly, though not at max settings.

So who should get this card? Casual gamers who just want an inexpencive gaming PC instead of a console. ALso, PC gamers looking for a cheap card to game on while they wait for better ones to become affordable. I'm probably upgrading to a 1060 (or just the 1050 ti) this year and I would recomend if you can afford the 1050 ti, get that instead and will hold until you get your 1070s or 1080s.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: The MSI Gaming APP is terrible. The video card is great.
Customer Review: Unfortunately this card still uses the venerable MSI Gaming APP for the overclock and LED light functions and it's always been a buggy mess. Constant crashing and locking up, and this has been on multiple PCs with various MSI graphics cards I have owned over the years. The card itself is great though. The overclocking settings in the "APP" isn't very much so you can run it stock without the software and still get great performance. The LED lighting though is another story. I've heard that Mystic Light will control the lighting but I'm not going to run another 3rd party program in the background just to have lights. The video card has only red lights anyway and my system is blue so I don't mind them not being on. Of course you can also use MSI Afterburner if you really feel like overclocking this card but it's not necessary. It runs very cool. The only time I have ever heard the fans come on is when I turned them on myself. After using a 750TI for several years this is a great upgrade for my old PC.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review:
After having this MSI GTX 1050 Ti 4GB low profile graphics card for a year. The fans are growling due to bearing wear.
I had a similar problem with the MSI GTX 750 Ti low profile card. I took off the fans and found a label on the back.
The fans were made by idcooler.1688.com. The model is listed as XY-D05510S. I went to the website and found that it is all in Chinese. The fans are 50 mm diameter when measured across the blades, 12 volt, 0.28A 4000 rpm, with a 2 pin configuration. It would be nice if I could order replacement fans. But apparently other people are having the same issue. MSI needs to use better fans.

I have built a fan shroud out of .025" thick aluminum sheet. HD sells it in 6"x18".

I purchased 50 mm ball bearing fans from amazon https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07KRVPYLP/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o03_s01?ie=UTF8&psc=1
they are smaller than the original fans. These measure 50mm at the outside of the housing. About 46 mm blade to blade. But the the rpm is listed at 7000.

I purchased a package of connectors from amazon as the connectors on the fans are too large.
https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07449V33P/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o02_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1

The large holes in the aluminum were cut with a jewelers saw. Bending was accomplished with a bench vice, pliers, fingers, and a non marring mallet.

The connectors on the two fans were cut and soldered to a single 2 mm connector.
I had some small shrink tubing that I used to insulate the solder joints
The polarity of the connector had to be reversed as they are wired in opposite to the one on the original fans . A pin was used to lift the plastic tabs that holds the connectors in place and they were swapped red for black.
I have included some photos. Note the position of the fan wires. The red is positive. If you try this. Be sure to wire it correctly. I'm currently running this board and testing it out. I hope that it does well when the weather heats up.

At least now, if a fan dies, I can replace it quick.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: I bought this for video processing, and it is working well for that. It was quite difficult to install into my Acer Aspire ATC-705 desktop, however, and I will describe the process for anyone else who might have that or similar machine. The Aspire has one x16 slot, and one express slot. The cord to the optical drive comes out of the motherboard where the NVIDIA card must slide in place. After removing the side cover and prying the expansion covers loose, it is necessary to disconnect and remove the hard-drive from its bay. Any card in the express slot must also come out. Then the graphics card can be angled and rotated into position, with the optical wiring coming up between the two halves of the card. Then replace and reconnect the hard-drive. There is barely enough room, but it will fit.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Perfect if you don't have luxurious 4k needs
Customer Review: I was looking for a decent but compact VGA card for my computer at home to do home office (i do design related jobs). Came across this 1050Ti from MSI and i was suprised how powerful it was. First of all it barely has any noise while you work and then i tried a few modern games too (recent releases from last year) and it could easily handle them in 1080p resolution. Of course during the gaming sessions you'll hear the fan power up but still for the price you can't go wrong with it. I've been using a factory re-furbished one for 4 months now, it came in perfect shape, i don't think anyone used this, haven't found any scratches anywhere. I'm super satisfied with the purchase.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Not as good as I thought
Customer Review:
The card works, but I'm not getting the performance others are reporting.
Running Intel i7 6200, 16Gb RAM, 3.4Ghz, Windows 7 Pro. Should be getting hash rate for XMR-STAK of 900+ H/S with this setup but barely getting 500. Have tweaked settings. Spoken with a couple of users running the same setup, and they are getting 900 H/S with one user topping out at just over 1k.
Also, it was shipped with a label slapped on the retail box. No other padding, protection, and not in another box. Also the box was NOT taped shut. I have no way to know if this is new or used since there was no factory seal on it. Even the anti-static bag it was in wasn't sealed.
Final issue: I guess the length seems to be different depending on where you measure from. I measured 7.2" clearance and this was listed as 7.09". I'm going to have to do a hardware modification to move my hard drive back to be able to close the lid on the computer as the hard drive rotates down in place and it won't quite clear the end of the card.

Customer Review Title: I got it when it was less than half its current price
Customer Review:
Right now during the pandemic and the large amount of scalpers over charging people. it’s better to wait for manufacturing to catch up with demand. Get a more powerful cheaper card in a few months. If you can find a good deal on a pre-built pc, then that’s probably your best bet for value right now.

Make sure when you get a new GPU that it fits your system and has a strong enough power supply.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Breathed new life in older PC
Customer Review:
My alienware x51 r2 had a GTX 750Ti and it was dying fast. It would stop sending a video signal until it "warmed up." So, I decided on a 1050Ti as I wasn't about to put more into this 3+ year old PC. Needed a small form factor (less than 9" or so) due to case size.

This 1050Ti was perfect. Short, not extra power to connect, and will play most current games decently. It took me more time to get the cover back on my PC (bent pin slots) than to unpack and install. Three screws and lift out bracket with old card, insert new card and put it and bracket back.

I already had the 330w power brick so I wasn't too worried about power requirements on my x51 r2. First power up needed to remove old drivers and install new ones. Bingo, working like a charm.

Excellent card for the money (even as video cards are still overpriced but not as much as they once were).

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: One of the best 1050s on the market
Customer Review: For durability I have it a 3 star because at the end of the day it's still an expensive computer component that you should be very very careful with. All it take is one drop, static shock from touching it after sitting down, or if you put it in wrong. Just be careful anyways for any thing like this. For gaming I put this in a basic dell pavilion, and it ran most new games and 1080p medium settings at 60fps. That's pretty expected for most 1050's but this one IS overclockable and I was running at stick so that's pretty impressive. If you can keep the temperatures cool enough, a overcooked 1050 can be equal to a 1050ti. But don't just go ham on the OC if you don't have a good cooling system because will literally end up lighting 150 dollars on fire...have fun kids. Always remember to not be too nifty, respect the 1050.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review:
2nd UPDATED REVIEW:
Paid 165 USD after taxes. my CPU is causing my bottleneck but still able to play games and nearly maxed 1080p settings.
Games; Witcher 3(ultra, lowest 45fps),CS:GO(max 120 with a 1%low), GTAV(auto:very high 55fps+). I haven't seen a decrease in performance since I have installed.
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED FOR ANY BUDGET or UPGRADE!!!
|
|
|(bottleneck fixed with new i5 cpu below)
|
UPDATED: 3/22/2018
PC Specs; Intel Core i5-8600k, 16 GB DDR4 RAM, ASUS Prime z370-z Mobo and same GPU.
This graphics card is insanely good, plenty of head room for those wanting to manually overclocking or those who just want plug in and play. I personally I have seen the fans start to turn at ~63C (23% fan speed, not even audible) .I have yet to see this GPU get past 65C. Core Voltage can NOT be edited, it'll show it in the MSI Afterburner APP but soon as a game is launched it'll drop it to zero (something related to MSI not allowing it trying to help keep their customers from experiencing motherboard dangers).
GamersNexus showed that Core clock of 150, Memory Clock of 500 is the only OverClock that is 100% stable and reliable, of which I personally found before reading the article.
This GPU crush's DOOM at 1080p ultra! GTAV at max settings (using GamersNexus settings) at a stable 35fps but could easily achieve a locked 60+fps with default in settings. CSGO at locked 200+ fps. Overwatch ultra but scaling at 100% locked 55FPS. For the 156USDD it was well worth the buy but NOT worth the current prices due to the crazy price fluctuations from miners and supply/demand.
I would only replace this card if it died (currently using the stable OverCLock for 14 monthsnow) on me, I don't plan on playing at 2k/1440p, this card is BEST for those wanting 1080p but don't mind medium settings.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review:
Easy to install! This card is amazing! I have an MSI build with a red ibuypower NZXT case and it matches! A couple things to keep in mind.

1) The card is pretty long! Make sure you have room in your tower! I suggest if you don't then move your HDD or SSD to another location.

2) This fan requires PCIE power connection! My previous card was a GT 510 Nvidia, so didn't require power. This card does and the MSI logo lights up. I'm was new to builds, so if you need PCIE power there are cords on Amazon.

3) Card fans may not be spinning! This is okay was the card fans only start spinning when needed to! This helps to reduce noise and power consumption.

4) Card is great for price for low budget builds! I can run PUBG smoothly with this! Totally recommend this card!

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB

Customer Review Title: Great Middle of the road card
Customer Review: the card plays Madden 19 really well (Seems to be frame capped anyway), gets descent FPS with Assassins Creed Origins on High @ 1080. It comes with a low profile back plate, dual slot that you put on the card, be careful doing this as the area is heavily populated with components where the screw that fastens the board and back plate together. One thing that bothers me is the temp when testing AC Origins when I switched from 720 to 1080 it shot up to 83 C and started to throttle back the clock to keep it under control (to be fair it was still 1600 well above the advertised 1300 or 1400 or whatever this one was, I have two, any way watch out for that and take counter measures if necessary, The way my PC case is set up is not very good, it pulls fresh air in through the front through the CPU cooler and blows it out right where the GPU is nested, so hopefully this is no fault of the card it's self, and you won't have that problem.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: This is a great card for light gaming
Customer Review: Fantastic value for money. Would be brilliant for a small form factor computer with the low-profile bracket installed. In my case, I do light gaming and my computer is not SFF (I have a mid atx tower) and just wanted there to be less clutter inside the case. I probably could have gotten away with a 1030, but I want a little overhead in case I ever do get a little more demanding with my usage. So for 4k streaming and non-AAA titles, this card works perfectly. The only thing that could have made this 5-stars is for it to have been totally silent, but I think it's unreasonable to expect that.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Green Tint that Won't Go Away
Customer Review: This video card ran great for almost 90 days. Very quiet and great graphics. Then one morning while reading the news (not a high powered gaming app) the screen developed sort of a puke green tint. I tried a few different pages, same thing. Tried adjusting color settings. No luck. Then this morning, along with the green, the screen was beginning to flicker occasionally. I thought my monitor was about to frizz out and I was going to order another, but just to be sure I pulled an old monitor out and swapped monitors. Everything still looks green, so it's definitely not the monitor. Hmmm. Any MSI reps want to weigh in on this one?

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: My son got a Lenovo desktop computer as a gift. The integrated video card was fine for youtube and browsing the internet, but was no good for gaming. The PCI slot was available on the motherboard but the power supply could not handle a card that needed additional power. This card was perfect for it. Super easy to install. This plays GTA V very smooth. Unless you are a hardcore gamer, this card is perfect for playing some casual games. It is quiet and does the job.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Worked great, played PUBG on low settings
Customer Review:
Worked great, played PUBG on low settings. PUBG requires a beast of a video card and thats why I upgraded to GTX 1080 (if you can afford it, get it!)

WoW no problems on medium/high setting. You will get some lower FPS during RAIDs but that is expected, after all this is entry level card.

Witcher 3 ran beautifully on medium to high settings good stable smooth FPS

Watch Dogs 2 low settings anything higher you get low FPS

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Works well for light/mid gaming, upgrade old PC
Customer Review: Worked in a Dell Optiplex 990 Desktop (I’ve seen pictures of it in a SFF- small form factor), I had a used slim desktop and wanted something to use for light gaming, works like a charm. FF14 and WOW run with no problems maxed. Needed low profile. Wish it was a little cheaper, but if you’re looking for something to bring back an old pc to life, this will prob be the card you want.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Great card! 4 stars because of the cost.
Customer Review:
This is an amazing card for a begginer gaming rig. This card in a used SFF Dell or HP is a sweet budget gaming desktop.

Has no problem playing GTA V on High settings and getting 60+ fps.

The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because (at least at the time I bought it) it was about $20 more than the Mini version.

BEWARE: Measure your card clearance on the Motherboard. I had to cut into my CPU heatsink to make room for this card in an HP Compaq 4300 Elite. The single fan version (diff brand) would have fit without modification.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: Bought this to replace a failing original Radeon 6670HD. It's small, quiet and works fine in the legacy Dell XPS 8300 pcie x2 slot running Windows 10. The card length doesn't interfere with the ram modules, but if you don't have a module installed in ram slot 4, you must flip the locking tab up or the end of this card will block it.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: Very good low profile card for the money. I had a little trouble installing the card in my hp sff g2. There is a usb 3.0 header that plugs in to the motherboard right where the heat sinks cooling fan sits. Rather than buying a 90°adapter for the header, I got out my pocket knife and was able to shave down some of the over molding on the header protector of the usb connector. It fit perfectly after that. I bought this for American Truck Simulator paired with my i5-6500 it runs very well. On ultra settings I'm running about 55-60htz on average. It works great for what I use it for.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Turned my Thinkcentre M91P into a little gaming machine!
Customer Review: The 1050ti is the most powerful (and most expensive), half height gpu on the market in 2018 and this model is great! In my system (i7 2600, 8 gb of ram) the card runs perfectly off the stock 240w psu. The fans are barely audible over the rest of the system during most scenarios, and kept the card running in the high 60's in Super Position (high 70's with a +175/+100 overclock) with a 68 degree ambient. Even at 100%, they aren't annoyingly loud (but you can definitely hear them over the rest of the system) and keep the card suprisingly cool with the minimal airflow of the case. I do wish they could make an SFF RX 570 tho lol

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: I really can't say enough about how great this card has been. A few notes though. I am not a hard core gamer. I play games for fun on occasion and don't really care if the settings are on ultra or if I'm getting 60fps. Don't get me wrong, this card handles all but the most recent games in highest settings on my ultrawide 1080 monitor. I bought this card primarily because it was supposedly quiet. My old GTX 660ti was a great card, but could be heard all the way into neighboring rooms when at idle, not to mention when in use! This card is dead silent. At idle and low load the fans are off and it makes no noise what's over. Even at max load, my case fans are loader than this card. If your not a hard core gamer and looking for an ultra quiet card, you can't go wrong with this.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Won't Fit Optiplex 7020 SFF Without Tweaks
Customer Review: Was excited to get this but then immediately disappointed once received. It's not the fault of the card itself. For others looking - if you have a Dell Optipkex 7020 SFF this card DOES NOT fit unless you replace the OEM PSU (which requires also purchasing special ribbon cabling). There simply is no room for this card. If you see in the description that it fits this model PC, just be forewarned that it doesn't without tweaks.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: Easy to install. Instructions tell you to go to MSI.com for drivers, but that site tells you to go to nvidea.com instead. No biggie, but the thing upsetting me is registering the card with MSI... The box has a serial number, but not the 'checksum', which is necessary to register. The card has a different serial number and a checksum printed on it. In order to get that info, I have to remove the card, then reinstall it. The 'checksum' should have been on the box, and with 2 different serial numbers, I am unsure which to use. Eventually, I will pull the card and figure it out, but it should have been easy-peasy...

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review:
I bought this as one of the final pieces to my build which is now a ryzen 7 1700, 8gb ddr4, 1tb hdd (ik i need an ssd lul), and this card. And this build was to replace my xbox one and become a pc gamer because i always liked the advantages pc had.
As for how this card runs? Amazingly, i dont have many big new games that typically get tested but heres a few things: (also this is all typically while streamlabs obs is also using the 1050ti to encode my stream)
Overwatch- i can get an easy 60fps on high on 900p and a stuttery 60fps on high 1080p.
WWE 2K19 (released 10/5/19)- so this is the newest game ive got and this i play on on 720p high and full crowd capacity and get max frames with no drops. I know past wwe games have had awful ports for frame rates so i bought this as a gamble and was pleasantly surprised.
PUBG- I run on 900p again but can get anywhere from 45fps - 60 usually. And 45 being the lowest usually.
Monster Hunter World - i switch between 900p and 720p on this one. This ones kinda weird when im streaming i play on 720p medium just so i can stay as close to 60fps as i can. But when im not streaming if i remember ill usually play on 900p medium-ish settings and and about 60fps as well.

Hopefully this helped someone, im not usually a reviewer lol :) but i definitely reccomend this card for ur pc build if ur comparing, i compared between a few cards before buying this one as well.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: nice little 2 slot low profile graphics card
Customer Review: Perfect graphics card to put in an old OEM system since you don't need PCI-E power cables, and one of the only modern GPUs that still comes in a low profile version, although it is still a 2 slot card. Gets up to 70ºC while gaming at 1080p in a system with poor exhaust, temps would probably be lower in a better cooled case.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: My son has a old HP desktop and we had already upgrading the cpu to the highest ability that the motherboard supported, and hed been using the same aging 6870 gpu for over 5 to 6 years, so i put this one in for him. Big difference. Its also less strain on his 600 watt power supply, which also seems to help his pc run better. Its amazing that even these old pcs will still run games on high settings with a upgrade here or there. Hes using; Phenom 9850(quad) , 8gb ddr2 (800mhz), 600 watt pwr supply, and this gpu. Strong little gpu this 1050.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review:
Awesome card, I've had faster, but for the money and the little head and watts, it's really impressive.
And you can actually buy one at will unlike a lot of AMD stuff.
Zero issues with this perticular card, I did have to specifically gat an active display port adaptor
while I thought from reading that a passive one would work with something this new, I might have misread.
All is well on three monitors with the active adaptor though.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Upgraded old PC for gaming fun
Customer Review: Added to an old PC (2012 really nice at the time with 16gbRAM) and made it capable of playing a lot more modern games. My PC only has PCIe2 so it can't take advantage of the PCIe3, but doesn't seem to matter because it will do the low end gaming stuff that's being thrown at it.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: What a video card for the money!
Customer Review:
What a video card for the money! I was impressed with getting both bracket sets, one for lo-profile and one for taller desktops. In Windows 10 Pro I'm seeing 2 GB of "Dedicated Video Ram" with total available at 10 GB! Its quiet, sleek and performs for all my needs.
I built a new unit with an M.2 WD 250 GB SSD, 7th Generation Intel Pentium G4600 (Quad core), 16 GB DDR 4 etc. So, this card complimented the whole package. This card draws very little power compared to some.
I highly recommend this chip and card.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: After a lot of research on best bang for the buck, I bought it. This was an upgrade from a GTX460TOP, and it was one heck of an upgrade. 2x - 3x the fps while increasing resolution and options to high.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: Sadly had my graphics card blow out & this was an affordable replacement for it. Works great, and was easy to install. It works for the games I play on high-ultra with minimal lag. I will need to replace eventually as it does have some lag in watching playback for video edit in adobe premier with 1080p vid (not noticeable in final product however!) this playback lag however is not unbearable or unworkable (more annoying than anything)

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: This thing has exceeded expectations! As part of my Kaby Lake build (MSI Z270 Gaming Plus mobo, Intel i7 - 7700k cpu, and so far only one G.Skill Ripjaws V Series 16GB DDR4 3200 SDRAM module + a GAMMIX S10 PCIe 512GB M.2 SSD) I have been blown away by the performance!! I can run WoW on Ultra settings + have several browser tabs of FoE open + have an interactive desktop (Rainmeter) running + a couple of Excel sheets open and my PC shrugs it off and asks, "is that all you got?!?" Love it!!

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review:
so far so good, btw, amazon or MSI, you sent me used one, the box opened before! any SFF user, it works on probably any SFF OEM DESKTOP.
mine is a lenovo thinkcentre M82, it works, but i'm not sure if you can overclock it, most SFF have limited pcie power supply ...

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: This is a great GPU if you're building a PC on a budget
Customer Review:
This is a great GPU if you're building a PC on a budget. You won't be able to play games on max settings at 4K, but I have played a lot of games at max settings on 1080p with this.

I'm very happy with this card since I was building on a budget, but since I have more money now, I will be upgrading to a 1070 soon. Nothing wrong with this card. It has served me well. I'm just personally ready for an upgrade.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: It fits perfectly in my Dell Optiplex 790 sff and turned it into a 1080p gaming machine :)

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: good buy even for an older desktop.
Customer Review:
Have an old i5 desktop running Linux Mint. Installed LG UltraWide 34" IPS LED Monitor - 21:9 display. The older ATI graphics card did not support this monitor resolution. So bought this graphics card to replace the older one.
This graphics card requires BIOS firmware update for it to work, else POST fails. Once the card is installed, OOTB drivers in Linux Mint / KDE neon / Ubuntu / ... works great.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Best graphics card in this price range!!!!!
Customer Review: I don’t normally post reviews but this card was so good I had to. I originally bought a 2 year old computer from a bank it came without a graphics card so I had to start searching for one. I checked over every card in the 100-200 dollar price range and this is the one that stood out to me the most. It arrived 2 days after I bought it and installation was a breeze. After about an hour o installing software and drivers it ran like a champ. The only 2 games I’ve tested it on are war thunder and world of warships but on both it ran around 80 FPS with no drops on max settings. This is the first graphics card I’ve ever owned and installed. It was also able to run without problems on a 240 W power supply. If your look for a cheap graphics card that will run any game you through at it and your on a budget this is the best card for anywhere near 200 dollars.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review:
I've had this card for about 2 months now and it's been pretty decent on a budget rig... kind of butts right up to one the hdd or fan on my hp 8300 I ordered off of here, but there hasn't been any problems really.

Performance wise, it's been decent. No slowdowns unless I really ramped up every option I could think of.

Overall, very happy with this card. Decent price, good performance.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: I'm not a very avid gamer, mostly playing World of Tanks, and various realtime strategy like Starcraft, Age of Empires, or Command and Conquer. For those games (running in 1920x1024) this card is amazing. If you are a fan of the "Homeworld" series games, you can crank everything up and the space battles look epic! The fans get a little noisy when they crank up, but do an excellent job of yanking the temperatures down and keeping them down.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Maybe the best budget GPU you can buy
Customer Review:
Maybe the best budget GPU you can buy, I bought this for about $150 back in November 2017 so it's amazing for what I paid. I use it with a Pentium G4560 CPU. I play all my older AAA games at 60fps at ultra/high settings (Skyrim is 60fps on ultra settings). Ultra settings will drop to 50fps in demanding situations for brand new AAA games like farcry 5 and even 40 - 45fps at times, but lowering to medium/high will give solid 60fps.

If you plan to play 4K games you are going to have to lower the settings to medium for solid 60fps, ultra/high will be more of a 30fps gameplay. In my opinion you should grab a better GPU if you want 4K gaming with high/ultra settings.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review:
I have the Dell Optiplex 9010 (I believe the SFF), and I had NO issues with this graphics card. This was the first graphics card that I ever installed, and it was SO EASY to use.
Before the graphics card, I tried playing FrostPunk. Great game, but it requires SUCH HIGH FPS. My poor little computer couldn't handle it. It was constantly lagging and choppy, even at the lowest resolution settings. One little installation of this graphics card, though, and everything runs so smoothly now! So happy I made this purchase! :)

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: From a 560gtx ti, and some odd years later. We get a very happy customer
Customer Review:
Definitely a right decision to go with msi, not only does it look great, performs well, and runs whisper quite. It's extremely efficient since the full power of the msi only kicks in when you need it.

It doesn't hurt he card to look amazing, and combines extremely well with my NZXT Full atx red/black case.

Anyone looking for budget gaming, look no further.

Be wary of power requirements, the instructions show two power pins, but in reality it only needs a standard 6 pin connector.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review:
no issues what-so-ever, good for a budget gaming PC build, or if you just want to upgrade an older PC, my only complaint is that in some games you have to turn the settings down as the cars meets the bare minimum for brand new titles, but other then that it's good if you are just looking to upgrade an exsisting build to modern specs or making a budget gaming build its worth the money,

if you have the funds right now and on the fence, click that buy button, works great

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: "Cute" comes to mind when I hold this card in my hands. It can't hold a candle to my old GTX 980, but for about 100 bones it can't be beat. It's silent, it runs cool and uses very little electricity. It supports 3 displays in UHD and is good to go with the most modern games, although not at the highest settings. The black and white matches very well with MSI's motherboards in the same price bracket, and looks beautiful plugged into my MSI Z170A SLI. This no-nonsense GPU is perfect for a first build or a budget gaming rig.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: I'm playing mostly Skyrim Special Edition, and this card maintains 60 fps except in rare cases @ 1080p, ultra quality. The card is reasonably quiet. It jumped $30 in price a week after I bought, was up $50 after two weeks, so good timing on my part. I don't know if there is any significant difference in the types. I bought this one (ITX 4G OC) because it was cheapest and in stock, the rest were on a two week waiting list.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: Used this to upgrade an old self built desktop, replacing a GeForce 660GT. Installation was easy, though you will need to go to Nvidia's site to get the most current driver for this card (457.09 at this time) as windows will install an older one by default. Runs Path of Exile at 1080p 80 FPS silently. Noticed that the fans do ram up when the framerate goes beyond 140. Outside of running games the card is very quiet. Love the lights on this. Would not run without connecting the 6 pin power connector but that may be the fault of my old Asus P8Z77-V LK motherboard.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: While this card may be out of stock it is a great card to use. IT is easy to over clock with either MSI After Burner or the the one click solution the MSI Gaming app. Before I had fans in my computer it ran at about 40 degrees. Now its ranges at about 20 with a couple of fans. It is very stable and is a huge upgrade from a lap top. With the 4GBs of VRAM you wont have to worry about using it a 1080p. I really do recommend getting one of these card. Its a great bang for your buck!

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: I wish I would have found a different video card. The reviews were deceiving. This card is just powerful enough to play most of my games on the lowest possible settings. For the price I paid, I would expect to be able to get decent performance out of it. Wolfenstein: The New Colossus gave constant video performance warnings while trying to play it with this video card.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Excelente card for entry lvl gaming and beyond for a great price
Customer Review: I'm amazed with how good this little card is and how little power it requires to run, cuz its really darn good, I bought mine from the amazon warehouses, it said the box would be damaged but it was barely touched and the card is actually really good, came out of the box with a boost clock of 1740hz from the default 1470hz, so overall I'm really happy with my purchase.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: la entrega fue rápida, así como un buen servicio al cliente, en lo particular no me sirvió la tarjeta porque como se muestran en las fotos cubría completamente el puerto que alimenta a la placa madre, porque la que tengo es una ITX, pero bueno es mi caso particular, espero les sirva a alguien mas esta valoración para que no cometan el mismo error que yo, Dios bendiga al que este leyendo

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: It is hard to imagine how this got through MSI quality control. One fan spins wobbly and therefore makes noise. The other fan is perfect. This was the third card I bought from Amazon in one week. The first two from a different manufacturer had black screen after the driver installed. This one works perfectly except for the fans which is why I give it 2 stars. I am going to keep it because I am tired of returning cards. I contacted MSI and asked for a replacement and I would ship this one back upon receipt (because I need a card) and they said no - deal with Amazon.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: I've had this for about a month now and am very pleased with it. My PC build is minimal: <400$ dual-core AMD with integrated graphics. Fortunately, it sucks straight from the mobo so I didn't really need to worry too much about the PSU. Is able to handle light gaming with ease. It can handle everything my little 2-core AMD A4-7300 could throw at it, and then some; a LOT of some, which prompted me to finally get a well needed CPU upgrade.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: fortunately I have a monitor that has HDMI inputs so ...
Customer Review: Works well enough for playing relatively older games. Note it doesn't support VGA monitors at all, I tried with a HDMI - VGA adapter and it just didn't work, fortunately I have a monitor that has HDMI inputs so I could just use that.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: This review is for the MSI GTX 1050 TI 4GY OC I just got it today so I'll tell you what I think so far. I've I upgraded from a GTX 750 TI and I have to say the difference is very noticable. Gameplay is smooth and fps was great. And when I played Rocket League it just really came alive tha graphics were alot better than i was used to and overall gameplay was so much better.But like I said I just got it so we will see but I am very happy right now

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Great for gaming, graphics designing, and video editing!
Customer Review: In my opinion this is the best graphics card you can get for the money. Pared with an Intel I5-4570 and 8GB DDR3 (1600mhz) RAM. I average 50-60 fps in Far Cry 4 on ultra settings. Needless to say this is a very cheap and capable graphics card. Would definitely recommend!

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: Msi 1050 ti 4gb gaming x. I have waited about 3 months to write my review on this card and will say that it runs the games I play flawlessly. I'm not big on a lot of games but I do play a mass majority of big titles. Battlefield 1 on mainly high ultra running at around 55 to 60 fps. PUBG at an average of 46 to 65. LOL runs way high at 135 fps in heavy fights. Rust is a consistent 50 fps. The game that works this card so far is ark at 42 to 48 on high settings. This card has not given me any issues at all does the job and honestly don't want to get anything better for now. Msi has won me over with this card.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: 1050ti still good for some top titles today.
Customer Review: Runs fornite and pubg without any frame drops with property settings. Love playing witcher 3 on it also. Internal its all Nvidia no matter the design. I went with MSI since I like the look and the dragon logo on fans. Red LEDs show nicely on it too. Plus I won't buy any used ones since miners kill their life span. Go new when it comes to your gpu. Your PC will love you back.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Great for computers with weak power supplies
Customer Review: This video card lets me play modern games at reasonable settings. My computer is kinda old, and has a particularly poor power supply. Despite that, this card runs well (not trying to overclock anything), quietly, and at a relatively low temperature.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Nice for DirectX-11 upgrade and higher res graphics and GPUs
Customer Review: I was able to upgrade to DirectX-11 after installing, which helped speed and detail rendering with a game and with Autodesk use. I have been able to use the many GPUs with Autodesk animation rendering that speeds up draft animations tremendously from hours to minutes.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: Easy to install, works like a charm (So long as you know this is an entry level/budget device that cannot compare to the cards that cost 3X this), and didn't break the bank. Not much else to say. Replaced a GT 710 (came with the computer as a means to connect a display, processor and mobo did not have GFX card) and kicks the 710's behind.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: Popped this card into a Dell 790 SFF and it rocks. I just played Assassin's Creed Odyssey at 1440 res (HP Omen 32" monitor) for a couple of hrs at high settings, flawlessly. Dual fans are a big plus. Incredible performance, especially at the price. Card also let's you activate Freesync thanks to nVidia's new drivers that just came out.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Great for those old Optiplex systems.
Customer Review: Bought for an old Dell optiplex with an i7 2600 and it performs really well. Customer Review: If you don't need the top end gaming platform this does the job jus fine. Needed a card for Ryzen that had no graphics, may as well step up to this and get something that could do gaming, movies and images fairly well. This is a decent choice.

A huge upgrade for my Lenovo M91P SFF.

No need to upgrade my power supply as it has little power consumption.

Thanks, Amazon! Definitely worth it!

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: can makes out pretty much any game out there with an old 1366 ...
Customer Review: Beast graphics card, can makes out pretty much any game out there with an old 1366 by 768 monitor which is exactly what i have, btw came in perfect shape and ran smoothly after installing drivers woot xD

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review:
I ordered this to replace my AMD Raedon RX 460 card, as I didn't want to order a new power supply as well as it's the same wattage, and the performance boost is noticeable.

In the virtual world, Second Life, with the old card, I had to limit draw distance to 32M max, and down to 8M at certain places, otherwise I'd start to freeze up. Since getting this card, I've been able to go to 128M, and raise the graphics quality with no degradation of performance.

For the price, this is probably the best card to get.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: Normally happy with MSI Products. Ordered this in November 2019 and installed in December. Less than 1 year and it seems to have died. No signal on DisplayPort or HDMI without any system changes. Have uninstalled / rebooted / etc with no change. Really disappointed for such an expensive purchase.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Best budget card you can get!
Customer Review: This card powers my system and the results are way better than I had expected (GTX 1050Ti 4Gb). Runs almost everything I have thrown at it at high/ultra settings. Runs PUBG on the highest settings, plays squad on the same. Really no need to waste money on a 1060 while the prices are inflated. Great card for the cost, not much else to comment.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: For a more than competitive price, you're getting a bona fide, 1080p-pushing card that's quiet, uses easily obtainable drivers, and doesn't require extra power on top of the MOBO supply. Oh, and it can fit in most any case, and comes with smaller plates. Would recommend to any casual builder trying to game or A/V edit.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: The card itself is pretty decent. It will play most games with decent FPS and quality while not costing too much. The downfall with this card is how unreliable it is. You spend 200$ for it to last maybe a year? Like that is such a joke in my opinion. I won't be buying another one from MSI for that very reason. One year is not how long a card should last.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: this graphics card can run all of my games including "the witcher 3" "skyrim" and "destiny" at max graphics settings and no lag. the lowest fps you will get from these games is 30fps and thats on max graphics setting which is plenty! if you keep the graphics setting on high and not max you can keep a steady 60fps. overall would recommend for first time computer builders or for anyone that wants quality without spending an arm and a leg.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Great value and upgrade for my older PC!
Customer Review:
I replaced a huge GTX560 card in my older PC with this guy. The old card was so big it had its own power connection!

This new card is a very welcome upgrade in terms of space savings and performance. This handles all the older games I like to play with ease, and does well with a lot of current games as well.

The card has been totally stable, no issues whatsoever.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: Purchased MSI GTX 1050 TI Gaming X to replace fried MSI GTX 670 on an older PC. Replacement was a simple matter of deleting the old card driver, updating Bios Version, unplugging the old card and pulling it out, installing and plugging in the new card, and, finally, downloading and installing the driver for the new card. It seems to be working fine using the same settings as the old card.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: Great GPU for the price! Brought an old computer from 2011 into the current age. Installed on a friend's pc which had a gtx 650 and this blows it out of the water. Now he can plays most games at 1080 on medium and sometimes high presets. Doesn't require any psu connections, only requires pcie socket for power source.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Price to performance is an excellent deal. There is zero overclockability however due to ...
Customer Review: With rebate only paid $80 + taxes. Price to performance is an excellent deal. There is zero overclockability however due to the fact that bios pretty much has all settings on lockdown so don't count on using msi overclock software to change that. Also, it sips all power from the motherboard so there wouldn't be much overhead room anyway unlike some oc cards that have external pin power. Since it delivers what it says it delivers perfectly well, it gets 5 stars. Also of note, it's rather small so excellent form factor and there are no lights or other glam on this version 1050 (the short card).

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review:
I bouth this last December 21, and I used it just for 4k video on youtube and movies but it just stop working, fans are spinning but no video, I switch the video card for a hd 5450 and it works but not for the 1050 ti, I also tried in a different motherboard and no video.
I try to contac the seller but it shows "ERROR".
I hope the seller see this and contact me to see what we can do. Thanks.
Overall nice, easy install, grat video card and no power connector.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review:
For anything like mid-range gaming to playing on high setting at over 300 fps on fortnite, I would recommend this to anyone on a budget that wants to play triple a games.
Only problem I had was that the fans never turned on until I got a program called "MSI Afterburner" that finally told windows to register the fans I guess?

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: It was great working on hp compaq elite 8300 sff

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: I adjusted some of the settings including vsync and some others as recommended by searching online
Customer Review:
I threw this into a SFF 8200 Elite office PC I picked up for $20.
The only reason I've rated it as 4 stars rather than 5 is the first one generated some horizontal tearing as I had it connected to a TV. I adjusted some of the settings including vsync and some others as recommended by searching online, but had no relief, so I had to send it back for a replacement. It was pretty simple and while the second one initially did the same thing, readjusting the settings (to the same I'd tried with the first) addressed the issue.

Definitely worthwhile as it turned a total of $170 into a beast that runs PlayerUnknown's Battleground at 65-75 FPS on an i5-2500.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: It is handles the games I have been playing very well. I may end up changing to a card with more ram on it in the future as games get even more detailed but for now it works really well for the games that are out currently. Getting use to the programs that it runs does take some work. But after a while you will get the hang of changing the settings around as they are needed. Highly recommend for any gaming pc.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review:
Bought for a HP small form factor pc that has fast cpu - but graphics needed serious help.

This was the only thing I could find that would fit, not require new power supply, push 3 monitors with high resolution, modern, and affordable.
So big thanks to Nvidia and MSI for accomplishing all of that in one card.

Not using for games so can't speak for that but some business apps that are graphic intensive were crawling before and have now come to life.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB

Like I will be doing nothing and they just crash. But it does do well with the games I'm playing (castle Wolfenstein 2). Lot's of bang for the buck. I have not tried a new game.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: Had read a lot of good things about this company. Installed card with no problem, only con was that the site was a little difficult to navigate. Card was worth the money excellent display. I am not a gamer so was excellent for general use.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: This is the perfect balance of power draw and performance. It's definitely not top of the line but far from being cheap junk. Using this in a budget PC build for a customer . It plays most modern titles with ease .

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: so its perfect. I may even order 1 more to SLI ...
Customer Review: Fast, quiet, and just the upgrade my old PC needed. Im using it for some music apps and bitcoin mining, so its perfect. I may even order 1 more to SLI for more power. MSI is a name i trust, and the Twin Frozr series hasnt let me down since the Nvidia 6 series.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Easy to install great performance even on an under powered PC.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Way better than any card within its price range

I tested the games on 1080p resolution and using an i5. Lack of tha 6-pin power connector is a plus. Max temperature reached on stock settings is 78 degrees Celsius. It is value for the dollar. Arrived in Kenya barely a week after purchase.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: Great budget card. Was simple to install and update. Has worked flawlessly no matter what I've thrown at it. I play Skyrim on the highest graphics settings and use DAZ3D and Photoshop with this card and it does not miss a beat. I would have bought a higher end card if my budget had allowed for use with DAZ3D as rendering images would go faster but I cannot complain about how this card handles. I would definitely recommend this card to others and I have recommended the card to friends!

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB

Customer Review: Had some problems trying to get it into my HP motherboard, had to buy a riser board to get it over the stupid plug that they move next to the video slot I can’t use one hdmi slot but card works great, love it and have recommended to many others. Haven’t recommended HP to anyone😁

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: ... power cable for more overclocking headroom so I would recommend that one if you have the extra cable from ...
Customer Review:
Gigabyte has a ti for about the same price with an option to connector an extra power cable for more overclocking headroom so I would recommend that one if you have the extra cable from your power supply. Otherwise this is a great graphics card but I just wish it had that optional extra power connection. I did manage a +120 ish mhz overclock though without touching the voltage.

TLDR: if you have an extra connection on your power supply get the gigabyte one with that option, otherwise this is great.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Perfect Fit for any SFF machine!
Customer Review: Installed this video card in a HP Elitedesk 800 G1 SFF machine. Fits perfectly within the case. I would recommend this video card for any low profile build! Runs great off the standard power supply, no issues.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: Fits perfectly and works well in a Dell Optiplex SFF as well as a Lenovo SFF.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB

This card has been working great for me ever since I bought it. Rock solid stable and great FPS for its power consumption.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: I was excited to receive my Video Card so quickly. But now I am wondering if it works. Amazon delivered it in it's original package (unsealed). Not even a piece of tape. GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Great & Easy Install - Minimum Card needed for playing Baulder's Gate 3
Customer Review: Great & easy install as long as you Download & Install your drivers before you plug in the card. I updated my Desktop Graphins card from MSI Nvidia 570 2GB to this MSI Nvidia 1050 4GB LP. It was quite an improvement. 6hrs of game time turned into 1hr with the reduced lag time of panning left. It is probably the minimum I would go to play this game. A GTX 1660 6gb would probably smooth it out a little more but I am happy. My son's GTX 2070 is really fast and flawless but would not fit in my small case and is out of my budget range.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: Bought this for the XPS 8300, dropped it in with ease and wow what a difference it made!!! Easy instructions, driver downloaded and was easy to install.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review: Piece of crap made by an uncaring and unresponsive company. Have tried to get this replaced via warranty options but they don't respond and don't answer the phone. Used this card for one day then got a no signal. None the ports work anymore. Cooling fans don't run. It's dead...

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Wish it was a little shorter
Customer Review: This doesn't quite fit in a Dell 990/9010 SFF, it will fit in the desktop models, but it's just a little too long for the SFF. The Gigabyte or Zotac cards are a little shorter and work just fine.

GPU Name: MSI Computer Video Graphic Cards GeForce GTX 1050 TI GAMING X 4G, 4GB
Customer Review Title: Best card for the money if VR games not a necessity.
Customer Review:
Best card for the money if you don't care for VR games. Plays all non-VR games with high resolution and at least 30 FPS. Ultra graphics will not always be available and the card is average for VR games - not in the top end of Steam VR benchmarks. However, ultra graphics and high-end VR are typically at high-end prices.

With rebate, sweeter deal.

GPU Name: EVGA GeForce GTX 1650 KO Ultra GDDR6 Gaming, 04G-P4-1457-KR, 4GB GDDR6, Dual Fan, Metal Backplate
Customer Review: This is a good graphics card for low to medium gaming use. Its great for editing videos and pictures. Card can run GTA 5 at 60 FPS at 1080p. Any other game like Fall Guys, Minecraft, Overwatch, L4D2 and 1 run great as well. If you're on a budget and don't fancy the newer games and just want a rig that can run some fun games, I would recommend this card.

GPU Name: EVGA GeForce GTX 1650 KO Ultra GDDR6 Gaming, 04G-P4-1457-KR, 4GB GDDR6, Dual Fan, Metal Backplate
Customer Review Title: Oh, how my blood pressure got normal!
Customer Review: Wow! Gorgeous card but not the newest or quickest, and EVGA now is like being in online heaven. I am just here for the first time, and I feel like I'm in another world online very coordinated!

GPU Name: EVGA GeForce GTX 1650 KO Ultra GDDR6 Gaming, 04G-P4-1457-KR, 4GB GDDR6, Dual Fan, Metal Backplate
Customer Review: Can get 60-70+ FPS with decent frame times on high or optimized graphic settings in newish triple a games.

GPU Name: EVGA GeForce GTX 1650 KO Ultra GDDR6 Gaming, 04G-P4-1457-KR, 4GB GDDR6, Dual Fan, Metal Backplate
Customer Review: Instalada y probada, no he tenido problema al momento, da buenos fps en resolución 1920x1080, calidad de gráficos en alta en gran variedad de juego incluso soporta épica en muchos juegos sin dar gran bajones de fps, temperatura adecuada para los dos disipadores que tiene integrados combinados con una buena ventilación en tu gabinete

GPU Name: EVGA GeForce GTX 1650 KO Ultra GDDR6 Gaming, 04G-P4-1457-KR, 4GB GDDR6, Dual Fan, Metal Backplate
Customer Review Title: Excellent GPU, value, quality, performance A+
Customer Review: Replaced a GTX750 with this one on a Virtual Pinball, this deavours the game with all effects and 3D effects on full.

GPU Name: GIGABYTE Radeon RX 5600 XT Gaming OC 6G (Rev. 2.0) Graphics Card, PCIe 4.0, 6GB 192-Bit GDDR6, GV-R56XTGAMING OC-6GD REV2.0 Video Card
Customer Review:
A good option for the price range, this rev. 2 comes already with the updated bios which will give it 14ghz memory speed instead of the 12ghz the first release came with.
I have ran a furmark test on 1080p and the max temperature was about 58 celsius, the fans does a great job cooling the card down.
Idle temps are about 40 to 45 celsius and the fans will start working once it hits the 56 degree @ 10xx rpm, which makes no noise at all. Coming from a blower gpu user, i love these features !

Package is quite simple, it doesnt come with any CD based drivers or controller; so you must download the ones from the AMD website.

GPU Name: GIGABYTE Radeon RX 5600 XT Gaming OC 6G (Rev. 2.0) Graphics Card, PCIe 4.0, 6GB 192-Bit GDDR6, GV-R56XTGAMING OC-6GD REV2.0 Video Card
Customer Review Title: 5 stars for graphics per $, but lights on graphics card messes up video output
Customer Review:
I have a rig built for work (Core i7-8700, 32 GB ram, 1 TB SSD) but because of covid, it was time to upgrade the onboard video card so I can play some games. Could't go Nvidia route because the PSU is skimpy (It's a Corsair, but only 450w), this fit the bill. Max out on the graphics on old games like Starcraft II and it consistently runs over 70+ fps. I'm sure I'm not going to get that with newer games, but I'm still working through a back catalog of games from the last 10 years that I'm sure I will be fine. I also don't mind lowering the resolution to 1080p (currently at 1440p) if it keeps the fps buttery smooth for newer games.

The only downside for this card is I had some trouble with it and it is what knock the rating down so much. For nearly a week, I couldn't get this card to work because as soon as I boot the computer, the video is skewed/garbled and nothing is viewable. I had to go back to the onboard video card while I troubleshoot. Turns out, it's the lights on the video card. As soon as I installed the software to control the lights and turn them off. The card worked fine. But this problem has been with Radeon cards for a while now from what I read (a few years at least), why does the problem still exist today?

GPU Name: GIGABYTE Radeon RX 5600 XT Gaming OC 6G (Rev. 2.0) Graphics Card, PCIe 4.0, 6GB 192-Bit GDDR6, GV-R56XTGAMING OC-6GD REV2.0 Video Card
Customer Review: To start off, a small shout out to amazon for delivering this product so quickly. International shipping said it would take well over two weeks to deliver this card, but it arrived in five days! Back to the card, it is a beast. It runs all my games flawlessly, even without a bios update, which surprised me a lot. While the card could get fairly toasty, but I just adjusted my fan curve to max out at 65% fan speed, which did not produce as much noise as I expected. The card could easily reach 80°C on stock settings, but a bit of fan tweaking fixes the issue. I also appreciate the mostly black and grey color scheme with a single RGB Gigabyte logo; really helps with customization. So far, I have zero complaints. 100% recommend this card, although be sure you purchase the Rev 2.0 version.

GPU Name: GIGABYTE Radeon RX 5600 XT Gaming OC 6G (Rev. 2.0) Graphics Card, PCIe 4.0, 6GB 192-Bit GDDR6, GV-R56XTGAMING OC-6GD REV2.0 Video Card
Customer Review: I really like everything about this GPU! Speed, temperature control, aesthetics - they're all fantastic. Set-up was easy, no BIOS update was required, and AMD's Adrenaline software works great. I highly recommend this GPU

GPU Name: GIGABYTE Radeon RX 5600 XT Gaming OC 6G (Rev. 2.0) Graphics Card, PCIe 4.0, 6GB 192-Bit GDDR6, GV-R56XTGAMING OC-6GD REV2.0 Video Card
Customer Review Title: Good performance, only has minor issues but is acceptable
Customer Review: This card has a high clock speed with rev 2.0 at a reasonable price. When playing games at high settings it runs smooth and never crashes. However there are minor issues with all 5600xt series GPU. It sometimes has blacked screen for a split second and occurs for a few times after booting up the system. But that's basically it. It wouldnt run into such issues during gaming and other GPU-consuming tasks. I think this kind of minor issues is acceptable unless you aim for perfection which in that case should go buy NVIDIA card. The temperature is only a little higher than Sapphire series card, but with pc fan cooling its not an issue.

GPU Name: GIGABYTE Radeon RX 5600 XT Gaming OC 6G (Rev. 2.0) Graphics Card, PCIe 4.0, 6GB 192-Bit GDDR6, GV-R56XTGAMING OC-6GD REV2.0 Video Card
Customer Review: Great card! Plugged it in, downloaded the updated bios and was gaming in no time. Card stays cool, the fans are silent, and the few games I have played so far have been perfectly stable. Highly recommended!

GPU Name: GIGABYTE Radeon RX 5600 XT Gaming OC 6G (Rev. 2.0) Graphics Card, PCIe 4.0, 6GB 192-Bit GDDR6, GV-R56XTGAMING OC-6GD REV2.0 Video Card
Customer Review:
I bought the first one for a friend who couldn't afford a gaming computer. I was really impressed with the build quality. The shroud is really sleek and cool, the LED on the GIGABYTE is nicey, and even though the plastic of the fans themselves look a little cheap to some it's a great card.
So good that I bought my other friend in New Zealand one.

Temps are always good when gaming, even in a case with low airflow.

Everything works as it should after downloading AMD's automatic driver update thing.

GPU Name: GIGABYTE Radeon RX 5600 XT Gaming OC 6G (Rev. 2.0) Graphics Card, PCIe 4.0, 6GB 192-Bit GDDR6, GV-R56XTGAMING OC-6GD REV2.0 Video Card
Customer Review:
Fantastic for it's price point!

Recommend adjusting fan settings if you're in a warm room. Thermal throttling under load with ambient temp ~83F/28C. No issues in cooler ambient temps (<70F/21C).

Running on an ASUS Z490P with 10600k, 16GB Vengence, 2TB NVMe SSD

GPU Name: GIGABYTE Radeon RX 5600 XT Gaming OC 6G (Rev. 2.0) Graphics Card, PCIe 4.0, 6GB 192-Bit GDDR6, GV-R56XTGAMING OC-6GD REV2.0 Video Card
Customer Review: Buen servicio recibí la tarjeta en el plazo establecido, al principio tuve dudas con respecto al envió a centro américa, pero se disipo cuando recibí la tarjeta en mi domicilio. En lo personal recomiendo la tarjeta, trabaja según mis expectativas y esta a un precio razonable en comparación a los productos de mi país.

GPU Name: GIGABYTE Radeon RX 5600 XT Gaming OC 6G (Rev. 2.0) Graphics Card, PCIe 4.0, 6GB 192-Bit GDDR6, GV-R56XTGAMING OC-6GD REV2.0 Video Card

Returned Card for refund. Would not boot into Windows just a Black Screen. Did some reading up on the card on over 50 different Tech forums, and nothing but Black Screen issues and complaints with this card.
Tried to contact Gigabyte for assistance and no reply from them. Purchased an nvidia 1660 Super instead, installed flawlessly with no issues.

GPU Name: GIGABYTE Radeon RX 5600 XT Gaming OC 6G (Rev. 2.0) Graphics Card, PCIe 4.0, 6GB 192-Bit GDDR6, GV-R56XTGAMING OC-6GD REV2.0 Video Card
Customer Review: I've never had such a headache with a piece of computer hardware as this. The computer is freezing all the time and I've also had a number of blue screens. I've removed all other hardware / software trying to diagnose issues with this computer only to find log files that point to the video card. I've written Gigabyte for support but no reply. I've always bought their video cards but this will likely be my last. GPU Name: ZOTAC Gaming GeForce GTX 1660 6GB GDDR5 192-bit Gaming Graphics Card, Super Compact, ZT-T16600K-10M
Customer Review:
This card is very power efficient and very, very quiet. That's where the positives end. Compared to the RX 580 (at $185) this card is a rip-off in the FPS/$$$ department. Team Red's 580 matches the performance of the 1660, yet it costs $35 LESS. For the cost-difference in comparable GPUs, the GDDR5 1660 is a waste of your money. After owning both the 1660 and the 1660 Ti, paired with a 9400F, I can say for certain, that if you MUST HAVE NVIDIA, get the Ti. For the $60 higher cost, you get about 30% higher performance AND it can even play games on high setting at 4K very comfortably. IF YOU DON'T GIVE A CRAP ABOUT NVIDIA, go with the RX 580 at this performance margin and save $35 for the SAME PERFORMANCE.

This 1660 is a waste of your money. NVIDIA should be ashamed of this card.

GPU Name: ZOTAC Gaming GeForce GTX 1660 6GB GDDR5 192-bit Gaming Graphics Card, Super Compact, ZT-T16600K-10M
Customer Review:
I've installed several versions of this generation (1050, 1060, 1070, 1080) from nVidia into other people's computers, and my old GTX 580 finally failed (one fan stopped spinning, the other was making noise and my screen would flash white a few times a day). This gave me a reason to upgrade, and I found 1060 to be the current best "bang-for-the-buck". I just wish the video card market was better now (I really don't like cryptominers).

This is the first time I purchased a card from with the ZOTAC brand. Once I chose the 1060, I based the purchase of this brand on the price and size of the card. I'm very happy with it. It works perfect with DP connections to dual 1440p monitors. I noticed that both monitors now show up as audio devices too, and it works, but the monitor audio is not very good, which is to be expected. I think I'll stick to my external DAC/AMP with headphones, but I thought that was cool.

The fan is quiet when not under load, but does get louder, but not super loud, when under extreme load. The only thing left to do is test how long it lasts. I'll update this review if I have any issues.

GPU Name: ZOTAC Gaming GeForce GTX 1660 6GB GDDR5 192-bit Gaming Graphics Card, Super Compact, ZT-T16600K-10M
Customer Review Title: Fits just right in a small build
Customer Review: Upgrading from an old budget build to a mid-range and this seems to do the trick so far. FPS is solid esp. compared to the old card (GTX 650). The card nicely fits in my mini-ITX case -- I had to move the optical drive slightly during installation but now everything is snug. Also reasonably quiet!

GPU Name: ZOTAC Gaming GeForce GTX 1660 6GB GDDR5 192-bit Gaming Graphics Card, Super Compact, ZT-T16600K-10M
Customer Review Title: a lot of bang for the buck.
Customer Review: I paired it with an i7-7700 and 16GB DDR4 Ram. Played games in 1080P ,1440 and even 4K. 60FPS at 1080/1440p at Ultra and 30FPS at High in 4K. The price isn't much more than a GTX1050 Ti and is less than a GTX 1060 , performs better than both.

GPU Name: ZOTAC Gaming GeForce GTX 1660 6GB GDDR5 192-bit Gaming Graphics Card, Super Compact, ZT-T16600K-10M
Customer Review Title: This is the best option if you want to pay msrp, Price to Performance
Customer Review: I love it, its quiet small and can fit in almost anycase and performs higher than it's rated boost clock about 1980mhz when gaming. It's also 10% faster then a gtx 1060 6gb in some games and about 10 to 15 fps slower than a gtx 1070, if anyone was wondering.

GPU Name: ZOTAC Gaming GeForce GTX 1660 6GB GDDR5 192-bit Gaming Graphics Card, Super Compact, ZT-T16600K-10M
Customer Review Title: Good balance between performance and price. Works great with Ubuntu 18.04
Customer Review:
I needed a decent card to drive my 27” 4K display on my Ubuntu Linux system while working from home that would also give me decent FPS in Steam (and would be delivered in a reasonable amount of time). Against my better judgement, I’d tried a Radeon-based card beforehand and it was an incompatible nightmare.

There are cheaper cards out there, but the ZOTAK had the GPU I wanted and a lot more RAM than some of the other options.

Installation was overall pretty simple. Pull the old card, drop in the new one and hook up the PCIE power cable. I highly recommend that you use at least a 650 or 750 watt supply. I had a Corsair 750 watt supply on my parts shelf that I installed at the same time and when I fired the system up, I was impressed that I didn’t hear a lot of fan noise.

I like to use the official Nvidia drivers since they usually have better management utilities and better performance. After setting the system to use the “multi-user.target”, I followed their installation procedure to blacklist the nouveau kernel modules and installed their drivers.

After rebooting, the system went back to the default “graphical.target” and things just worked from there on.

I did some testing with Kerbel on Steam and the display was crisp, clean and had a decent frame rate. I didn’t notice any extra fan noise and verified that the card continued to run cool. The two large fans do a nice job moving air while making minimal noise.

Overall, I’m pretty impressed with the card. It gives a reasonable balance between price and performance and has been trouble free so far..

GPU Name: ZOTAC Gaming GeForce GTX 1660 6GB GDDR5 192-bit Gaming Graphics Card, Super Compact, ZT-T16600K-10M
Customer Review: I have always found the GeForce to be the best for the price, UNTIL THIS ONE! Nvidia dropped the ball on this one... The card DOES work, and has 4 outputs that it can handle all 4 monitors great.. And when playing Metal slug to Mortal Kombat 3 it's amazing. But Forza, MK11, MKX, Battle Feild 4, Fallout76 even, the GPU is very weak.! I should have spent the 80 more to go with a better line... I will rethink my next purchase, Nvidia just lost a fan :(

GPU Name: ZOTAC Gaming GeForce GTX 1660 6GB GDDR5 192-bit Gaming Graphics Card, Super Compact, ZT-T16600K-10M
Customer Review: Overall I'm pretty satisfied with this g-card. I was originally shopping for a 1050/1050Ti but when I finally got around to buying one I decided to go with the 1060 and just pay an extra 50 bucks. It was VERY worth it. The performance on the 1060 (not event he Ti) really just doesn't even compare to even the 1050Ti and its only a bit more expensive. Like all PC gamers I'm still fuming over the prices of GPUs due to (it almost makes me vomit trying to say it) "Miners" so that is a MAJOR downside because no one should have to pay this much for a video card these days. Anyways most things about this card are good so I'm not going to list them all but the main ones is that it was easy to install and get into my PC and I've had no issues with it since my first use about 6 months ago now. Some downsides is that it runs hot so just be careful with that and the 3GB model is somewhat lacking on performance. So if you're looking for a bit better performance when running games I would grab the 6GB model or the Ti (they might be the same idk). Defiantly get this instead if you're looking at a 1050 because I would still consider this a 'budget' card but it just runs way better than a 1050 ever did. BUT if you wan't serious performance it's not even a competition the 1070/Ti/1080/Ti are WAYYYY better especially if you're looking into streaming. Zotac makes them very well and I'm very happy with it but I have to say EVGA is probably the better manufacturer as they don't run quite as hot.

GPU Name: ZOTAC Gaming GeForce GTX 1660 6GB GDDR5 192-bit Gaming Graphics Card, Super Compact, ZT-T16600K-10M
Customer Review: cool fast and perfect for the 1920x1080 monitors...update: had for short time..fan went out then on then out...got some BSOD and critical failure from windows 10....swapped out with GTX 970...booted....not sure if design or fan problem..anyway having to return and as way to expensive now could not get same thing so 1050ti? not sure. beware as if it is design then many will have this problem.

GPU Name: ZOTAC Gaming GeForce GTX 1660 6GB GDDR5 192-bit Gaming Graphics Card, Super Compact, ZT-T16600K-10M
Customer Review:
absolutely love this version of 1660! this cards over extended heat sink and exposed side heat pipes allowed me to add dozens of extra raspberry pie heat sinks! this brought full load temps down from 88c to 66c!!! and thats full load with 4000mhz memory and 1860 coreclock boost!

i wish more card makers would expose their copper heat pipes to the side for cooler modding, you can get 60x small heatsink chips for only $20 but get huge gains in cooling

GPU Name: ZOTAC Gaming GeForce GTX 1660 6GB GDDR5 192-bit Gaming Graphics Card, Super Compact, ZT-T16600K-10M
Customer Review: My son's pc only has an AMD FX6300, instead of buying a new system I upgraded the video card. His Occulus rift s works on this system. Their requirements says the CPU fx6300 wouldn't work, but it does with this card. VR is more cpu intensive than games per say, so the FX6300 is about the bottom of the cpu list for VR, but it's working flawlessly. Occulus and Vive would probably sell more headsets if they actually new which cpu's will work. b/c most people are buying a new pc just for it to work with VR. who wants or can spend that much money all at once, especially if you don't have too. I'll upgrade his pc later. Cheapest way to go is buy a refurbished dell with a tower case with i5 or i7 4th gen processor and a RX580 or this card. total spend around $400 for VR pc.

GPU Name: ZOTAC Gaming GeForce GTX 1660 6GB GDDR5 192-bit Gaming Graphics Card, Super Compact, ZT-T16600K-10M
Customer Review: This card is sweet, probably the best part in my whole system. All my games look so much better. Just wish it had one less display output port and had one DVI port instead.
