GPU Name: Asus TUF Gaming GeForce GTX 1660 Super Overclocked 6GB Edition HDMI DP DVI Gaming Graphics Card (TUF-GTX1660S-O6G-GAMING)
Customer Review Title: An Excellent budget card, a good performer.
Customer Review: I purchased this card as a stop gap measure while building my new system. I needed a card that I could swap in that would function reasonably well. I was surprised by how well this card preformed. I used it on my old system with a FX 8350 cpu and 32gb of ddr3 1600 ram, Asus mobo old system was M5A97 and it was great. It wouldn't surprise me if I had installed it in my new build (Asus B450-F mobo, ddr4 ram) for a test that it would have held up quite well. It's now in my son's system along with my old fx 8350 cpu, all is well.

GPU Name: Asus TUF Gaming GeForce GTX 1660 Super Overclocked 6GB Edition HDMI DP DVI Gaming Graphics Card (TUF-GTX1660S-O6G-GAMING)
Customer Review Title: Respectable improvement over GTX 960, but not fantastic
Customer Review: So I upgraded from a 2GB GTX 960 and sure, it's a decent upgrade, but after I think 5 years for about the same price.. it's triple the memory, but only about double the processing performance.. after 5 years. So the increase in performance in relation to the cost is underwhelming, but it's even more disappointing with the noise and heat. I had TUF components before my most recent build. The reliability was great. And while this card isn't terrible, TUF nowadays just seems to mean budget.

GPU Name: Asus TUF Gaming GeForce GTX 1660 Super Overclocked 6GB Edition HDMI DP DVI Gaming Graphics Card (TUF-GTX1660S-O6G-GAMING)
Customer Review Title: This GPU hits all the sweet spots
Customer Review:
I couldn't be more pleased. I upgraded my mATX gaming box, pairing this card with a i5-9600k, and it is EXCELLENT. I can play all my games at 1080p with top graphics settings and they are brilliant, and run smoothly. The GPU temps run idle at around 30c, and the fans are super quiet. The best part was that the card is smaller than my old ASUS STRIX GeForce GTX 970 Overclocked 4 GB, so lots more room in my mATX case.

I game on Linux Manjaro, and wish Nvidia worked with the open source community more, my only negative towards the company, not the card. Still, they do release proprietary drives to linux, and they run just as smoothly on linux as they do on Micro$oft. Love the card...buy it!!

GPU Name: Asus TUF Gaming GeForce GTX 1660 Super Overclocked 6GB Edition HDMI DP DVI Gaming Graphics Card (TUF-GTX1660S-O6G-GAMING)
Customer Review: I was hesitant to purchase this since the product page had pictures with chinese text. However, the product arrived swiftly and is functioning normally in my desktop. For this price I am getting above 60fps at 1080p max settings and that is enough for me; I feel as if I have not wasted a single dollar by choosing this card. My GTX 660 has lasted over 4 years, I hope this card can do the same.

GPU Name: Asus TUF Gaming GeForce GTX 1660 Super Overclocked 6GB Edition HDMI DP DVI Gaming Graphics Card (TUF-GTX1660S-O6G-GAMING)
Customer Review Title: Fast, great for 1080p gaming, affordable, good drivers (no bloat!)
Customer Review: What can I say, nVidia just does it right (these days). I had to replace a Radeon card, the card was good but the software/drivers were janky and were so fussy with various video playback that I couldn't take it. I went to this 1660 Super, for about $200 shipped and it works perfectly right out of the box, no fuss, it's a smaller card, fits in my tiny case in my living room for the HTPC/Gaming box there, so compact cards win big time there. This card is fast and cool and quiet. Drivers from nVidia these days are great, you can choose to just do the driver or the geforce experience, but HDMI scaling works perfectly even with HDCP enabled. This is why nVidia wins for me. I needed a good gaming card that doesn't make it a fuss to get good media playback (cough, Radeon software, cough). Overall great compact fast budgeting gaming 1080p GPU at the $200 price point!

GPU Name: Asus TUF Gaming GeForce GTX 1660 Super Overclocked 6GB Edition HDMI DP DVI Gaming Graphics Card (TUF-GTX1660S-O6G-GAMING)
Customer Review:
Value 4/5 - Compared to other GPUs currently, this 1660 SUPER is arguably the best value you can find for new cards, and only older Radeon cards you may find better "bang for your buck". I can only go 4/5 because the current GPU market is overall overpriced. Another plus is the low power consumption of the 16 series, that can save some money in the long-term. Compared to other 16 series cards, the 1660 SUPER is clearly the best option... the 1660 Ti has minimally better performance (3-5%), and the 1660 performance is significantly lower (-10%) due to older GDDR5.

Gaming 5/5 - For 1080p, I consider the 1660 SUPER to be the sweet spot. You can easily play everything on high settings, and my guess is it will be this way for at least 2-3 more years before lowering settings is a regular necessity. 1660 SUPER is a passable option for 1440p and high framerate gaming, but 1080p is for the majority of gamers.

Noise 4/5 - The fan is audible with this TUF card, more than I've heard with previous cards I've owned (RX580, GTX470). It's not terribly loud, though... and with the low power consumption of the card, you really have to try pushing this card to get the fans revving up high.

This TUF GPU size is compact and should fit many cases. Sag shouldn't be a problem, unlike with larger cards.

I recommend the 1660 SUPER for 1080p gamers. If you're more casual and not focused on the newest games, maybe the 1650 SUPER or a used RX570-580 may be more within your budget.

GPU Name: Asus TUF Gaming GeForce GTX 1660 Super Overclocked 6GB Edition HDMI DP DVI Gaming Graphics Card (TUF-GTX1660S-O6G-GAMING)
Customer Review Title: Best bang for your buck I can imagine
Customer Review:
When building a new PC, I knew that I wanted to play some more modern games on it, but I didn't want to break my bank on a graphics card. It took me a long time and a bit of research to finally decide on this card, but ultimately I'm so glad I did.

This card is a beast at 1080p gaming and hasn't stuttered on anything that I've thrown at it. Overwatch, The Witcher III, Crash & Spyro Trilogy, MGSV, Batman Arkham Quadrilogy - all run buttery smooth at high graphic settings on this card coupled with a Ryzen 7 2700x. My PC runs whisper quiet with normal temps.

For the occasional gamer who's still running an older 1080p monitor, I can' t recommend this card enough.

GPU Name: Asus TUF Gaming GeForce GTX 1660 Super Overclocked 6GB Edition HDMI DP DVI Gaming Graphics Card (TUF-GTX1660S-O6G-GAMING)
Customer Review:
I received the card yesterday, so haven't had much time to test it out as yet but wanted to leave my initial thoughts about the card, and will update it later.

I always believe that in a review should be about the product, because that's what we are reviewing and not the service received. That said, I was a little disappointed about the number of stickers stuck all over the box. Thankfully this doesn't affect the quality of the card.

The card is a really nice fit, and is smaller in size to what I am accustomed to. The card looks really nice, and is an ideal fit for any build as it is black in colour, so it will fit nicely in your case no matter your colour scheme. So far the card is performing pretty well, even though I haven't put it through any rigorous stress testing as yet. This I will do once the Sea Cables have been repaired and I am able to run at full performance without any other complications.

GPU Name: Asus TUF Gaming GeForce GTX 1660 Super Overclocked 6GB Edition HDMI DP DVI Gaming Graphics Card (TUF-GTX1660S-O6G-GAMING)
Customer Review: I wanted to upgrade my ASUS GTX 960, because let's face it, that's a 4 year old GPU. I chose this card based on affordability and specifications, and I am extremely impressed. I could have paid $100 - $200 more for a better GPU, but with my budget, this worked perfectly. After un-boxing and installing, I immediately went to benchmark (i.e. stress-test) this graphics card using Heaven Benchmark 4.0. Under high load, I get 60 frames per second, no stuttering, and an excellent quality of image. Next, I fired up my heavily modded Skyrim (300+ mods!) and the game runs like butter. So smooth, no stuttering, no image tearing whatsoever. Then, I loaded Star Wars: Fallen Order. Nothing but a smooth experience so far. I'm trying to find a negative aspect about this card, but since I've only had it for 24 hours, I can't find one(yet). There ARE better cards out there, but If you're looking to upgrade and you're on a budget, this graphics card is certainly top of it's class.

GPU Name: Asus TUF Gaming GeForce GTX 1660 Super Overclocked 6GB Edition HDMI DP DVI Gaming Graphics Card (TUF-GTX1660S-O6G-GAMING)
Customer Review Title: 静音機能は非対応です．御注意ください．
Customer Review:
ASUSのGeForce GTX 1660Super グラフィックボードは4種類が展開されています（2020年5月時点）．すなわち，エントリーモデル（1ファン），高耐久モデル（2ファン；私が購入したものです），ゲーミングモデル（3ファン）という一連のシリーズと，これらにDUAL-GTX1660S-O6G-MINI（別系統の2ファンモデル）を合わせた4つです．

ASUSは0dBテクノロジーという静音機能を有しています．
これはGPUへの負荷が低い時（非ゲームプレイ時など）にファンを止めて静音化するというもので，いわゆるセミファンレスという機能に当たります（名称は違えど，各メーカーのグラフィックボードにも同じ仕様がありますね）．
問題は，このページに表示されている3つのモデルがどれもその機能を持っていない点です（ちなみに，DUAL-GTX1660S-O6G-MINIにはこの機能があります．なんでですかね？新しいモデルなんでしょうか）．

私は静音傾向のPCを組んでいますが，この機能がないため騒音が回避出来ません．
GPUファンの最低回転数は1100rpmもあるのです！静音仕様でもないファンをこの回転数で回せば駆動音はそれなりです．音楽を聴いたりゲームをしているときは気になりませんが，静かな環境でデスクワークをしているときは低周波のファン回転音が常に聞こえ，不快に感じるレベルです．

これを避ける術はもうありません．私は悩んだ末，同機能を有した別モデルを購入することに決めました．高い勉強代です．

GTX 1660Superは，ミドルクラスの定番GPUになると思います．ゲーミングにすべてのウェイトを置くというより，様々な用途にPCを使う上でゲームもしたいという方が購入層になると考えます．私の失敗が，せめて他の方の糧になることを祈ります．

GPUとしての機能には触れませんでしたが，自身の求めるレベルを見誤らなければ（すなわちハード性能以上のプレイングを求めなければ）不満を感じることはないと思います．

GPU Name: Asus TUF Gaming GeForce GTX 1660 Super Overclocked 6GB Edition HDMI DP DVI Gaming Graphics Card (TUF-GTX1660S-O6G-GAMING)
Customer Review Title: Good, except for driver issue on Windows 10
Customer Review:
It's a graphics card, it graphics pretty good.

However, there is a issue with windows 10 and Nvidia drivers. In Microsoft's endless wisdom they pushed out display drivers with their windows 10 updates. These drivers don't let you install the proper drivers for your card, leading to frantic googling and swearing. Turns out you have to download a 3rd party tool to remove the previous drivers to enable you to install your own. Once that is done it's smooth sailing, but buyer beware, do your homework

GPU Name: Asus TUF Gaming GeForce GTX 1660 Super Overclocked 6GB Edition HDMI DP DVI Gaming Graphics Card (TUF-GTX1660S-O6G-GAMING)
Customer Review:
This is a great card for it's value. Runs Fallout 4 whith no problems at all while keeping in the 40 Celsius range. Usually the lower range. I just run it on the gaming mode in the tweak software. For higher end Graphic games, I only have to boost my fan speed from it's minimum 24% of rpm's to 74% of total rpm. GPU does run hotter between 70 C and 90 C.
Overall I really like this graphic card and if I can figure out how to cool it more without forcing my fan speed up. it will definetly be a super WOW card. They did a beautiful build here.

GPU Name: Asus TUF Gaming GeForce GTX 1660 Super Overclocked 6GB Edition HDMI DP DVI Gaming Graphics Card (TUF-GTX1660S-O6G-GAMING)
Customer Review Title: Solide, Schnell ohne viel Schick Schnack oder Tannenbaum Beleuchtung...
Customer Review:
Habe meine GTX650 Ti 2GB in Rente geschickt nach dem Sie mir Jahre lang treue Dienste Geleistet hat, aber der Speicher und sonstige Performance liegen ca 2 Jahre hinter dem "reicht doch noch",
Daher Die Neue , zum Packet es ist nicht so toll wenn Sachen nur in der OVP verschickt werden und dann die Ganzen Aufkleber drauf kleben ... ansonsten recht Ordentliche verpackt ....
Nach dem Auspacken die Optik Wirkt Robust und Solide ohne viel Schick Schnack oder Tannenbaum Beleuchtung...ein Arbeitstier halt ...
Einbau lief auch ohne Probleme Rund 2,5 bis 3 Slots in der Höhe sind etwas mehr wie meine Alte dafür ist Sie ca 3 cm Kürzer, Strom braucht Sie 1x 8Pin(6+2) ....
Jetzt zu Leistung ..... MEGA ! Ich zock derzeit nur auf 1080P und die Performance ist gewaltig (subjektiv) was bisher nur auf unterstem Niveau lief läuft jetzt mit hohen oder höchsten Einstellungen und doppelten bis dreifachen FPS ...
Zur Lautstärke kann ich nur sagen das Sie im allgemeinen in meinem System ( Gehäuse Lüfter 2x 200mm 3 x140mm + 2x140mm auf der AIO) nicht wahrnehmbar ist .... wenn Sie Jetzt noch die nächsten 2 bis 4 Jahre hält ist Sie Ihren Preis absolut wert !

GPU Name: NVIDIA Titan RTX Graphics Card
Customer Review: Performance is almost the same as RTX 2080Ti. Only a little more CUDA cores and DDR6 RAM. and clock speed is much lower than RTX 2080Ti. So it is definitely an overpriced graphic card. RTX2080Ti should only worth for $799. RTX Titan should only worth for $999.

GPU Name: NVIDIA Titan RTX Graphics Card
Customer Review: Disappointed. 3d mark score of 9706. My 4 year old AMD r9 390x scored comparable to a brand new card. I'm running a zenith extreme motherboard with AMD 1950x , 64 GB ddr4 gskill , 1 tb Samsung 980 nvme... somethings wrong with this card . I'm checking through everything on my PC to make sure I didn't miss anything or need any bios update . Nope all good. The card is trash. Update . A few days after this the card must have cooked inside my PC as I smelled some burning electronics. Keep in mind my PC has 14 high pressure fans inside so I know it was not hot as my average temp was around 48c . That was usually hot inside the case because of a lot of rendering. Called Amazon for support and it was a insult talking to their rep as they told me that it must be the PC. Time to reboot it. Ok lol guess what. Tried a different setup with windows and it was the card. Next try . Amazon says we tried calling nvidia for "help to you but they are close now" great. I can tell I'm speaking to someone from scammer revolts YouTube now. End result. The card is dead. I'm sending it back to Amazon and I have unfortunately ordered a lower end card to replace this. I got a vega 64 by Asus. I'm very disappointed in Amazon.

GPU Name: NVIDIA Titan RTX Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Excellent card for the right purposes.
Customer Review: Don't buy this for gaming. It is an amazing gaming card but its main purpose is AI, machine learning, CAD, photo & video editing.

GPU Name: NVIDIA Titan RTX Graphics Card
Customer Review: Quadro performance at 40% the price. Currently the best card on the market for machine learning research plus it plays games! 24gb of vram means larger batch sizes and depending on your data, more utilization of the card during ml training. Wish I could afford two to try out the new nvlink!

GPU Name: NVIDIA Titan RTX Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Great for Deep Learning, not gaming
Customer Review:
This card really only makes sense to buy for one kind of person. The kind of person that needs more gpu memory. I work with huge deep learning models that even with a batch size of 1, still go over 12gb of gpu memory usage. So i was thrilled that this card was released. It is a bit disappointing to not be able to stack them together in one system due to cooling issues, but I'm happy none the less.

Please don't buy for gaming. SLI 2080ti's will work way better for the same price. And one 2080ti will give you about the same performance, but at half the price.

GPU Name: NVIDIA Titan RTX Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Great Card, not just for gaming though.
Customer Review:
Initially I had wanted to buy two 2080 TIs as they came with 11 GB of VRAM and would be twice as fast as their 1080 counter parts. When the RTX Titan came out, the 24 GB of VRAM caught my eye and knew it was the card for me. When i got the card, it took me an hour or so to get it working with it's slower brother, the 1080, but once I started playing around, it did not disappoint.

My iray renderings come out much quicker, twice as fast as before. I'm getting double the framerate on every game i play- the card is so powerful that all games just go to maximum.

While it's a little expensive, the card performs very well, it being hooked up to two monitors while my 1080 is connected to four, giving me six total. The only major draw back on this card, which can be negated by tuning the fan profile, is the heat. I had to use third party software to crank the fans up to near maximum when the card is under full load.

Other than that, i've maxed the card out once with a single iray scene. Other than that, it's a solid buy.

EDIT/UPDATE: So I've been using this card for almost a year; games, CAD, Daz Renderings. It's a solid card at 24 GB of RAM and i've managed to max it out several times on RAM. it's a champ to say the least. I managed to render 5 different 300 DPI 6 x 9 images in 5 hours - simultaneously.

I definitely plan on getting a second card when the wallet allows. Please note the card's speed drops 200 mhz when it breaches 84 Celsius. a custom curve in MSI afterburner keeps it at 84 c or just under.

If you purchase this card- there will be a delay for funds verification. so that 2 day becomes 3 or 4. Signature required. As for gaming- it utilizes about 1/5 of it's total processing power to deliver (I cap at 60 fps).

GPU Name: NVIDIA Titan RTX Graphics Card
Customer Review:
If you can buy it you will not think it`s not worth.
It`s Better than Titan V and RTX 2080Ti.
And RTX 2080Ti may dose Self-ignition.
So I go with Titan RTX，Safe, gorgeous, unbeatable.

GPU Name: NVIDIA Titan RTX Graphics Card
Customer Review: Hands down a powerful beast for a consumer card. Handles pretty much anything thrown at in like a champ. The 24GB VRAM helps a lot for rendering and high use applications (of which I almost exceeded at one point). There is some coil whine when under heavy stress, but I noticed it actually got quieter the more I used it. Fans are decently quiet and you can keep it under 84C it in most applications. Price tag is mighty hefty and is definitely overprice by at least $500, but the performance is there.

GPU Name: NVIDIA Titan RTX Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: I like the NVIDIA Titan RTX Graphics Card.
Customer Review: I hope to purchase a second soon, if I need it. I am using this card on both Windows 10 and Intel Clear Linux OS, and using the proprietary NVIDIA drivers on both. Intention is to code both for machine learning and RTX. I have tested it lightly on some games, and it appears to be an impressive improvement over my older model 1080 Ti. I did not buy the Titan RTX primarily for gaming. My rating for value for money is not scientific, but a seat-of-the-pants feeling, for how it cmpares to my 1080 TI experience. This is an expensive card with lots of memory that is useful for neural networks and compute shader algorithms, but it is an entry-level platform in this respect. You can double this with two Titan RTX, for 48 GB, but before you think that is a lot, look at the NVIDIA site for full-on solutions that cost much more. One thing to consider is that the twin blower fans pull air from one side, and exhaust top and bottom through a heat sink running the length of the card--these do not exhaust out of the backplane like a commodity gaming rig does, they exhaust internally on most cases. This means that you need to consider your chassis cooling design differently, especially if you plan to use two cards. I like the design, it is actually more flexible. Use an appropriate chassis, maybe not your old GForce GTX chassis. My ambient room temperature is 75 F degrees, and I have six fans exhausting from a 6U case with lots of room around my single card, which is on a Thermaltake 16x riser. The card is cool to the touch while writing this review, and warm for the 3D I have tried so far. Hope this helps someone, ok, now I must get back to work!

GPU Name: NVIDIA Titan RTX Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Only buy if you know what it's for and still need it.
Customer Review:
For gaming, this is a near-total waste of money; just get 2080Ti instead. No game manufacturer is going to waste time targeting this card's resources.

This card is for deep learning and maybe other sci/tech applications. It's not even good value for mining crypto. Almost the only reason to get this card is to fit a large model (probably a neural net) into its spacious 24GB of vram, and for that purpose it works fine.

Don't think of it as an RTX card. Don't think of it as a Titan card. Think of it as a Quadro 6000 with the 64-bit flops disabled. Because that's what it is.

GPU Name: NVIDIA Titan RTX Graphics Card
Customer Review:
Initially I wasn’t sure if this has driver support for Windows Server 2019 but I tried it anyway. It works!

Just download NVIDIA GeForce Experience to auto detect the card and get the latest driver. But before doing so, here’s the trick — be sure to install the WLAN feature in the Server control panel. For some reason GeForce Experience requires the Wireless LAN feature or else it will crash upon startup. WLAN is included by default on other Windows editions but not on Server edition.

Here are a couple photos of what the card looks like in an HP ML350 Gen10 server. We are using this server for Milestone XProtect video surveillance.

GPU Name: NVIDIA Titan RTX Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Let's be clear, you're spending $1400 for a 15% performance boost over 2080 Ti.
Customer Review:
With the headline out of the way, this is the best GPU I have ever used, runs every game and software I want, I don't even need an integrated GPU, which is good because my CPU doesn't have one, but even if other programs are using 10% usage of it, it still performs better than RTX 2080 Ti, and I haven't even overclocked this beast yet.

If you're rolling in dough, absolutely worth the purchase, but if you're trying to pinch pennies and save everywhere you can, you have to figure out of a 15% boost is good for you, otherwise it'd be CHEAPER to SLI/NVLINK 2 RTX 2080 Ti together, and get even more performance... But then you have to deal with frame lag and how many games don't have proper SLI support, so if you want the best single performance gaming card in history, right now, this is it.

GPU Name: ASUS GeForce RTX 2060 Overclocked 6G GDDR6 Dual-Fan EVO Edition VR Ready HDMI DisplayPort DVI Graphics Card (DUAL-RTX2060-O6G-EVO)
Customer Review:
I wanted to like this card, I really did. I normally buy EVGA video cards, but their 2060 cards didn't have my preferred cooler style (blower with exhaust out the back of the case) and they all had fewer or legacy outputs which I was trying to avoid. So this card seemed like it was a good option. I've had Asus cards in the past which were ok and I stand by their motherboards, so I figured it was a pretty safe choice. Unfortunately this card's (thermal) performance was simply unacceptable.

I installed this card into a brand new PC I was building, with adequate cooling and power, but no matter what, with stock settings, the card would overheat and lock up the machine within few minutes of starting a game. I played around with the fan profile in the provided Asus GPU Tweak II software and was able to get the card to run stable for longer, but even that would eventually result in a lock up. The only thing which seemed to remedy this was setting the blower to run at 100% all the time (which sounds a bit like a hair dryer).

I don't overclock, I prefer simplicity and stability to the constant tinkering required to get every last ounce out of my hardware. When I plug in a video card, I expect it to work with stock settings. This card failed to do that. Whether it's a manufacturing defect or some bad firmware resulting in a broken default fan profile, I'm not sure. Honestly, I paid too much for this card to want to find out. I've returned it and ordered an EVGA card, hopefully that'll perform better despite the less desirable cooler and port configuration.

GPU Name: ASUS GeForce RTX 2060 Overclocked 6G GDDR6 Dual-Fan EVO Edition VR Ready HDMI DisplayPort DVI Graphics Card (DUAL-RTX2060-O6G-EVO)
Customer Review Title: Mine performs about the same at the 1070 (if you don’t mind the loud clicking at 5000 rpm)
Customer Review:
it can run most of the games i played so far on ultra without any noticeable frame drops. game in my inventory include origin premier games like bf 5 and anthem as well as steam games like Farcry 5, Fallout 4, metro last light and gta 5. The only time i found any issues was in battle field 5 when i turned DXR on for shits a giggles. It ran surprisingly smooth every where but the city and even then it was only at the start of the map. The actual game play wasn't effected.

As far as noise goes i've had a dual fan gtx 660 and a dual fan rx 580 both louder than this card even when it ramps up. i had to open the side case to make sure the fan was running. This is my first blower style card and i always hear they have noise issues but it's the quietest video card I've had in years.

Far as price per pound this thing seems to be neck and neck with a 1070 and those are another 100-200$ new so i guess it's in good shape. It's still a little pricey to me but I don't regret my purchase.

Edit: So I’ve ran into an issue with the card. It’s got a loud tick in the fan. It happened during installation but I thought it was paper but it came back. Louder then ever with a vengeance. Took it out and noticed some of the screw heads have tool marks on them. I hope they didn’t send me a refurbished one at full price. I’ll have to go to the manufacture now that it’s past amazons lemon period. Awe well I still don’t regret the purchase but I’m very disappointed.

GPU Name: ASUS GeForce RTX 2060 Overclocked 6G GDDR6 Dual-Fan EVO Edition VR Ready HDMI DisplayPort DVI Graphics Card (DUAL-RTX2060-O6G-EVO)
Customer Review Title: Works great in a small ITX build
Customer Review: I used this card in my Phanteks Evolv Shift case as it was suggested to run a blower-style GPU. The ASUS Turbo series fit the bill with blower-style cards and I was able to get a 2060 for a decent price. Installation was a breeze and the card has been running all my games on the highest settings without any temperature issues. The card peaked at 74 degrees celsius and held there after several hours of gameplay. The card is louder than I would have wanted, but given the type of small case build I did, I will accept a little more noise when gaming as long as it keeps itself cool. At this point, I'm just waiting on the GeForce Triple Threat code to get emailed to me, which support said will take 10 days after purchase.

GPU Name: ASUS GeForce RTX 2060 Overclocked 6G GDDR6 Dual-Fan EVO Edition VR Ready HDMI DisplayPort DVI Graphics Card (DUAL-RTX2060-O6G-EVO)

It was Asus about 24 days a little to late trying to offer their excellent customer service that you will constantly hear playing as one of their main automated statements during my long durations of waiting for a service representative to help me fix my problem.

Beware of Asus products complete utter garbage.

GPU Name: ASUS GeForce RTX 2060 Overclocked 6G GDDR6 Dual-Fan EVO Edition VR Ready HDMI DisplayPort DVI Graphics Card (DUAL-RTX2060-O6G-EVO)
Customer Review Title: Not quite as stated. Still a very SOLID Gaming card.
Customer Review: The card looks stunning, it performs very well, it arrived on time and without problems to the package of any form. The description indicates the boost clock is 1809 Mhz, in reality the boost clock is only 1785 Mhz out of the box. 24Mhz really trivial but, I would suggest an edit to the listed specs for this product. The fans are whisper quiet until you get the card REALLY REALLY hot, then you can hear them when they ramp up to full speed. The product specs will show in UEFI if you use a ASUS ROG STRIX Z370-E Gaming motherboard. Also tested using GPU-Z.

GPU Name: ASUS GeForce RTX 2060 Overclocked 6G GDDR6 Dual-Fan EVO Edition VR Ready HDMI DisplayPort DVI Graphics Card (DUAL-RTX2060-O6G-EVO)
Customer Review: Loved these cards. They looked good, ran quietly and flawlessly. I ended up deciding to go with a water-cooled Asus RTX 2080 Turbo for ultimate silence and performance. If I build an air cooled machine in the near future, I will buy these cards for it!!

GPU Name: ASUS GeForce RTX 2060 Overclocked 6G GDDR6 Dual-Fan EVO Edition VR Ready HDMI DisplayPort DVI Graphics Card (DUAL-RTX2060-O6G-EVO)

GPU Name: ASUS GeForce RTX 2060 Overclocked 6G GDDR6 Dual-Fan EVO Edition VR Ready HDMI DisplayPort DVI Graphics Card (DUAL-RTX2060-O6G-EVO)
Customer Review: This didn't work for me. I have an older PC running an Asus P9X79 Pro system board and Intel I7 processor and Asus monitor so I thought it would be compatible but after trying multiple drivers I couldn't get it to work consistently. Anywhere from 10 minutes to 2 hours running it the screen would go blank like a screen saver or low power shut down and the only way to bring it back up was to unplug the HDMI cable and plug it back in. I tried 2 different HDMI cables and 2 different monitors but the same thing happened. I called customer service and worked with a few different techs but the issue could not be resolved. They passed me off to Microsoft who had me reload the OS that didn't fix it either so I returned it. and replaced it with MSI card of the same model and that has worked great.

GPU Name: ASUS GeForce RTX 2060 Overclocked 6G GDDR6 Dual-Fan EVO Edition VR Ready HDMI DisplayPort DVI Graphics Card (DUAL-RTX2060-O6G-EVO)
Customer Review: I received this product through Amazon and had gotten it on time with packaging and everything as described. After I received the card I installed it into my PC the next day. The card was great, until it wasn't. The day after I installed the card, I booted up my PC and the card was then disabled by my PC. I tried everything from rolling back drivers, making sure all the cables were connected, made sure it was in the slot properly, nothing was working. I then went to Asus to fill out an RMA form, only to find out that this card had been previously RMA'd. The card that I had received had already been returned as faulty, EVEN THOUGH THE DESCRIPTION OF THE CARD ONLY SAID THE MANUAL WOULD BE MISSING. NOT THAT IT WAS PREVIOUSLY FAULTY. Upset by the lack of Amazon's knowledge on the card being previously faulty. The card was great for the day that it did last though, was great to play games for a few hours on settings/frames I haven't experienced before.

GPU Name: ASUS GeForce RTX 2060 Overclocked 6G GDDR6 Dual-Fan EVO Edition VR Ready HDMI DisplayPort DVI Graphics Card (DUAL-RTX2060-O6G-EVO)
Customer Review: Amazing graphics card! Got it for my husbands computer and it’s a whole new experience. I’m not much of a gamer, but I love puzzles. My husband will play through games like Tomb Raider that have a great narrative and puzzles I can help solve. We recently started playing the new Star Wars game, and the graphics are amazing! GPU Name: ASUS GeForce RTX 2060 Overclocked 6G GDDR6 Dual-Fan EVO Edition VR Ready HDMI DisplayPort DVI Graphics Card (DUAL-RTX2060-O6G-EVO)
Customer Review Title: Works For Using 4K TV as Monitor if TV Supports 4:4:4 Color.
Customer Review: I got this to drive a Samsung Electronics UN40MU6300 40-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2017 Model) as a PC Monitor. After considerable research I found this combination to support 4K UHD 60hz 4:4:4 on the card/TV. The display is superb, no lag, and the 2017 monitor stays on the chosen input (PC - HDMI 1) even after power cycle on monitor or PC using power saver to shut of monitor. Highly recommended. I have TV on desktop and not on wall across room so I have same dpi/resolution as my previous setup of two monitors (Samsung 2048x1192) with addition screen space.

GPU Name: ASUS GeForce RTX 2060 Overclocked 6G GDDR6 Dual-Fan EVO Edition VR Ready HDMI DisplayPort DVI Graphics Card (DUAL-RTX2060-O6G-EVO)
Customer Review Title: Powers two 1080p monitors. Rate it a *Best Buy.*

It delivers to both at the same time which was why I purchased this particular graphics card. I'd rate it a *Best Buy* for the price.

Customer Review Title: It fit into my Dell 3010 MT, barely. But not my Dell 9010 MT.
Customer Review: Works really well in Dell 3010 MT with new power supply to support it (pcie connectors). I did have to trim the locking tab that holds the pcie cards in place because of the gpu's fan shroud, but it's plastic so easy with scissors. It's a tight fit too, so you have to slide it in at an angle to clear then line it up with the pcie slot and case holes (takes up two spots). Also recommend keep clear the slot below the fans blades. Due to where they put the sata and USB 3.0 connections on the motherboard for my other computer (Dell 9010 MT) this card wouldn't fit down into it, so I had to get a shorter GPU (EVGA GTX 1060 6GB mini) for it.

GPU Name: ASUS GeForce RTX 2060 Overclocked 6G GDDR6 Dual-Fan EVO Edition VR Ready HDMI DisplayPort DVI Graphics Card (DUAL-RTX2060-O6G-EVO)
Customer Review:
Great card, was able to hit a Passmark score of 10,186, nearly hitting the average for a 1070 card. Average for 1060 is 8793, while average for 1070 is 11,017. I selected this one mainly because of the white cover, which ultimately is silly and unimportant.

Games run pretty much at full detail or even ultra on some, though the memory limitation of 3GB does get in the way more than I expected. Prey, for instance, can deliver 120 FPS, but stutters due to memory usage as new textures load in, making "Medium Texture" quality the only acceptable choice - purely a memory issue preventing using higher.

3D applications like Lightwave, Daz 3D, perform well enough, though, the memory limit again reduced effectiveness.

Bitcoin mining generated about $2 a day via NiceHash.

If you have the extra money, it may be worth it to get the 6GB version.

GPU Name: ASUS GeForce RTX 2060 Overclocked 6G GDDR6 Dual-Fan EVO Edition VR Ready HDMI DisplayPort DVI Graphics Card (DUAL-RTX2060-O6G-EVO)
Customer Review:
Update 2/28/17
I have been using this for 5760x1080 surround gaming across three monitors for a couple weeks now and it's working wonderfully. No screen tear, no noticeable frame rate drops. I've been playing Battlefront, The Crew, Need For Speed, Borderlands: The PreSequel, and a couple other games that support ultra wide resolutions and it's been keeping up no problem. Great card, if it supported SLI I would buy another.

I just upgraded to this from an XFX Radeon 7870 and the difference this card makes blew me away. My old xfx was really struggling to keep up on games like Battlefront, fallout 4, and Doom, but this card takes all these games without breaking a sweat. I can now play anything I want on the highest graphics settings at 1080p resolution all day long and this card doesn't even flinch. No framerate drops, no screen tear, nothing.

A FurMark test on both cards was really interesting. The xfx hit 80 degrees C in under 45 seconds in the stress test and was only able to render around 40 fps. This Asus card rendered a constant 76 frames and took over 4 minutes to reach 80 degrees c. The ambient air temperature was around 19 degrees C when I ran this test. I am also personally not comfortable with any of my chips getting over 80 degrees C, so that is where I stop the tests. I know that most chips can go hotter without failing, but I am just not comfortable risking it due to my limited computer budget (hence the $200 card).

Please note that I only have 1080p monitors, and I don't plan on upgrading for a while. This card is perfect for 1080p gaming though, and if you're in the same 1080p/budget boat as I am this card is going to last you through quite a few games yet to come on ultra with very good frame rates.

GPU Name: ASUS GeForce RTX 2060 Overclocked 6G GDDR6 Dual-Fan EVO Edition VR Ready HDMI DisplayPort DVI Graphics Card (DUAL-RTX2060-O6G-EVO)
Customer Review Title: Excellent Display Adapter driving HDMI 2.0 50" 4K monitor, 27" 1080p HDMI monitor and extra 19"DVI monitor
Customer Review: This is a great graphics card that is driving HDMI 2.0 50" 4K monitor/TV, 27" HDMI 1080p monitor and extra 19" DVI monitor (using a really long DVI cable) without a problem. One suggestion I do have is not to change the font magnification in Windows from 100 since I believe that I did notice some degradation in performance. I do suggest changing text size individually in Windows (menu size, etc.) individually. That way the fonts are large enough on screen and the graphics performance is still great. Very pleased that it's not heating up due to it's design - if it did, you would hear the fan which I would not be happy with. Really pleased with price and performance for what I'm using it. Don't recall changing the thermal paste with silver thermal paste - I suppose that would be an even better solution if you're using gaming software - which I'm not.

GPU Name: ASUS GeForce RTX 2060 Overclocked 6G GDDR6 Dual-Fan EVO Edition VR Ready HDMI DisplayPort DVI Graphics Card (DUAL-RTX2060-O6G-EVO)
Customer Review Title: Not the best for modded Skyrim SE
Customer Review:
I use this card mainly for playing modded Skyrim SE, so far without an ENB. I have a few texture mods, weather, water etc. I run a 1080P monitor, and I would honestly say this is the minimum card I would run with such a setup. I cannot comment on games besides Skyrim SE, so your results will probably differ from mine. The card routinely spikes to 1961Mhz @ 68C with .1GB of Vram left. I do get FPS drops to around 45 when in the outside world during daytime. I would recommend the 6GB version of this card even if you have a 1080P screen.

The card is very fast, but the vRAM really holds it back at times.

GPU Name: MSI Gaming GeForce RTX 3070 8GB GDRR6 256-Bit HDMI/DP Tri-Frozr 2 TORX Fan 4.0 Ampere Architecture RGB OC Graphics Card (RTX 3070 Gaming X Trio)
Customer Review:
Disliked price for sure my 2080 super gaming x trio is barely behind it by almost single digit on benchmarks however eye candy and smoothness and how fast it plays on ultra is amazing. It will deliver insane game play no shutter no lag much smoother than 2080 super but I was expecting higher bench speeds which I am not. It's same size as 2080 same looks has essentially better game play and about 100 bucks more than what I paid for my 2080 super. Final thoughts keep my 2080 don't buy this as its not hardly a game changer. It reacts well to drivers with little to no issue. Seems to have better response and eye candy. But the trade off at that price I'm not sure is a deal breaker. It won't fail you on insane playing without lag on ultra and runs cooler. Only main difference and all I do for a living is build gaming machines. Not sold on this card yet. Will play cyber punk a bit longer to notice any anomalies. But if your looking to spend alot of money for zero lag and crisp clean smooth gaming its the card for you needs more RAM and a Bump on clock speeds for this price.

My 2080 used actually costs more on Amazon. So maybe if you were in market for card during these times get this over the 2080. Seems like it's available now.

Beware no magic here just flawless gaming eye candy without shutter or lag and slightly less for price of a used 2080.

Will keep it this will future proof my 4,500 dollar PC. My 2080 now sits in a box unused.

GPU Name: LINKUP {35 cm} PCIE 3.0/4.0 16x Shielded Extreme High-Speed Riser Cable Port Extension PCIE Card┃Black┃Left Angle┃3.0 Gen3 Compatible
Customer Review: Fractal Define R6, this cable works with this case with a slight modication. You'll need a small square jewelry file. File the holes towards the front of the PCIE towards the bracket end about 6mm. You'll be making the holes slotted, without making them wider. View the pictures, after that you'll need M3 by 8mm standoffs, (slightly longer than standard motherboard standoffs). Secure everything to the case, if all is done right, you'll get proper PCIE Graphics card slot engagement, view the pictures. Otherwise this is a fantastic premium cable.

GPU Name: LINKUP {35 cm} PCIE 3.0/4.0 16x Shielded Extreme High-Speed Riser Cable Port Extension PCIE Card┃Black┃Left Angle┃3.0 Gen3 Compatible
Customer Review Title: Worst riser cable I’ve ever bought and also the most expensive
Customer Review:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.
 Apparently you don’t always get what you pay for and the Linkup PCIe 4.0 riser cable is a great example of that. I paid upwards of $70 for this thing and expected it would be good and essentially perform the one basic thing that it’s designed for without dropping frames. In my experience, a high price point usually indicates exceptional material and quality assurance. In this case, it absolutely did not.

I read some of the bad reviews and should have listened, but I figured they were probably talking about the budget line of cables, not the premium one I was looking at. It’s hard to tell since they’re all grouped together on the same page. One more selling point was that my mobo has 2 PCIe 4.0 ports on it so I figured I’d go the future proof route and this item is sadly it right now if that’s what you’re trying to accomplish.

Immediately after connecting this thing to my RDX 2080 ti and plugging it into my Prime X570 Pro motherboard, I experienced boot issues and the fan on my graphics card ran constantly at full speed, then BIOS would try to load, the error light on the mobo indicated an issue with the graphics card, boot would fail, then the system would reload and repeat the cycle until a reset screen appeared from too many failed attempts. After the reset screen, I could get to Windows without making any actual changes in BIOS. Windows took significantly longer to load than normal and crashed sporadically while running. Every time I would reboot, I would have to do the same thing. I tried removing and reinserting the riser firmly. It doesn’t really lock in place on the motherboard (which felt cheap) so I thought maybe it wasn’t seated correctly. I tried reseating it and using multiple ports - nothing helped.

I have read some cables aren’t well shielded and thought maybe that was the source of the issue. To test this theory, I wrapped the entire cable in anti static shielding plastic four times over and from terminal to terminal - absolutely no change.

The second I took the riser cable out of the situation, everything went back to working flawlessly. I seriously hope this thing didn’t damage any of the components of my rig. I thought I could trust it because I paid enough to expect a good quality cable. Save yourself a few hours of wasted time and potential damage to your rig and look elsewhere. At least to me, it’s not worth the risk and this thing is getting returned first thing in the morning. Lesson learned: never buy a Linkup brand cable again.

GPU Name: LINKUP {35 cm} PCIE 3.0/4.0 16x Shielded Extreme High-Speed Riser Cable Port Extension PCIE Card┃Black┃Left Angle┃3.0 Gen3 Compatible
Customer Review: I can’t express how happy I am to have this PCIE cable that solve our problem. This is the only pcie extension cable that works perfectly for my HighPoint SSD7101A-1 RAID Controller which is needed to be placed outside of the HP Server due to limited space and heat problems. Having been trying many similar cables from other sellers, none of those can be used to extend this highpoint NVMe SSD RAID controller. Other PCIe riser cables may be good for graphic cards which automatically lower the bandwidth to adapter slower performance cables, but total failed to run extreme high-speed data transfer as in our case. This Extreme PCIE cable does the job without sacrifice the performance and runs steadily for more than a couple of weeks (others fail within hours). It completely solves the heat and performance problem we had. Best performance cable. Will definitely recommended for whoever wants the performance.

GPU Name: LINKUP {35 cm} PCIE 3.0/4.0 16x Shielded Extreme High-Speed Riser Cable Port Extension PCIE Card┃Black┃Left Angle┃3.0 Gen3 Compatible
Customer Review:
A riser cable can never increase your framerates. However, it can absolutely hinder them.

That said, I saw zero framerate drop between cabled and my 2080 (non-ti version) plugged straight into the motherboard. I ran multiple benchmarks (3DMark, in-game, etc) with and without, and differences were within margin of error.

I did notice about a 4-6C drop, under load, in temps on the card, and about 2C drop on the CPU, due simply to the fact that the card was off and away from the motherboard. These temps are with the case side-door open (more on that below).

Cable seems very high quality, and was sufficiently long (actually just a bit TOO long) for a standard mid-tower case. Kind of wish there were color options other than just grey, as a vertically mounted GPU on a showcase PC is sexy, but kinda let down by the bland cable. I think CableMods exists because I'm not the only one who cares about aesthetics to the point of custom-coloring our ATX cables.

Sadly, the ASUS ROG Strix 2080 I bought is a 2.75 slot card, and is just too thick to mount vertically in my Corsair 500D case. It gives me about a 1/4inch gap if I close the case door, and then the temps just skyrocket. I used it instead in my old case with my old 980ti, which seems to get enough airflow; dropping temps by a few degrees even with the door closed.

Good product, despite me not checking if I could properly fit my GPU vertically. Hopefully one of you learns from my oversight.

GPU Name: LINKUP {35 cm} PCIE 3.0/4.0 16x Shielded Extreme High-Speed Riser Cable Port Extension PCIE Card┃Black┃Left Angle┃3.0 Gen3 Compatible
Customer Review Title: Not a direct fit for the evolv shift but still works.
Customer Review: This cable works as expected. It replaced the stock cable that comes with the phanteks evolv shift case. The stock cable caused crashes and blue screens while running an rx 5700. This replacement cable has had no issues running in pcie 4.0. This cable is not a drop in replacement for the phanteks case. The mounting holes do not match with the bracket however this case supports the card well enough to not need to bolt the cable down to the frame.

GPU Name: LINKUP {35 cm} PCIE 3.0/4.0 16x Shielded Extreme High-Speed Riser Cable Port Extension PCIE Card┃Black┃Left Angle┃3.0 Gen3 Compatible
Customer Review:
I bought a horizontal external GPU holder and needed a cable to match. This went perfectly with it. Compared to Thermaltake this has much better shielding and I noticed no performance drop between the two.

I wish they would find a way to do a single cable or tubes versus flat though as long ribbon cables are notoriously a nightmare for cable management and them splitting this into multiple small ribbon cables makes it a mess.

Overall pick this one over if you're worried about electrical noise and shielding. Durability is great, I can see these lasting a while as well. This cable is futureproof too and should be able to handle new standards within the next 5-10 years easily.

GPU Name: LINKUP {35 cm} PCIE 3.0/4.0 16x Shielded Extreme High-Speed Riser Cable Port Extension PCIE Card┃Black┃Left Angle┃3.0 Gen3 Compatible
Customer Review Title: Yeah it costs and arm and a leg..... but you get what you pay for.
Customer Review: Awesome cables! Very thick but this is great if you need heavily shielded. I was able to twist these cables to get fit into a half height slot, and they worked fantastically (most cables did not). These babies are expensive, but well, well, well worth the price. No other cable that I twisted was able to fit through a half-height slot and continued to work. NO LOSS OF SIGNAL, and can be twisted any way you want! Best of both worlds. I literally spent $100 on cheap cables and after a while they resulted in a system halt due to PCIe signal fault. I had to throw them out. I am using a souped up 256GB 82TB RAID 6 SuperMicro Dual E5-2697 v2 48 cores. The case is only 2U and thus only has half height slots. ALL OF THE OTHER CABLES REQUIRED TWSITING OR CRIMPING TO FIT IN THE 2U SLOT ON THE CASE! This is why they failed, If you see the pictures, these cable DO NOT use ribbon cables, these are individual wires that are shielded and divided. This way you can navigate these cables to fit into very tight spaces. MOREOVER, and this is the best part.... NO SIGNAL LOSS. Moreover they do not obstruct the adjacent PCIe lanes. If you look at the supermicro X9dri-ln4f MOBO you get alot of PCIe slots, but he space is very, very tight, especially in a 2u case. Yeah they aren't cheap, but you better believe they are worth every damn penny, especially if you had to go through wasting the time, energy, money and suffering the frustrations all the other cables caused me.

Customer Review Title: Does not work with Phanteks Case 90 degree brackets
Customer Review:
Update:
The LinkUP support said they are making a new PCB to address the issues of PCB deflection and length in some Phanteks cases. They also said they would send an engineering sample to test once it was produced. I will post the results on this review including photos and performance test information.

Attached are a few photos showing the Phanteks riser cable and 90 degree mounts (PH-VGPUKT_02 & Enthoo 719 case mount) As you can see the printed circuit board (PCB) is a lot smaller (length and width) and deflects (bends) under the weight of heavy graphics cards. Note: The Phantks doesn't.

LinkUp product quality:
It is a very nice cable. The cable quality is good. The connectors are nice and well constructed. If the PCB was like the Phanteks one (thick and larger) it would be 5 stars (currently, I would say 3 stars since it doesn't as good as Thermaltake or Phanteks)

Support:
They can be a little hard to get hold of in the US. But once they engage they have been very good to work with and have accepted the product return even though it was open.

System Information:
Phantks Enthoo 719
AMD 3960x (using Heatkiller IV Pro for Threadripper CPU water-block)
Zenith II Extreme Alpha
ASUS Dual RTX 2080ti OC (using Heatkiller reference CPU card water-block)

GPU Name: LINKUP {35 cm} PCIE 3.0/4.0 16x Shielded Extreme High-Speed Riser Cable Port Extension PCIE Card┃Black┃Left Angle┃3.0 Gen3 Compatible
Customer Review Title: Works for vert mount - too much static noise on audio card
Customer Review:
So I picked this up planning on installing it into an MSI sekira 500x with a 5700XT. The riser cable does well as expected - card works well when vertically mounted (get a little warmer than usual, but nothing crazy). The part that plugs into the GPU does not reach the mounting holes in the sekira case, can't fault the riser cable for that, but I did have to rig something in my case in order to help support the gpu.
My main issue with this riser cable is that I had an internal audio card (Sound Blaster AE-5) and while the gpu was vertically mounted the cable would interfere with the audio card. I would get weird wobbles in audio playback tests - and spikes in chatter. I then tried an external sound card - same problems. All of these problems disappeared when I mounted the card normally. I'm going to have to return this cable and try a different brand, or give up the vertically mounted dream.

GPU Name: LINKUP {35 cm} PCIE 3.0/4.0 16x Shielded Extreme High-Speed Riser Cable Port Extension PCIE Card┃Black┃Left Angle┃3.0 Gen3 Compatible
Customer Review Title: Funktioniert nicht mit PCIe 4.0 - Update beachten!
Customer Review:
Nachtrag Ende Januar 2020:

Nachdem ich über die letzten Monate hinweg im Kontakt mit dem Hersteller stand, mir diverse Engineering Samples zum Testen zur Verfügung gestellt hat, kann ich sagen, dass ich mittlerweile die finale Revision 2.0 des Riser Kabels in Händen halte. Mit diesem Kabel treten nach bisherigen Tests keinerlei Fehler mehr auf, weder in synthetischen Benchmarks noch in Spielen, auch die WHEA Fehler sind behoben!

Diese neue Kabel-Revision sollte laut Hersteller ab Mitte Februar 2020 im Einzelhandel verfügbar sein.

Ich möchte ausdrücklich noch einmal hervor heben, wie zufrieden ich mit dem Support und Service des Herstellers bin, und dass man schlussendlich eine gemeinsame Lösung gefunden hat, die allen zugute kommt! Würde die Bewertung somit auf die vollen 5 Sterne anheben.

---

Ich habe drei verschiedene Riser Kabel dieses Herstellers probiert: Das 15cm Premium, das 20cm Premium und das 30cm Extreme.

Kein einziges dieser Riser Kabel funktionierte auf einem ASUS Strix X570-E mit einer PowerColor 5700XT Red Devil ohne Probleme, trotz Herstellerangaben "PCIe 4.0 Ready" (bei den Premium Varianten) oder "PCIe 4.0 Verified" (Extreme Variante).

Bereits nach Windows Start finden sich Tausende WHEA Error ID 17 Fehler (= Fehler im PCI Express Root) im Ereignisprotokoll. Sobald Last anliegt bricht die Performance auf PCIe 1.1 ein, der Rechner startet direkt neu oder es hagelt BlueScreens.

Die Verarbeitungs-Qualität der Riser-Kabel ist hochwertig und mit PCIe 3.0 mögen die Kabel tatsächlich gut funktionieren, aber die Angabe bezüglich PCIe 4.0 ist schlichtweg gelogen. Meine Suche nach PCIe 4.0 Riser Kabeln geht weiter.

GPU Name: LINKUP {35 cm} PCIE 3.0/4.0 16x Shielded Extreme High-Speed Riser Cable Port Extension PCIE Card┃Black┃Left Angle┃3.0 Gen3 Compatible
Customer Review Title: Hochwertige und sehr flexibele RISER CARD (PCIe-Slot-Anschluss-Verlängerung)
Customer Review:
Dieses PCIe-Slot "Verlängerungskabel" (bestehend aus fünf flachen "Bändern") lässt sich wesentlich besser in "engen" Bereichen einsetzen (sprich biegen), als die normalen nicht "aufgesplitteten" Riser.
Die beiden Anschluss-Slots sind in der Breite kleiner als die anderen, welche ich bis jetzt hatte.
Damit konnte ich das Ding durch die Slot-Öffnungen des Gehäuses schieben um dann die GPU nach aussen zu verlegen.
Bis jetzt fehelrfreie Übertragung an die angeschlossene NVIDIA Quadro GV100, welche mit 97% Auslastung läuft.
Das eine der 5 Bänder/Kabeln berührt, im PC-Gehäuse, eine weitere sehr heiss werdenden GPU und ich kann da keine Beschädigung durch Wärmeeinwirkung feststellen. Wohl wegen des Materials, dass nicht schmilzt -- was bei den anderen, preiswerteren, Stoff- bzw. Gewebe-Bänder der Fall war.
Knicken geht nicht, aber enges Biegen ist sehr gut möglich.
Der Sperrhebel auf der Buchsenseite rastet an die GPU gut ein - auf der Steckerseite aufs Board auch sehr gut.
NACHTEIL: Sehr bzw. zu teuer (speziell die längeren Ausführungen)!!
Dafür spitzen Verarbeitung und sieht auch gut aus.
Hoffe, dass meine etwas lange Ausführung jemanden bei der Entscheidung helfen kann.

GPU Name: NVIDIA NVS 310 by PNY 512MB DDR3 PCI Express Gen 2 x16 DisplayPort 1.2 and DVI-D SL Mllti-Display Professional Graphics Board, VCNVS310DVI-PB
Customer Review Title: Great low-power workhorse -- too bad about the fan.
Customer Review:
Excellent replacement for my 7 or 8 year old NVS-290 card (also PNY).
It looses 1/2 star for having a fan (NVS-290 was fanless), but stars
round down.

Honestly, I can't hear the fan, and the card is still pretty low power
(less than 20W), but I hate fans.

The old card still works perfectly but is no longer supported by
current NVidia drivers. It is still supported by the actively
maintained NVidia legacy driver, but the legacy driver prevents you
from upgraded to the current version of Xorg X11 server (which, in
turn, prevents upgrading various other things to current versions).

So, I sadly have to retire the trusty NVS-290.

That is still _way_ better than my last experience with an ATI card
that got abandoned completely after 2 years.

GPU Name: NVIDIA NVS 310 by PNY 512MB DDR3 PCI Express Gen 2 x16 DisplayPort 1.2 and DVI-D SL Mllti-Display Professional Graphics Board, VCNVS310DVI-PB

Customer Review:

GPU Name: VisionTek Radeon 7750 SFF 1GB DDR3 3M (2x HDMI, miniDP) Graphics Card - 900574
Customer Review:
The one shown in the picture is not the one that was shipped to me although I am not complaining because the one I was shipped (an AMD Radeon HD 7700 Series) met and exceeded my expectations. Additionally, this card is for the HP Small Form Factor workstations in the Z200 series.

The difference between what is shown in the image with this product and what I received is that the GFX card has two (non-standard [see image]) HDMI jacks although my new monitor (being an HP VH240a) came with the necessary cables. So this card is running a desktop with two monitors and it does it rapidly and seamlessly. I don't know whether or not it would be satisfactory for someone who is an intense gamer but for a computer engineer it is an elegant card with a very nice Dashboard for fine tuning both monitors (the second is an HP w2408h which is almost 10 years old) and this card is a major improvement over the motherboard's GPU. When I installed this card the older monitor's GFX definition was dramatically improved.

I am very happy with this card which I've been using since June 2019 and have no reservations in recommending this to other computer engineers or users who know how to install a card and use the CD to install the drivers, who want a very nice GFX card.

GPU Name: VisionTek Radeon 7750 SFF 1GB DDR3 3M (2x HDMI, miniDP) Graphics Card - 900574
Customer Review Title: Great while it lasted (until I killed it)*
Customer Review:
Bought this for use with three displays. It is not compatible with UEFI systems unless you disable Secure Boot and enable Legacy ROM support in UEFI BIOS before you install it. Installed in a Dell Inspiron 560 and a Dell Inspiron 3847 system. Worked fine until I thought I would try to flash it with UEFI GOP support. Don’t do that. You'll brick it if you do. If you need Secure Boot, look elsewhere. If you don't, then this was a decent card for the money. Drove all three displays on Windows 10 (while it lasted) with decent performance. Not meant for high-end gaming. Works best with clean installations of drivers. Requires an active adapter (not included) to use the DisplayPort at the same time as two HDMI displays. Otherwise you'll only get two working displays.

* Updated - I was able to re-flash the card with the original spec vBIOS ROM and it came back to life and works again. So, still working fine, even after a bad flash!

GPU Name: VisionTek Radeon 7750 SFF 1GB DDR3 3M (2x HDMI, miniDP) Graphics Card - 900574
Customer Review Title: Dual HDMI outputs for home office
Customer Review:
I installed this without a problem which means its EASY because my PC skills are minimal.
I'm still running a 10 year old Dell studioXPS that originally came with Windows 7. This drops in and runs like a champ. I needed dual HDMI because I'm running a new 27" Samsung monitor on one output and a splitter on the other that goes to another 27" Samsung and a 55" TV. They all run great.
Noise is minimal, no worse than the GeForce it replaced.
If you need Dual HDMI and this fits your specs, do it.

GPU Name: VisionTek Radeon 7750 SFF 1GB DDR3 3M (2x HDMI, miniDP) Graphics Card - 900574
Customer Review Title: Noisy Fans (VisionTek Radeon 7750 SFF 1GB DDR3 3M (2x HDMI, 1x miniDP) - 900574)
Customer Review:
Just for the record, this is not a new card. It has been out for quite some time. One indication is the box. The box was not black, instead it was blue with black accents. Plus, it only supports DirectX 11. However, it does support O/S from Windows XP to Windows 10. Which is convenient in my case. Before an O/S reaches the end of its lifestyle,, I perform a clean install, including drivers, software, and naturally security updates. I create a system image. When I feel nostalgic, I just restore that image. Everything is intact. I grew tired of playing with Virtual Machine and its limitations.

I purchased two of these graphic cards, and both of the fans had an annoying wining sound. There is one thing that I have learned. Do not buy electronics, or computer parts from online store that doesn't concentrate on technology. What you see (advertised), is not always what you get (actual product) on this site. This is probably a very good reason for the price reduction.

GPU Name: VisionTek Radeon 7750 SFF 1GB DDR3 3M (2x HDMI, miniDP) Graphics Card - 900574
Customer Review: I bought this as a low cost dual HDMI output graphics card for an older Intel I7 machine running an ASUS ROG motherboard in an old and noisy server tower, that supposedly had multi monitor support on it's on board card, but never seemed capable of actually doing. I run mine in a mirror mode to pipe video and audio into my living room for streaming movies. It's doing exactly as I need it to do, and I'm a happy customer. I don't think I'd look to this card for gaming. There are far better choices for the hardcore gamer. Both of my "monitors" are large UHD 4k TV's, and I have no flicker issues, even with the second one running on a 50 foot HDMI cable. A great buy for someone needing an inexpensive card and multi monitor support.

GPU Name: VisionTek Radeon 7750 SFF 1GB DDR3 3M (2x HDMI, miniDP) Graphics Card - 900574
Customer Review Title: this device eventually works with some issues
Customer Review:
This device eventually works well with some issues. I installed the video card with two monitors. initially I could not get it to recognize both monitors. Apparently win10 does not builtin driver support. I loaded the software from the disk that came with the device. That solved the two monitor recognition problem, but the display was only 90% of the screen. I tried to check the customer support page, It was blank and had not been updated on over a year. I did find the option in the supplied software to correct the 90% display issue. I thought I might be home free, until I tried to register the device to activate the three year warranty. If you guessed that the registration page is nonexistent, you would be right. Even AMD RADEON does not list support for this particular card

Bottom line, the only support for this device is the CD that is packaged with the video card.

GPU Name: VisionTek Radeon 7750 SFF 1GB DDR3 3M (2x HDMI, miniDP) Graphics Card - 900574
Customer Review Title: The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly.
Customer Review:
The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly.

In the end, this is a disappointing card. I am going to return it.

But let me tell you

The GOOD:
- The card really manages to drive 3 screens (I had one DP and two HDMIs connected simultaneously) with very decent performance
- It fits inside my SFF desktop (DELL OptiPlex 960).
- Most importantly: It DOES support DDMA (in Windows at least), and is able to send independent audio streams to the two HDMI monitors. This was the very reason I purchased the card.

The BAD:
- The fan is really noisy. I tried using a Low-Noise-Adapter, and that did bring the noise levels down to almost acceptable. Still - not enough for a HTPC.

The UGLY:
- It crashes Windows 7 Pro systematically. After upgrading ATI Catalyst software to the latest version, Windows crashes every time I try Skype. Even if I don't use Skype, the machine seems to freeze every now and then without obvious reason. Was rock-solid before the addition of the VisionTek card.

This makes the card useless, so I'll have to return, alas!
I loved the idea of being able to drive a screen + 2 TVs simultaneously, but maybe this is not the card for it.

Customer Review Title: After I changed the setting it worked fine. It was easy for me (not a computer ...

change one BIOS setting to make this work on some computers

This is to inform purchasers of a potential additional step required when installing this graphics card. My computer, an HP Envy 700 (and possibly other computers) required a change in one BIOS setting before this card will work. I cannot post a link here, so to find a solution for your computer you'll need to do an internet search. Or, if you can find a knowledgeable person at VisionTek , they also may be able to help with this.

The card did not work at all before changing the BIOS setting. After I changed the setting it worked fine. It was easy for me (not a computer expert) to change the BIOS setting.

Customer Review Title: Good video card - but not great
Customer Review:
I was just looking for a decent video card to upgrade beyond the onboard video (Radeon HD 4200 - yes, I know, ancient) on my MOBO and after doing much homework found that this card was the best fit for my system with the least amount of power requirements and the best performance.

PROS:
- Fit like a charm in my HP Slimline.
- Got both HDMI ports hooked up and having no issues with multiple displays.
- Good for moderate gaming. Probably won't be able to handle some of the newer games unless you setup custom profiles in Catalyst.
- Handles rendering and intense GPU processing well. Tested with ptGui and AutoCADD so far. Got pretty good results, pretty quick.
- Came with ATX case bracket, HDMI to DVI-D converter and drivers / ATI Catalyst software and instructions.
- Rates at a 6.9 / 7.9 on Win7-64 with Phenom II X6 1065t CPU.

CONS:
- NOISY. Before I upgraded the video card I had about 17 - 20dB of noise from my system at idle. Now it's about 35dB - 38dB at idle. At 100% CPU usage it's about 55 - 60dB with case & CPU fan at full throttle with all case covers on. Pretty noisy.
- HOT. Hot to the touch. Granted you shouldn't be "touching" the heat sinks on your GPU card but even from an overnight OFF state to on, it gets hot quickly. Less than two minutes.

I'm being generous with the four star here because the heat and noise is almost a deal breaker. Hot and noisy just isn't a good combination for any type of electronics unless it's a device that is expected to produce heat and noise. The card itself works great though.

For the cooling benefits, a fan is a good thing to have on your GPU. For the noise, eh, not so much - especially the fan on this card. Might want to go with a silent card that just has larger heat sinks and hope your case fan (if you have one) keeps your system cool enough or replace the fan with a liquid cooler for GPU cards (if you have the space).

GPU Name: PNY NVIDIA Quadro NVS 510 2GB GDDR3 4-Mini DisplayPort Low Profile PCI-Express Video Card VCNVS510DVI-PB
Customer Review Title: Awesome graphics card for a business level machine
Customer Review:
This is a great device for the cost. Comes with everything noted, including four solid miniDP to DP converters. Card came in sealed bag, shipped with a DVD with drivers on it as well. I'm actively driving four 2K monitors, and its doing so effortlessly.

Hardware wise this card has a GPU, but it's not one really designed for games. It's got enough power to do most basic things while driving four displays. That includes things like video encoding, decoding, and some 3D boosts. To be super clear this is NOT DESIGNED FOR GAMING, but for business use. And it does exceptionally well at doing that with most apps one would use for business (CAD software, editing, etc).

The only minor disappointment was that the GPU driver is apparently not versioned correctly (or possibly not strong enough?) to support enhancing zoom conferencing with virtual backgrounds. It may be that the hardware could support it, but Zoom doesn't see the version info it wants and simply refuses to try. Hopefully that will be corrected if it can at some point in the future.

GPU Name: PNY NVIDIA Quadro NVS 510 2GB GDDR3 4-Mini DisplayPort Low Profile PCI-Express Video Card VCNVS510DVI-PB
Customer Review: Was worried because I had never utilized the souped up PCI slot before..X16 I think. But the Nvidia 510 fit like a glove. Had gotten recommendation from NVIDIA support before purchase. They are great. Card comes with 4 adapters and a GREAT install CD. However, adapters only go from mini DP to DP connection. None for HDMI or VGA. Check your monitor for connections. Mine takes both VGA and HDMI..HDMI better, so I had to order a cable, mini DP to HDMI..make sure you get one 4K rated for 3D applications, games, etc. Other than that, first start, plug cable into #1 slot and bootup going to look like WIN95 until you install drivers with the CD. Reboot and you'll be amazed...

Customer Review Title: NVS 510 Is a Good Replacement for the NVS 420
Customer Review:
I needed a second quad monitor card for another computer and looked at the NVS 420 I've used in other computers. The 420 has been discontinued. The 510 is significantly faster, slightly less expensive, and easier to install and connect. The 510 uses 4 mini display port connectors rather than the VHDCI connector on the older card. Mini display ports just seem a heck of a lot easier to connect. Card came with full height bracket installed and the short bracket if I needed it (I did). The 510 has 2 GB vs 512 MB of the 420, as well as 192 CUDA cores vs 16 in the 420,

Great business graphics card. Probably not what somebody would be looking for if gaming.

The only negative is that the card we ordered did not come with DisplayPort to DVI-D adapters despite showing their inclusion on the Amazon, PNY Web Site, and the card packaging. GPU Name: PNY NVIDIA Quadro NVS 510 2GB GDDR3 4-Mini DisplayPort Low Profile PCI-Express Video Card VCNVS510DVI-PB
Customer Review Title: Good Card until your Video goes black from the slightest bump
Customer Review:
This review is from a customer who has purchased and installed about 10 of these now for our business.

This card works fine as long as you do not touch it. The Mini Displayports on this card are either faulty, or Mini-Displayport technology itself is faulty. After about 4-6 months of usage, the video's begin to not work and go black. The problem is, if you slightly touch or bump the connection, it loses visual. We then spend time trying to resolve it, rebooting, re-plugging up everything. Eventually you can get your display back.. until you bump it again.

For the average home user, probably not an issue. For businesses who need 4-8 screens working 24/7 on critical computers, this is not a good product. Getting called at 2 am to come troubleshoot Faulty Graphic cards sucks. I Have reached out to PNY for RMA, and they have been helpful in working with me to resolve it. However, at this point, we do not want replacement cards. We would rather have our money back and go buy Quad cards that have Displayport or HDMI inputs. If we want to stay in the nVidia world and stay under $500 per card, that means rolling back nearly a decade to the NVS 450. Because this NVS 510 was the only Nvidia Card that had Quad capability on a low profile bracket.

This results in us looking back to ATI and their Cards for options. I sincerely hope and wish nVidia/PNY is able to craft working technology for Quad monitor users who do not want to troubleshoot this issue any further.

GPU Name: PNY NVIDIA Quadro NVS 510 2GB GDDR3 4-Mini DisplayPort Low Profile PCI-Express Video Card VCNVS510DVI-PB
Customer Review:
Works well for display port or DVI connections but if you need to connect to a H MDI connector through an adapter particularly the Seiki 4K unit it would not work with PNY Quadro NVS 510 Graphic Card. The software is very tricky to do a custom install as the cards not able to recognize this monitored through the adapter You got a check two boxes to try to make custom settings, but that not clear form the screen. The Seiki documentation is terrible but the interlace mode would work but the settings could not be saved. Various calls to customer support or worthless. I had a very high level software engineer I could not get to work either. Had to return but did not use Amazon because they were out of stock and not sure what I am going to face.On the other hand, the included Nvidia desktop software is really nice and I have used it for four years. The fact that the card only takes 35 W is great.

In contrast,EVGA GeForce GT 630 1GB DDR3 Dual DVI, mHDM Worked right away it was only $70. The 2 GB model is probably better as it took for gigabytes of system memory using 4K monitor as well as to 1K MONITORS on the side.The card only draws 25 W but be sure to get the Kepler model. The box says it only supports 2.5 K but the website is correct about 4K.

GPU Name: PNY NVIDIA Quadro NVS 510 2GB GDDR3 4-Mini DisplayPort Low Profile PCI-Express Video Card VCNVS510DVI-PB
Customer Review Title: Good for computers that come with low-power AC supplies.
Customer Review: Good for computers that come with low-power AC supplies. Many other cards would do better performance, but not at this low of power consumption. Works great for our church computer, which only has a stock 400W power supply. The Displayport cables are pretty weird (Mac stuff) but adapters are available and it works. We have a quirk with one of the displays that are connected to an actual TV, if the TV is on BEFORE you start the computer, then all is fine. If you turn on the TV after the computer, then it doesn't "wake up" the port and you will have to reboot the computer. An annoyance for sure, but it works fine once you realize the workaround.

GPU Name: PNY NVIDIA Quadro NVS 510 2GB GDDR3 4-Mini DisplayPort Low Profile PCI-Express Video Card VCNVS510DVI-PB
Customer Review Title: Meh--four screens are cool, but incorrect drivers are not
Customer Review:
This video card works okay but shipped with the wrong driver (?!)

I'm perfectly capable of downloading one, but there's no point in putting a CD in the box when it only yields 'The Graphics Adapter installed in the system is not compatible with the current set of drivers.' Not to mention that paying $300 for a video card should command the respect of including the correct driver.

I ordered this card because we needed three displays and may expand to four. Once I downloaded the driver it worked fine--not amazing, just fine. I still see video artifacts now and then--periodically I'll close a window and it doesn't disappear until I 'mop' the screen with another window.

This is the latest driver (both on installation date and two weeks later) available from the Nvidia site. Windows 7 pro, 64 bit.

GPU Name: PNY NVIDIA Quadro NVS 510 2GB GDDR3 4-Mini DisplayPort Low Profile PCI-Express Video Card VCNVS510DVI-PB
Customer Review Title: Major improvement over older FX Quardo 4500 cards, and only takes up a single PCIe-x16 slot.
Customer Review: First of all I use my workstation for CAD, not for gaming, else I would have bought a much more expensive video card. In replacing my ancient and once beloved Nvidia FX Quadro 4500 cards there was a power reduction of 50 watts per-card to start with. Also I gained a extra PCIe-x1 slot as the FX 4500 was double wide. Dragging objects across two monitors is now very smooth with no 'snap-shot' effects. Color and object definition are razor sharp across all monitors. Be sure to install Nvidia Control Console which can be called up by right-clicking on the desktop. This provides a vast driver library for many video cards plus color and monitor control options. Be sure to buy the correct 4K rated HDMI cables (Mini HDMI to HDMI) or use the adopter cables with 4K rated HDMI cables.

GPU Name: PNY NVIDIA Quadro NVS 510 2GB GDDR3 4-Mini DisplayPort Low Profile PCI-Express Video Card VCNVS510DVI-PB
Customer Review Title: Preformance is great But after a couple of months the fan starts ...
Customer Review:
have 13 Dell T3610 precision workstation with card new from Dell. Preformance is great But after a couple of months the fan starts to get loud. And then after a couple of more months it fails, card overheats, system shuts down. The first one failed after 6-8 months. Under warranty of course, Dell sent tech to replace motherboard?, which didn't work, before we realized fan wasn't working, Quickly swapped cards with working unit, problem went away. I've had about 4 or 5 of original 9 replace under warranty. Most are now noisy even the replacement ones, a couple more have failed, not under warranty. very disappointing!

Also have had some problems with the mini dp connections. Mostly because i believe we used the mini DP to DVI adapter, too much weight hanging of back of card. better to have correct cable,

GPU Name: PNY NVIDIA Quadro NVS 510 2GB GDDR3 4-Mini DisplayPort Low Profile PCI-Express Video Card VCNVS510DVI-PB
Customer Review Title: These cards are terribly difficult to keep working
Customer Review:
These cards are terribly difficult to keep working. I have had multiple issues across different PC's where on a 3-VDT set-up, one of them will just drop off and will not display. In these instances, a complete card removal, driver uninstall, and re-install is the only way that seems to resolve this. If it wasn't a requirement by the company to use these sub-standard cards, I would've said goodbye to them long ago and went with an ATI product.

Kind of a shame because I have had great performance from GeForce gaming cards on my personal machines, but these workstation grade cards are really eating into our productivity when they start dropping displays.

Using: Dell Optiplex 7010's, Intel Core i7, Win7 64-bit OS

GPU Name: PNY NVIDIA Quadro NVS 510 2GB GDDR3 4-Mini DisplayPort Low Profile PCI-Express Video Card VCNVS510DVI-PB
Customer Review:
I have 3 screens connected to my PC, one of which is a large-screen TV. My old setup was having trouble with the big screen even though it was supposed to be supported. The picture would break up regularly. Then I replaced one screen with a newer DP model. There wasn't room for the massive video cards on offer these days, nor the desire for all the cooling noise they create.

The NVS 510 was a great solution - compact and quiet, but supporting 4 high end screens. It does use mini-DP ports to fit a single slot but includes 4 adapters with clips to easily attach screens. I found and ordered one HDMI adapter from NewEgg for the TV connection. It might be cheaper to use an adapter cable. Now the TV signal is stable, the new screen is supported, and the unit runs cool.

For some reason, Windows didn't order the screens in the sequence of connection but I was able to correct the issue in the NVIDIA control panel (downloading the latest version from their web site).
