GPU Name: Diamond Multimedia AMD Radeon HD 5450 PCI Express GDDR3 1GB (DVI, HDMI, VGA) Low Profile Enhanced Heatsink Video Graphics Card (5450PE31G)
Customer Review Title: Now I have a 4K video card to match my Vizio 40" 4K TV on Win7
Customer Review:
Installation was not without drama. Having just been burned by an nVidia Zotac GT710 card which although advertised as Win7-compatible was NOT, I was on the edge of my seat for this card's installation. First, I installed the card and rebooted... black screen. So I pulled the card, rebooted, loaded every driver I could find on the included CD-ROM, then shutdown and put the new card in again. Came up OK this time, but only with 1920x1080 resolution. Oh No! Then I reloaded all the drivers again, but this time it pulled them off the web. VOILA! 3840x2160. I thought it had lost my icons from the right side of the desktop but they had shrunk and moved to the middle of the page!
The Vizio 40" 4K monitor was amazing before, now it's incredible. Even 12" from the screen these fonts may be too small, but those can be enlarged. The next lower resolution is 2048z1536, which isn't really what I want.
So right now I'm a huge fan of this video card. Oh, I'm not a gamer. I'm told that TV's don't really do well with fast moving games. So keep that in mind when reading my comments. This video card may or may not be up to gaming, but I don't know.

GPU Name: Diamond Multimedia AMD Radeon HD 5450 PCI Express GDDR3 1GB (DVI, HDMI, VGA) Low Profile Enhanced Heatsink Video Graphics Card (5450PE31G)
Customer Review:
I previously bought a GT-710 to get 4K capability and use a TV as monitor, but it was a pain to install, taking multiple iterations of running the same software to get it to take.
THIS CARD installed perfectly with zero effort on my part. Congratulations to AMD for releasing the product right.
Video is fast, crisp and clear. However, this is not a full 4K card (not enough memory) so I upgraded to another AMD Radeon product which also installed first pass without a problem.
XFX RX-560D4SFG5 Radeon RX 560 1196MHz, 4gb GDDR5, 14CU, 896 SP, DX12, DP HDMI DVI, PCI-E AMD Graphics Card

GPU Name: Diamond Multimedia AMD Radeon HD 5450 PCI Express GDDR3 1GB (DVI, HDMI, VGA) Low Profile Enhanced Heatsink Video Graphics Card (5450PE31G)
Customer Review: We were having trouble with things off the net like CBS-Online, etc. I decided that most of the problem was the old HP computer I had been using. I had a much newer Dell with more memory and an Intel I5 processor, but I wanted to add a video card with an HDMI o/p. The problem? It was a small from factor chassis. I ordered one card that I liked and it wouldn't fit the chassis. I ordered this card and Bingo, perfect fit. After installation we have used it and we have a perfect picture on the TV and all the hesitation and drop-outs we had previously experienced were gone.

GPU Name: Diamond Multimedia AMD Radeon HD 5450 PCI Express GDDR3 1GB (DVI, HDMI, VGA) Low Profile Enhanced Heatsink Video Graphics Card (5450PE31G)
Customer Review:
Well, courtesy of online classes I needed to be able to use Zoom on one of my computers. My 10 year old desktop machine just couldn't do it, and my little Lenovo could just barely. So...upgrade time!
To be honest, purchasing this board was something of an afterthought, since I figured bringing the desktop machine's RAM up to 4 Gb and installing a quad core processor should do the trick. But - having had good results with Diamond products in the past, and a modest price tag for the board, I opted to buy it and try it.
Upside: the card worked on the first try, and does a fine job of accelerating Zoom sessions.
Downside: the drivers from the AMD website installed with little drama, but there's a shortcut for settings that doesn't lead anywhere (Win 7). However, the Catalyst app allows the user to configure the board so I'm inclined to think the shortcut is just a leftover that was not removed prior to being assigned legacy status.
In any case - suits my needs to a tee. Recommended.

GPU Name: Diamond Multimedia AMD Radeon HD 5450 PCI Express GDDR3 1GB (DVI, HDMI, VGA) Low Profile Enhanced Heatsink Video Graphics Card (5450PE31G)
Customer Review Title: Replacement video card for dual boot Windows XP / Windows 10 system
Customer Review: I run a dual boot Windows XP/Windows 10 machine here at home, and I bought this card to replace my ATI Radeon X1650 video card that I put into service about 10 years ago. The fan on it quit working years ago, but this year not even the supplemental fan kept it cool enough to keep it from throwing errors from overheating. So, I decided to look for a video card that was "not too old but not too new" that would have Windows XP drivers and drivers that would at least work under Windows 10. I settled on this card, and I have not been disappointed. Installation of the card under Windows 10 with the supplied CD-ROM was straight forward and reasonably quick, and the same was true when installing the drivers on my Windows XP installation. I have thus far been able to run my Windows XP games (since they don't run under Windows 10) without a hitch, and the card functions well under Windows 10. I am now able to access web sites that utilize WebGL. If you are looking for a card that helps bridge the gulf between WinXP & Win10 on the same system, I can say that this card did the trick for me.

GPU Name: Diamond Multimedia AMD Radeon HD 5450 PCI Express GDDR3 1GB (DVI, HDMI, VGA) Low Profile Enhanced Heatsink Video Graphics Card (5450PE31G)
Customer Review:
My old tower has PCI Express slot. Fan got noisy visibly failing. I don't do games so needed just a video card, that supported my 22" DVI attached monitor. Under $50 and heat sink rather than fan seemed a perfect match. Diamond has been in the business a long time.
I ignored the bad reviews like no driver or hard to install etc. as non-techie operator error. Bought it; installed it and the silence was golden. But right off I noticed subtle issues like left click speed required to be slowed down. After a time it started blanking our for seconds. Then on Thursday I got my Turkey award. Powering up the BIOS gave 6-long beeps. Adapter failure. Only have 1 adapter, the video card. Tried cleaning and reseating by no go. Got out the old, noisy card and booted up fine. Past the 30-day return to Amazon. So must deal with a company 3,000 miles away for my 1-year warrantee for a product under $50.

GPU Name: Diamond Multimedia AMD Radeon HD 5450 PCI Express GDDR3 1GB (DVI, HDMI, VGA) Low Profile Enhanced Heatsink Video Graphics Card (5450PE31G)
Customer Review Title: Win 10 Anniversary Edition, check. HDMI, check. Catalyst Control Center, check.
Customer Review: I bought this for a Dell Precision T7500 server workstation--an absolute behemoth of a tower. One criteria for this purchase was noise reduction. Internally, the Dell has all passive cooling for the CPU, North bridge and RAM (24 gigs) and I didn't want to run my TV at 20db while watching moves to compensate for droning fan noise. The role of the Dell monstrosity is to make a dumb TV a smart TV, while acting as a media gateway between my TV and the Network Storage unit housing my movies. This card is the perfect solution at an economic price, answering all of my needs and exceeding expectations, replacing the Nvidia NVS card that failed. For the record, the Dell is running Windows 10 pro X64 and the TV is a 46" Dynex with 1080p HDMI. Crisp image quality with a minor adjustment to screen scaling through the Catalyst Control Center--something I usually don't install. If you're looking for a robust card, it's important to note Diamond makes top-rated stuff in the Radeon line. This card, even at GDDR3 is no exception.

GPU Name: Diamond Multimedia AMD Radeon HD 5450 PCI Express GDDR3 1GB (DVI, HDMI, VGA) Low Profile Enhanced Heatsink Video Graphics Card (5450PE31G)
Customer Review: This product fit into my Lenovo fine but could not get it to work. I kept getting an error message saying it did not support my version of windows which is windows 10. So I went to the web site and found that it had divers for windows 10 64bit, I downloaded it and then I had to restart my pc. When it came back my monitor said it was not connect so no picture on my monitor when I try to use the HDMI or the port.

GPU Name: Diamond Multimedia AMD Radeon HD 5450 PCI Express GDDR3 1GB (DVI, HDMI, VGA) Low Profile Enhanced Heatsink Video Graphics Card (5450PE31G)
Customer Review Title: Love the card--it still works beautifully after nearly three years
Customer Review:
A rare find: an inexpensive HD video card with three connections--HDMI, DVI, and VGA--which all work, and will support multiple monitors simultaneously.
And yes, it will support 5.1 audio (and if I remember correctly, 7.1 also although I have never felt need for a 7.1 audio setup so I can't verify that).
I don't do gaming, though clearly this card wasn't designed for that. It's for mostly for HTPC or multiple-monitor use, and works fine for that. No problems with sound, no problems with video artifacts or ghosting--just smooth output of sharp 1080p image for high-definition video from the Blu-Ray discs I play in my BD drive.
(Too bad there isn't an inexpensive software Blu-Ray player that not only plays the movie but also the supporting videos, trailers, etc.)

Love the card--it still works beautifully after nearly three years.

GPU Name: Diamond Multimedia AMD Radeon HD 5450 PCI Express GDDR3 1GB (DVI, HDMI, VGA) Low Profile Enhanced Heatsink Video Graphics Card (5450PE31G)
Customer Review Title: Utilize all the space on your big monitor
Customer Review: The key item for me with this card is the ability to use all the space on my 24" monitor. I'm not much of a gamer, so I can't really rate that. I used the hardware supplied to make the card low profile. It doesn't draw a lot of power and I was reluctant to add a card with its own fan so this works out nicely. Comparatively cheap too.

GPU Name: Diamond Multimedia AMD Radeon HD 5450 PCI Express GDDR3 1GB (DVI, HDMI, VGA) Low Profile Enhanced Heatsink Video Graphics Card (5450PE31G)
Customer Review: This card does not support Windows 10. This card does not support dual monitors (rear view shows two outputs for monitors). The max resolution on this card is 1280 x 1800 and will not go higher even though the monitor will support much higher. Recommend this card if you have no need of medium or higher vieo uses. Could be good for simple monitoring of processes.

Customer Review Title: Good video card once it's installed
Customer Review: I am running Windows 10. The package includes a note to get drivers from Radeon.com, so I got the latest driver package and installed it. I have two displays, one connected HDMI and one connected DVI. The display settings only recognized the HDMI display but duplicated on the DVI display. I ended up going to Diamond.com and getting the Radeon 5450 driver, which is only available for Windows 7. That package resolved my issue and now I have a sharp image on both displays. Changed the sound output to AMD HDMI output and that works.

GPU Name: EVGA 256-P2-N751-TR e-GeForce 8600 GT 256 MB PCI-Express Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Very great card, for a really great price.
Customer Review:
The seller was pretty awesome and got me this thing in like 3 days.

I bought this for gaming. I had a lot of games on Steam and such that I played on my old 6600GT. I then got a new PC and was stuck with onboard for a while. The card can run pretty much anything that's out right now, but for stuff like Crysis you might wanna run it at lower resolutions and with medium-high settings. It's obviously not an 8800GT but it gets the job more than done. No complaints. It got pretty hot the first day I used it but after that I didn't notice anything. *Knock on wood*

Monitor displays things with higher quality. Has PhysX support which is cool. I don't really know what else to say. It performs well enough. I ran Left 4 Dead at 60+ fps even with hoards at 1440x900, everything high except AA. If you just want a nice card but don't want to shell out the big bucks for a 295 GTX or something, I recommend this.

GPU Name: EVGA 256-P2-N751-TR e-GeForce 8600 GT 256 MB PCI-Express Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Works, but...a little hindsight to share
Customer Review: OK, this card works, and is worth about what you pay for it. However....I think I learned a lesson. Others have made similar comments, but I had to learn by doing. The lesson is this: Don't expect this card to make your single-core econo-model PC into a game/graphics demon. It will make your display smoother and make it possible to run some graphic-intensive games. In the process, it will push the power supply to the max, and you'll discover other bottlenecks such as disc and memory i/o. In retrospect, I'd have been better off to put the cash towards a higher-end PC.

GPU Name: EVGA 256-P2-N751-TR e-GeForce 8600 GT 256 MB PCI-Express Graphics Card
Customer Review: This little beast packs a punch. On my rig (3.0 Ghz AMD 64 X2 6000+, 3 GB of ram, Windows 7 Ultimate 32 bit) it works very well. Before, I was using integrated graphics and could not do anything related to video games. Now I can run most games on high settings and even new ones run well. Dragon Age Origins works very well on medium settings at full res for me 1440x900. The dual monitor feature is excellent too. Small quirp is that the card goes loud when on serious gaming sessions but that's to be expected.

GPU Name: EVGA 256-P2-N751-TR e-GeForce 8600 GT 256 MB PCI-Express Graphics Card
Customer Review: Worked perfectly!

GPU Name: EVGA 256-P2-N751-TR e-GeForce 8600 GT 256 MB PCI-Express Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: Nearing the $100 price point, it's a good option.
Customer Review: Let's start saying that this card is not speed demon, and it's widely known that when it came out, it wasn't a good choice because at its original price point, it was too far away performance-wise from the high end cards to be called a midrange card. But now at near $100 it is a good card to recommend to someone who wants a cheap card that can do some light gaming. It can certainly handle some past generation games on good resolutions. Just don't expect it to handle Crysis with all the bells and whistles. eVGA is generally very reliable, and with this card they're certainly keeping that trend, it just works flawlessly.

GPU Name: EVGA 256-P2-N751-TR e-GeForce 8600 GT 256 MB PCI-Express Graphics Card
Customer Review:
I don't actually own this card...yet *shakes fist*

I read the other two reviews and it kind of seemed silly that someone with an old computer buying a new series video card rated this card poorly because it didn't work for him. I've been using evga now for a while and I really like it. It's not top of the line, but it's certainly not at the end.

They haven't done me wrong....and I know what i'm talking about when it comes to computers.

GPU Name: EVGA 256-P2-N751-TR e-GeForce 8600 GT 256 MB PCI-Express Graphics Card
Customer Review: I just called EVGA and was able to confirm that they've really hid the ball on this one -- it's NOT HDCP enabled (and there's no way to find it out from their Web site, manuals or spec sheets). What this means is that any protected content (e.g., Blu-Ray, HD-DVD, Vista HD video, etc.) will not play through this card and you'll get a blank screen. It basically moots one of the core functionalities of this chipset, that it offloads H.264 video processing from the CPU onto the video card.

GPU Name: EVGA 256-P2-N751-TR e-GeForce 8600 GT 256 MB PCI-Express Graphics Card
Customer Review: I bought this card some time ago, and i cannot believe the performance improvement i have got, having only a computer worth $200 (Athlon 64 3400+, 1gig DDR ram, 450W PS,DVD+R burner,250Gig PATA hard drive) I was able to play Crysis, and Unreal Tournamnet at medium. Once i made a little upgrade (Athlon 5600+, 2 Gig DDR2, GA-MA78M-S2H)for about $200, i was able to play Crysis with all setting to medium and UT3 with all settings to High, i have made computers using the 8500 gt for my relatives and i know that there is no comparison with this video card.

All because of a packaging mistake I believe.

GPU Name: PNY Video Card Graphics Cards VCQK4200-PB
Customer Review Title: Solid GPU. Light weight, cool running under loads, stable!
Customer Review:
I built a video editing computer according to specs I read on a tech website. It called for both a Quadro K4000 GPU (not this K4200) and a GeForce GTX780. The idea was that the GeForce provided the superior rendering performance while the Quadro K4000 provided the stability and 10-bit processing for color adjustments and grading. The Quadro is the recommended board by Adobe for serious editing work.To be honest, I saw no difference whether the Quadro was installed or not, but it's impossible to tell what's really going on under the hood.

I became concerned because someone at PNY told me that they did not recommend nor support the two GPUs be installed in that configuration. I returned the K4000 because I could not justify the price tag for no discernible results.

Then, I decided to build another computer for a different purpose and at the time this Quadro K4200 was released. I must say that both the Quadro K4000 and the K4200 perform well. Unlike the GTX780, the Quadro is much smaller, lighter, and stays cooler under loads. Its size and weight helps because I'm building a portable system. And of course I prefer the 1 GB increase in VRAM over the K4000.

GPU Name: PNY Video Card Graphics Cards VCQK4200-PB
Customer Review: Great Graphics card.

GPU Name: PNY Video Card Graphics Cards VCQK4200-PB
Customer Review: Great price

GPU Name: PNY Video Card Graphics Cards VCQK4200-PB
Customer Review Title: I think it is a design flaw in the K4200 and would not recommend them to anyone that has long projects
Customer Review: This is the second Quadro K4200 that I've purchased. The first one I returned, this one I should return. They ran for a only two days under long load before they caused my PC to freeze. In other words, I tried two different cards in three different Dell work stations and after a day or so they freeze the computers after about 40 minutes of GPU run time. I would restart the computer and the system would freeze again 30 or 40 minutes later. I spoke to PNY and they have no explanation or suggestions as to why this happens. I think it is a design flaw in the K4200 and would not recommend them to anyone that has long projects. They just freeze the computer and once in a while cause errors on the hard drives. My drives are mirrored so just a bit of recovery time lost and of course the project. If your drives aren't mirrored, you may be down for some time. What good is a card that freezes your computer after 40 minutes? I have run a pair of K2200, K620, a GTX 980, and a GTX 960 in these systems on with the same work load for weeks without any problems. I monitor temperature and they were well within operating range. The GPU load was 50-60%. No obvious reason to fail. They just do not seem to run long. I am disappointed because while they are running, they do a good job and take they only one card slot.

GPU Name: PNY Video Card Graphics Cards VCQK4200-PB

GPU Name: PNY Video Card Graphics Cards VCQK4200-PB
Customer Review: The Quadro line of GPUs is very expensive as GPUs go so you would expect that they would work really well. The first k4200 that I purchased would run for about 30 minutes before freezing my work station. As long as I was not using the GPU, it would work fine. But, when ran the GPU circuits for 10-30 minutes, zap, black screen. I spent an hour on the phone to PNY trying to find out what is going on. Tried it in different work stations, T5500 and 2 different T3500s. Same problem. No ideas from PNY. So I returned it to Amazon. (Amazon return was great!) A few weeks later I decided to give another K4200 a try. It ran for 36 hours before freezing the work station just like the previous unit. I may send this new card back too.

GPU Name: PNY Video Card Graphics Cards VCQK4200-PB

GPU Name: PNY GeForce RTX 3090 24GB XLR8 Gaming Revel Epic-X RGB Triple Fan Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: PNY prima di lanciare un prodotto sul mercato di fascia alta qualche test fallo!!!
Customer Review:
La recensione negativa riguarda PNY e specificatamente la versione UPRISING della RTX 3090 che gode di un difetto, spero "temporaneo", ma non posso saperlo, che comunque non è accettabile (dopo varie ricerche in internet sembra che la versione REVEL non sia coinvolta nel difetto ma non avendo testato direttamente non posso confermarlo in prima persona).
Premessa, visto il prezzo pagato, mi aspetto tutto sia perfetto come minimo. Ma veniamo al test, appena montata scheda tutto va bene, RGB colorazione arcobaleno all'accensione, scarico il software dedicato per settare colorazione fissa in linea a tutti i componenti RGB del mio pc e magia... NON E' ANCORA OTTIMIZZATO IL SOFTWARE PER POTER REGOLARE RGB DI QUESTA SCHEDA!.
Scrivo all'assistenza PNY e dalla Francia mi rispondono che sono a conoscenza del problema e ci stanno lavorando per risolverlo senza avere una tempistica per la risoluzione.
Scusatemi ma una domanda me la pongo. Prima di lanciare un prodotto sul mercato qualcuno se l'era fatta la domanda su come controllare i led RGB?????
In soldoni avrei dovuto accettare di tenermela con colorazione arcobaleno continua oppure staccare cavo RGB per non avere illuminazione sulla scheda e non avere RGB accesi.
Se pago un prezzo premium per un prodotto di fascia enthusiast mi aspetto tutto sia perfetto e considerando ho un pc desktop di fascia alta in tutti i suoi componenti con case finestrato per godermi anche il lato estetico non accetto un compromesso del genere e mi stupisco di questa superficialità da un'azienda come PNY.
PNY mi spiace ma prima volta che ti compro ed anche ultima. Reso avviato. Grazie ad Amazon per la celere consegna ma spero la prossima RTX 3090 in arrivo, di altro brand ovviamente, non mi faccia scherzi.

GPU Name: PNY GeForce RTX 3090 24GB XLR8 Gaming Revel Epic-X RGB Triple Fan Graphics Card
Customer Review:
Top Karte! Die Preisschwankungen sind zur Zeit enorm. Ich habe ein sehr moderaten Preis hier bekommen. Die Karte ist sehr gut. Boostet bei erhöhter Lüfterdrehzal im richtigen Gehäuse dauerhaft auf 2 GHz bei 75°. Blendet man den Preis aus bekommt man hier eine Grafikkarte mit enorm viel Videospeicher. DLSS und RTX sind für uns Spieler eine interessante positive Weiterentwicklung. AMD macht mit seinen neuen Grafikkarten einen tollen Job und es wird spannend in der Zukunft. Im Moment ist die Verfügbarkeit und der Preisaufschlag extrem. Wer trotzdem das Glück hat
Preise nahe des OVP zu bekommen und mit zeitnaher Lieferung, wird denke ich zufrieden sein. Der Enthusiasmus Aufschlag ist enorm dafür bekommt man allerdings eine Grafikkarte mit 24GB. Die Beleuchtung ist vorgegeben da ich aber ein geschlossenes Gehäuse habe ohne Sichtfenster, waren mir die Beleuchtungsoptionen egal. Letztendlich muss das natürlich jeder selber entscheiden. Ich bin soweit zufrieden damit.

GPU Name: PNY GeForce RTX 3090 24GB XLR8 Gaming Revel Epic-X RGB Triple Fan Graphics Card
Customer Review Title: scheda grafica top ma non le poste
Customer Review:
Come da titolo la scheda grafica in questione è una top di gamma ,stiamo parlando di una 3090 ,inserita subito nel mio pc (i9 9900k ,32 gb 3466 mhz cas 16 ,z390 aorus pro ,1 tb 970 evo plus ),che dire si sono visti subito i miglioramenti di prestazioni ,per ora l'ho provata con ungine heaven benchmark ,dove la mia precedente 2080ti faticava a mantenere i 60 fps in 4k 8x anti aliasing dettagli alti ecc ora mantengo agevolmente i 60 fps e anche oltre .aggiorno : l'ho provata anche con ac valhalla nel benchmark integrato e con tutto praticamente al massimo in 4k mantiene agevolmente i 60 fps quasi sempre ,do 4 stelle perchè purtroppo questa versione di 3090 pny
uprising rispetto alla revel non ha staffa di sostegno per la scheda e gli rgb per ora non sono regolabili via software ,speriamo in un aggiornamento futuro del programma velocity x .ora però passiamo alla parte spedizione ,come da titolo le poste italiane si confermano sempre più inefficienti e vergognosi ,pacco spedito l'1 dicembre è arrivato ieri ,in più come segnalato anche da un'altro utente la scatola della scheda stessa aveva segni di apertura con l'adesivo esterno mezzo tolto e rimesso a posto in più con vari segni di usura nella scatola .ringrazio ancora amazon per avermi aiutato con la spedizione ,come sempre i migliori per l'assistenza al cliente ,speriamo solo che si convincano a troncare i rapporti con le poste italiane perchè a mio modesto parere cosi si limita il valore e il potenziale di questo sito,articoli di questa importanza e prezzo non dovrebbero mai essere affidati alle poste data la loro completa inefficienza per non dire peggio.

GPU Name: EVGA GeForce GTX 1080 Ti Gaming 11GB GDDR5X iCX Technology - 9 Thermal Sensors & RGB LED G/P/M Graphic Cards (11G-P4-6591-KR) (Renewed)
Customer Review Title: Support was awesome, but as refurbs go I had to RMA it
Customer Review:
The 1080 ti is a wildly popular graphics card and I wanted to save a little money picking one up so I went with this refurbished card. I think I was a bit unlucky with the card I received as it would work extremely well for a bit and then reboot itself more or less. To be fair, I did have software issues first, but I resolved them over time and then tried another brand new card to test out the rest of my system and that worked great. When these cards work, they're fantastic.

The support team from this re-seller was fantastic... they had great advice, all of which I had to go through just to clear the software trouble, and they fully refunded the purchase and offered to send another card. Can't say enough good things about how easy that was... I felt no risk at any time in making a pretty big purchase.

GPU Name: EVGA GeForce GTX 1080 Ti Gaming 11GB GDDR5X iCX Technology - 9 Thermal Sensors & RGB LED G/P/M Graphic Cards (11G-P4-6591-KR) (Renewed)
Customer Review: I was a bit nervous about buying a refurbished graphics card, but thought it was less of a risk than buying a 2080 Ti, considering the issues they've been having. The box the 1080 Ti came in was in perfect condition and the card itself looked brand new. I've been using this card for almost a month now and have had zero issues with it. I'm able to max out the graphics settings for Resident Evil 2 (and every other game I've tried) with zero issues. Until the issues with the 2080 series graphics cards are fixed, I'll be more than happy sticking with the 1080 Ti.

GPU Name: EVGA GeForce GTX 1080 Ti Gaming 11GB GDDR5X iCX Technology - 9 Thermal Sensors & RGB LED G/P/M Graphic Cards (11G-P4-6591-KR) (Renewed)
Customer Review Title: Great alternative to the RTX cards
Customer Review:
Awesome video card. It does not have RTX but who care really, when you can play most modern games at 1080p in ultra detail, or in 4K at high or ultra.

It does heat up quite a lot, and noise level is pretty considerable, but overall it is still bearable if your case is a good case with decent insulation and good exhaust fans.

Not a single game is dropping below 60 fps in 4K, and with some games I get more than 100 fps on average; no stuttering, no issues whatsoever.

Save some money and get the previous gen; RTX is still new technology that is barely used in games, and in some new games like control, turning RTX on does drop about 10 frames per second, so there is still a lot to do to get real time rendering in games. In the meantime, this card will serve you well.

GPU Name: EVGA GeForce GTX 1080 Ti Gaming 11GB GDDR5X iCX Technology - 9 Thermal Sensors & RGB LED G/P/M Graphic Cards (11G-P4-6591-KR) (Renewed)
Customer Review:
The 1080Ti of course is a monster of a video card and, performance wise, it functioned with ease. It also looked great in my system.
However, I immediately heard a noise when the fans kicked on. I tried to duplicate it off of the computer with no luck but I did notice, when mounted, the power wire to the fan would hang just enough for the blades to rub against it.
The bitter outweighed the sweet on this one. For as much as this card costs, it shouldn't make much noise if any at all since there are no bearings in the fans. The photos show the blades wearing through the insulation of the wire and the blades themselves being blasted down. Eventually leading to overheating or possibly a fire.
This little problem slipped by QA. Now I've been waiting a few days for the return to process, after it's been delivered. This I can't completely hold fault to them due to Covid.
I can imagine this must've been just a slip up, but noteworthy nonetheless.

GPU Name: EVGA GeForce GTX 1080 Ti Gaming 11GB GDDR5X iCX Technology - 9 Thermal Sensors & RGB LED G/P/M Graphic Cards (11G-P4-6591-KR) (Renewed)
Customer Review Title: from EVGA but with MSI plugs? amazons customer service ftw
Customer Review:
Noticed that the HDMI cover said MSI... I went ahead and plugged it in and didn't have an issue until I plugged in a second monitor. Once I plugged in the second monitor the whole screen had a blue hue/tint... after trouble shooting we discovered that the actual HDMI port is bad.

Amazon offered to return the card but also said I could try going through the manufactures warranty to see if they could fix it as it should be under warranty. I'm going to try to go through EVGA's warranty before I return but over all satisfied with the product and amazons return policy.

GPU Name: EVGA GeForce GTX 1080 Ti Gaming 11GB GDDR5X iCX Technology - 9 Thermal Sensors & RGB LED G/P/M Graphic Cards (11G-P4-6591-KR) (Renewed)
Customer Review Title: Used well, not refurbished! But not a bad deal!
Customer Review: I got this card and inspected it to find dirty dust trapped in certain areas. Blew the whole card out with my air compressor and decided to try it out. 56-59C on idle and I was not happy! Gamed on it a little and watched the temp throttle the speed! So i swapped out the "great" stock cooler with an ARCTIC Accelero Xtreme IV. Now I get 36-39C on idle. Have not gamed on it yet. But do yourself a favor and get a different cooler for this card so it runs cooler and lasts longer!

GPU Name: NVIDIA NVS 310 by PNY 512MB DDR3 PCI Express Gen 2 x16 DisplayPort 1.2 Multi-Display Professional Graphics Board, VCNVS310DP-PB
Customer Review Title: Great Card - Driving 2 DisplayPort Monitors to 2560x1400 each
Customer Review: I am really impressed by this little card. I am using it in a Mini-ATX box (Shuttle) and I did have a regular video card so I could drive a 27" monitor to 2560x1400 using DisplayPort. I acquired a second 27" monitor and needed a card that could drive 2 monitors using DisplayPort and after a search, found this little and light video card. I am used to gaming video cards that consume 500 watts and have huge fans/coolers. Well, this little card sits there quietly and gives me full resolution on two x 2760x1400 DisplayPort monitors. It is not for gaming but does a great job with productivity apps - Office, Explorer, Chrome, YouTube. It was a very economical solution to a problem - how to drive two DisplayPort monitors. If you have this problem, try this video card. It installed easily and without drama.

GPU Name: NVIDIA NVS 310 by PNY 512MB DDR3 PCI Express Gen 2 x16 DisplayPort 1.2 Multi-Display Professional Graphics Board, VCNVS310DP-PB
Customer Review Title: Great card for general use dual monitor high resolution without upgrading power supply
Customer Review: I have two Samsung 32" WQHD LED Monitor (S32D850T) that I bought through Amazon. They have every possible video hookup that is out there I think, but the video card in my computer didn't have two hookups that would allow me to have the optimum 2560 x 1440 resolution that I needed. There are lots of cards out there that support two monitors at that resolution but they require a higher wattage power supply than I had in my computer. This card requires very little power so worked perfect for me. I don't think this card is made for gaming but if you want one for general use that doesn't require the purchase of an upgraded power supply this one works great. It does take a bit of work to get it going. You have to download the driver if it is Windows 8 or higher and I had to mess around and do some re-booting to get it to work.

GPU Name: NVIDIA NVS 310 by PNY 512MB DDR3 PCI Express Gen 2 x16 DisplayPort 1.2 Multi-Display Professional Graphics Board, VCNVS310DP-PB
Customer Review:
This video card supports two monitors well and the drivers are easy to come by. The only issue I have is that it doesn't come with the plate for small form factor computers. On the other hand, they don't advertise it as having one, either, so that's on me for not checking. If you need to fit this in the short slots, you might want to keep looking.

Myself, I'm not afraid to get creative when I need it now. I took tin snips to the one that came with it and made it shorter, then folded it and used a drill and rat tail file to make it fit. Just make sure you remove it from the card itself before you do something like that to avoid damage. Worked just fine after I tweaked it to fit.

GPU Name: NVIDIA NVS 310 by PNY 512MB DDR3 PCI Express Gen 2 x16 DisplayPort 1.2 Multi-Display Professional Graphics Board, VCNVS310DP-PB
Customer Review Title: Perfect for two monitors (1024x768) with inexpensive DP to HDMI cables
Customer Review:
I bought this to replace an nVidia GeForce card that I was running for two monitors. That card had one HDMI, one DVI, and one VGA. The HDMI worked great but the DVI monitor would sometimes turn off and on, and most of the time had blue lines flickering in the screen. I had heard that DVI and VGA were comparable in that they drew power from the computer, or something like that. I wanted a card with two HDMI ports and that's how I ran across this card.
When I bought this one I thought it was two HMDI. When I realized it was two Display Ports, I bought two inexpensive DP to HDMI cables. (These are one-way cables from the card to the monitors.) I installed the card, plugged in my new cables, and got it set up.
I'm not a gamer--I just love working with two displays--and I love this new card. Perfect display (1024x768). Clean, no flickering, no funky lines. I wish I would have bought this card first. No need for anything better.

GPU Name: NVIDIA NVS 310 by PNY 512MB DDR3 PCI Express Gen 2 x16 DisplayPort 1.2 Multi-Display Professional Graphics Board, VCNVS310DP-PB
Customer Review Title: Not Plug and Play By Any Means
Customer Review: This is not the fault of the seller. This is the fault of NvIdea. The card has 2 DVI ports. Not 2 HDMI ports. I had to go and buy 2 DVI to HDMI adapters. Once I installed the card, plugged in all the wires, installed the software that came with it and it still didn't work. Only one monitor worked and that one was like letter box format. I had to go to NvIDEA to download and install the latest drivers (from 2020) and it finally worked. I would think a company as big as NvIDEA would keep the drivers on supplied software up to date. I contacted the seller with the issue and he called me back within 30 minutes but I got it working by that point.

GPU Name: NVIDIA NVS 310 by PNY 512MB DDR3 PCI Express Gen 2 x16 DisplayPort 1.2 Multi-Display Professional Graphics Board, VCNVS310DP-PB
Customer Review Title: Works as advertised, HP z220 now does 4x displays
Customer Review:
I use a HP z220 workstation that comes with Intel 4000 integrated graphics providing 1xdisplayPort + 1x DVI but I had spare screens hanging around and wanted to try a 4-monitor setup. According to [...] the NVS 310 is the way to go.

I use windows server 2008R2 which is basically Windows 7 compatible, so I gave it a go:

I installed this guy and then needed to:
1. alter BIOS to re-enable integrated graphics
2. install Nvidia Graphics Driver 311.44. (It took a couple of driver downloads and a bit of fiddling. in the end, completely uninstalling all NVidia drivers, then doing a custom-install with 311.44 and deselecting everything but the core driver was the way to go).
3. windows screen management then worked fine.

I'm now a happy camper with 4 screens (3xdisplay port + 1xDVI). No idea about its graphics performance, but for coding etc it does exactly what I wanted.

GPU Name: NVIDIA NVS 310 by PNY 512MB DDR3 PCI Express Gen 2 x16 DisplayPort 1.2 Multi-Display Professional Graphics Board, VCNVS310DP-PB
Customer Review: Works great driving a pair of Dell Monitors with the 2 Display Port outputs. After I installed the drivers, the 2 monitors came up, number 1 monitor connected to output port1 and 2 to 2. First time this has ever happened to me. Also both monitors came up and everything was setup on the first boot. May not be a "gaming" card but for my use its fantastic!

GPU Name: NVIDIA NVS 310 by PNY 512MB DDR3 PCI Express Gen 2 x16 DisplayPort 1.2 Multi-Display Professional Graphics Board, VCNVS310DP-PB
Customer Review Title: great price, easy install, looks great, excellent support!
Customer Review: Needed to run 2 HDMI monitors which most cards don't support, especially at this price. Was a bit set back when i found it was DP and not HDMI as i was unfamiliar with DP. Called direct number for support - no waiting - and found i needed 2 adapter cables ($16) to connect the monitors. Great support, easy install. Monitors looks awesome and i didn't have to mess with sizing as when you have 1 HDMI and 1 something else. Now the PC is ready for next generation of monitors if i keep the PC for a while. Highly recommend!

GPU Name: NVIDIA NVS 310 by PNY 512MB DDR3 PCI Express Gen 2 x16 DisplayPort 1.2 Multi-Display Professional Graphics Board, VCNVS310DP-PB
Customer Review Title: Excellent upgrade for low-profile business systems needing two digital monitors.
Customer Review:
Take the load off of your business computer's processor and memory, double your screen space, while also making it easily adaptable to any two digital displays. This works with and recognizes displays correctly with any DisplayPort to Display-Port, HDMI, and DVI passive digital cable.

If you have low-profile machines, you work in IT, your clients just use business apps, and they need more screen - THIS IS THE RIGHT CARD AT THE RIGHT PRICE.

GPU Name: NVIDIA NVS 310 by PNY 512MB DDR3 PCI Express Gen 2 x16 DisplayPort 1.2 Multi-Display Professional Graphics Board, VCNVS310DP-PB
Customer Review:
Just a heads up, if you purchase this card and have installed the latest version of Windows 10 update, version 2004, nVidia does not have drivers for this version of Windows. You'll have to use standard Windows drivers.

Also, the card HDMI ports are DisplayPort, not the universal type you would find on computer displays and smart tv's. You'll need to purchase DisplayPort to DisplayPort HD display cable if your monitor supports that. Otherwise you need to purchase the DisplayPort to "standard" HDMI cable. Both types are listed as additional items you can purchase on this page.

GPU Name: NVIDIA NVS 310 by PNY 512MB DDR3 PCI Express Gen 2 x16 DisplayPort 1.2 Multi-Display Professional Graphics Board, VCNVS310DP-PB
Customer Review Title: Ken's Computer Shop has Great support
Customer Review: I originally ordered this part and when I received it was missing the half height bracket. Ken's computer responded to my concerns the same day and shipped the missing bracket right away. I really appreciated their speedy response to my concern. I will be installing it for one of my customers next week and hopefully it will resolve the problem created by Dell. This will be installed in a Dell OptiPlex 3040 which had 1 display port and one HDMI port for video. The two monitors they sent had only 1 display port and 1 VGA port. Dell's resolution was to send a HDMI to VGA adapter which has a pretty poor picture. This Video card will set both monitors to Display port and they will hopefully match in quality of picture. Thank you Dan for all your help with this issue. If this adapter works properly, I will probably need some additional adapters and Ken's Computer will be my vendor of choice.

Customer Review: Read the description carefully. Its a display port video card with no cables or DVI adapters. There is a similar NVS 310 sold with DVI adapters, if that's what you need. Otherwise, this is a quality video card for business applications.

GPU Name: NVIDIA NVS 310 by PNY 512MB DDR3 PCI Express Gen 2 x16 DisplayPort 1.2 Multi-Display Professional Graphics Board, VCNVS310DP-PB
Customer Review Title: LIKE NEW? LOL YEAH NOT EVEN
Customer Review:
I purchased a LIKE NEW one that came in a brown box....

It did not come with the full height adaptor as pictured that it came with both.. The half adaptor that came on it was bent badly... And the fan on the card itself had dust packed in it like it had been in a pc for QUITE SOME TIME.

If it works whatever.. But is is NOT LIKE NEW and should NOT OF BEEN marketed as such. At least blow the dust out of the fan and straighten it out GOOD LORD.

GPU Name: NVIDIA NVS 310 by PNY 512MB DDR3 PCI Express Gen 2 x16 DisplayPort 1.2 Multi-Display Professional Graphics Board, VCNVS310DP-PB
Customer Review: It works but the bracket does not fit the mounting slot on the case.

GPU Name: NVIDIA NVS 310 by PNY 512MB DDR3 PCI Express Gen 2 x16 DisplayPort 1.2 Multi-Display Professional Graphics Board, VCNVS310DP-PB
Customer Review Title: Disappointed by the limitations of only 2 screens maximum.
Customer Review: Not really happy with this purchase. I was under the impression I could have 3 screens on this card using Displayport 1.2 technology to daisychain a 3rd screen. Turns out that you can do that, but the GPU only supports 2 screens maximum. So this purchase was basically a complete waste of money. Unfortunate that they don't make the maximum number of displays clearer in the description of this product. I should have done more due diligence before purchasing this card so I gave it 2 stars as this is partially my fault.

GPU Name: NVIDIA NVS 310 by PNY 512MB DDR3 PCI Express Gen 2 x16 DisplayPort 1.2 Multi-Display Professional Graphics Board, VCNVS310DP-PB
Customer Review Title: Definitely does not work with Linux
Customer Review: Its supposed to work with Linux. It doesn't. The drivers that NVidia provides apparently have a bug that leads to image corruption and instability. The open source drivers don't work very well either. Had to go through a lot of hoops to first install and then uninstall this device and its drivers. Overall, I wasted four hours.

GPU Name: NVIDIA NVS 310 by PNY 512MB DDR3 PCI Express Gen 2 x16 DisplayPort 1.2 Multi-Display Professional Graphics Board, VCNVS310DP-PB
Customer Review Title: the stakes are what I was expecting
Customer Review: Works great with 3-monitors and text traffic.

GPU Name: NVIDIA NVS 310 by PNY 512MB DDR3 PCI Express Gen 2 x16 DisplayPort 1.2 Multi-Display Professional Graphics Board, VCNVS310DP-PB
Customer Review Title: Worst card for the money EVER.
Customer Review: I have been using this card for a little over a month now, it came with a computer that my office purchased. I use the computer for 3D Modeling and rendering and after having a lot of difficulty with the speed and overall stability of the card I did some research. This card benchmarks roughly 3% of some other cards in the same price range. When I try to render something with any amount of complexity the card cannot handle it and repeatedly shuts off the monitor as it crashes over and over as it tries to complete the task. All of this leads to just a black block the same size as the rendering. I would recommend about 40 other graphics cards before this one.

GPU Name: NVIDIA NVS 310 by PNY 512MB DDR3 PCI Express Gen 2 x16 DisplayPort 1.2 Multi-Display Professional Graphics Board, VCNVS310DP-PB
Customer Review: After three years of use, fan has become unacceptably loud.

GPU Name: NVIDIA NVS 310 by PNY 512MB DDR3 PCI Express Gen 2 x16 DisplayPort 1.2 Multi-Display Professional Graphics Board, VCNVS310DP-PB
Customer Review Title: Quick and Easy to Install Performs Adequately for Non Gaming Tasks.
Customer Review: I needed an inexpensive display adapter for the old PC that I keep out in my workshop. I have a really nice BenQ 27 inch monitor that for whatever reason would not scale the display correctly when using the existing display adapter set at 1920X1080. With this new card using the Displayport connection it works great. I received it and just had Windows 10 download the drivers. Perfect for a machine like this that is used for internet browsing, playing Youtube videos etc. A snap to install too.
